I purchased two of these. One for myself and one for my boyfriend. His only lasted two weeks. They are made of very cheap plastic and the ear piece broke right off during light use. Both of ours have had recurring mic issues related to compatibility issues with Windows 11. The mic randomly gets super boosted and activates even when there is no speaking going on. It is extremely loud and painful to anyone listening to the conversation. We found two ways of resolving this. One was to download their update platform and force an update even if there is none. This took a lot of time and only resolves the issue for a few hours. The other solution was to simply unplug the USB and plug it back in, but this only ever worked half the time and also only resolved the issue for a few hours.THIS THING IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY! Technical issues aside, the sound quality is not that great. I ended up replacing his with a cheap $30 headset that works far better and has no issues whatsoever. Steer clear of this abomination!

Purchased this to replace my gen 1 Astro A50 that I've used for years and the batteries have recently finally stopped working. The headband is larger which is why I bought this. However, there is always connection issues or glitches with this. When I take it off the charging dock and hold down the power button. It'll either say: "Headset connection", "Headset Disconnected", "Headset powered on", or a combination of these. Sometimes It'll connect on the first try but most of the time, it'll require me to hold down the button twice to try and turn it on. There's also been a few times that it wouldn't connect and I then realize that the dongle is flashing red. At which point I would have to take out then plug back in the dongle.Recently, the microphone has also been having issues with audio detection or for some reason the people that I talk to could barely hear me.I never had these issues with my Astros but their new A50X headband are smaller than the original so I can't go back to those...I do not expect these issues with a headset that is this expensive.-----Update:The microphone has now started to sound like I'm talking from the other side of the room. I can't tell if this is a lemon or if it's the normal quality of this headset.

I've bought this 360 as a backup to my original I've owned for the better part of 15 years, especially in light of the looming shutdown of XBLA. On the outside the console looks excellently maintained and well kept, however booting up the console the system loads into the OS version from 2011. This on the surface was not an issue, however the system would not update from the internet nor accept either of my XBL accounts for console or PC. This is not an unheard of issue and so I burned the updates from 2019 onto a disc and copied them onto a hard drive if the former did not work. The console would begin the updates from the flash drive only to still give the same response as downloading from the internet. After perusing forums and trying multiple ways for two days after work, the general support issue I've found is that this is a common problem with improperly formatted or set up replacement parts. I may not be able to confirm this due to me not wanting to damage the console but the system cannot even play Dragon Age Origins or create a new profile without demanding an update that crashes it or forces you back to the dashboard. This is not a 360 Slim issue, as my other 360 is an identical model save for some stickers and minor finish blemishes from more than a decade of taking the console to friend's houses. Moreover it also started effectively with the same version of the OS. If you want an Xbox 360 I'd implore you to look for one at your local video game store which unless I can repair this one is likely where I'll be trading it for a working one, unfortunately.

I have ordered 3 of these. The first one I ordered looked in very good condition, and worked well but stopped working after about a month, and due to a problem with my Amazon account I can no longer access it to make a return (have to use husband's account now). I then ordered 2 more, and when they came I realized that my 1st order hadn't even been the correct item! Only 1 of the 3 was actually a 2nd gen!!! These last 2 came in pretty bad physical condition. I bought it renewed in excellent condition, which should be close to new looking. Faaaaaar from it! I'm keeping the one that is actually the correct product, because (so far) it's working correctly. I'm putting a case over it, so the scratches all over won't be a big deal. What IS a big deal is the other one that came. Not only was it not a 2nd generation, as ordered, and it was extremely worn and scratched all over (even the keys had heavy wear) but it is even CRACKED on one corner, and the glass screen is popping out on that corner, too! This company is doing a terrible job, and I'm returning the worst of the last 2 as soon as I can. I'm hesitant to ask for a replacement because who knows what I'll receive this time. My expectations aren't as high as most. All I wanted was for them to be the correct item, not look like they've been thrown on concrete over and over, and work properly. Sadly, they can't even live up to this, despite selling these claiming they've been renewed to excellent.

I purchased a refurbished Thinkpad T480 from Microbeeglobal on Amazon, but unfortunately, the device was faulty and stopped working after only a few months of real use (less than 6 months). The charging port + Thunderbolt port were both dead (buying a new one plus motherboard soldering is not a DIY fix). I would not recommend buying from this seller, as my experience was less than satisfactory. Upon receiving my device, it looked clean with no scratches, but some parts and folds had dust. The internal (main) battery was not reliable since day one, but the extended one worked fine (48WH one). When I contacted the support team, they confirmed that it was a motherboard issue and that it was hard to fix by myself. I am past Amazon’s 90-day return window, and the seller’s support team suggested returning or replacing the device but stopped answering afterwards. Although the support team was friendly, it was difficult to get my message through, and some of the emails had Chinese words. I later found out that the team works from UAE

This is my third yoga 11e. All three are refurbished. So, the minor scratches and blemishes are understood. Here are the things that I have issues with on this last Yoga 11e1. It states Windows 10, but it has Windows 11. Usually, I would say this would be a plus. But the Yoga 11e doesn't have the possessor or RAM to have Windows 11. The system is so slow, and the response hurts when trying to open an app or even start up.2. Sound card - 5 minutes into the start of me using this laptop/tablet, the sound goes wonky and is in slow motion sound and sounds like a robot. It's not acceptable for out of the box.3. The hinge and mismatch screws. Ok, I know this is wear and tear. But Amazon has this in excellent condition. These items should have been replaced.4. There is no tablet mode. I'm unsure if this is a Win11 thing, but you have a tablet mode on the Action Center. I use this laptop/tablet to watch streams, so I turned the keyboard over so it would stand up to watch.4.5 Well, it kind of goes with the above. When you have it in the inverted position, the keyboard is still active, and keys are being pushed. I can’t type anything without holding the machine up.Things I enjoy1. Cheap2. Is a laptop and tablet3. Touch screen4. It does the job for what I need it to do.Yes, I'm returning this. I hope to resolve the issues above with the next one. Wish me luck. I hope this helps you. Thanks for reading.

***Update: I amended this review from three stars to one star, because a couple of weeks after I posted this initial review, my computer simply stopped working. It will turn on, but I get a plain black screen. With all the other issues I was having, I simply decided this was not worth the hassle and returned it. I will also note that I didn't mention it in my initial review, but this whole process also included another purchase of the same item that was for some reason flagged as undeliverable during shipping, so I never received that one. It's just become a massive headache that's already worth more than $80 in my time and energy, so I opted to simply return the computer.The return process was easy at least, but I will not be buying refurbished electronics on Amazon again.I'm leaving my original review below for posterity.***I bought this computer advertised in "like new" condition for around $75. I wasn't expecting miracles, but there are a couple things I have an issue with enough to give a 3 star review. They're not a big enough deal to request a refund (again, $75 computer here...I feel like going through the process of requesting a return/replacement is more of hassle), but not great. If this had been advertised for its actual condition, I still might have bought it, but I'd be giving it a much better rating.Biggest one is that in my "like new" computer, the track pad is wonky. It sometimes catches clicked down in a way I can feel if I click too far to the bottom left, and I have yet to be able to successfully highlight anything because the drag is weird. Neither of these are a huge deal for the way I plan to use this computer (especially because the touch screen does work fine so worst case I just highlight by touch), but it's less than I expected based on the listing.The other is that my computer arrived dirty, which I wasn't surprised by as other reviewers have mentioned it, but it was kind of disappointing. I don't think it was anything particularly gross, but there was a goopy smear on one of the device's silver-colored hinges that was rather off-putting, along with a spray of dried droplets on the screen. Probably just grease or oil and the residue of cleaner, but let's just say I cleaned the whole thing thoroughly before I used it.Overall, though, I just needed a really cheap computer to get me through a couple weeks, and this fits the bill. It runs fine other than the trackpad issue, comes with a decent charger, set up easily, all that good stuff. Just, you know, be aware that you're definitely getting what you're paying for!
When I opened up the Chromebook, a small piece of glass lodged in my thumb. All of the damage to the screen occurred before it was shipped.

When it arrived, I thought by the paperwork provided and reviews that the laptop would be in great condition working. I wasn’t using it so much in the first month or so after receiving it, but once I wanted to start using it for work and school, I noticed the battery would not stay charged for longer than 5–10 minutes unless constantly plugged into the charger. Some applications were also lagging when I tried operating. I waited some time but then when the problem became really persistent especially since I needed to use a laptop on daily basis for my job and school, I started a request for the seller to help me with the issue. I get a response that it is over the 90 day refund/replacement time frame (it was 5 days over when I put the request in) and that basically they can’t help me. I started contacting Amazon and multiple representatives started an A-Z claim, even though it was past the 90 days, I was told that I would be helped with the issue since the seller was not responsive. After a month of calling customer service, and being told that they understand my frustration and my issue would be fixed (I would get a return/refund), I’m now being told that Amazon can’t help me either. I am still currently trying to get my issue resolved with Amazon, but I would save your time and money and not buy from this seller. Almost $400 down the drain for a laptop that doesn’t function how a refurbished laptop should (I didn’t even get to talking about the cosmetic damages sticker cover up). I would strongly recommend saving up for a brand new laptop somewhere else if you are able to, because this will cause you issues (not far) down the line.

Like a previous review says, very bad wifi issues, constantly drops connection, especially if connected to 5ghz. At 2.4ghz connection you will get 1 mbps if you are lucky. Tried everything in terms of troubleshooting so it is definitely a hardware defect.

The right hinge on our Lenovo started pulling up on the casing, which in a matter of weeks led to the screen breaking completely. All of this was bad, but since it happened after we'd only had it for six months, we should still be good, right? The Lenovo manufacture warranty covers hardware failure and defects during the first year, so surely this would count?After more than an hour on the phone with Lenovo tech support, unfortunately, the answer was essentially, "nah, we're good, take care of it yourself." Why, you might ask, would a manufacturer warranty not cover an issue with the hinge of the laptop destroying the laptop, after only extremely light use? The guy on the phone told me, "Hardware doesn't count the outside of the laptop. We mean hardware like the motherboard. Only the INSIDE of the laptop is covered."So, buyer beware. Personally I'll never buy another Lenovo product again. And I'll certainly never waste any time thinking their manufactures warranty is worth a damn.
Purchased for daughter - who is a grad student - to replace a 5-year-old laptop that lived a good life. Dead out of the box, spent an hour on the phone with Lenovo tech support.

I had a terrible experience with this product. The charging port is defective, and the laptop won't charge at all. It's incredibly frustrating to receive such a faulty item. Why would you send out defective products, wasting customers' time? I expected better quality and reliability.

Several show stoppers here...On the Amazon description page, the product manufacture date was listed as 2023. When received, the DELL manufacture date stamped on the laptop is 2017. Shipping was slow but packaging was good. Just laptop and power supply in box in bubble wrap. Aside from manufacture date, laptop specs were as advertised, HOWEVER the show stopper are; The internal battery is completely dead and will not hold a charge. The DELL diagnostics show that a test run in 2022 warned of a insufficient powered battery. My tests show the batter completely dead and the BIOS doesn't even recognize it. Also, the USB-C port with which I intended to connect to my DELL docking station was also dead. The docking station works perfectly with my 2-year old Dell Latitude. When plugged-in via the USB-C port, the laptop speakers squeal and the system locks up. I've sent an email through Amazon marketplace, an email directly to the company, and an email through their website customer assistance page. No answer.
System is not good as much as I expected.Hanging and feeling lagging

Keyboard is flimsy and falling apart already. SLOW after required updates. Backlight on keyboard and speakers no longer work unless plugged in. USB port just died. Barely had 4 months and ready to scrap. Save yourself the trouble, there's a reason it's the cheapest in the category....Pros: responsive touch screen, backlit keyboard, lightweight, portable, excellent battery life, inexpensive.Cons: not as quick as it could be (but for the price plenty fast), screen glare in light, top shell is aluminum but bottom shell is plastic. The model is from 2021, the one I got was manufactured May 2021.I primarily use this for travel and laying in bed, for those purposes it works great. Don't expect this to hold up to a more powerful laptop, but for browsing or for things like Netflix and YouTube, it's great.

It completly ceased working and would no longer turn on after the first week. The Laptop top covering had a bubble after I opened & noticed this after recieving, then began to completly peel off more with everyday. I was excited by the price and thought thst I would be okay if this lasted less then 1 year but this wasn't the case and like I said lasted no longer then a full 5 days. WHAT A JOKE! One thing that I did not understand was that this type of computer holds not a lot of data. It is not the best for streaming, playing games, apps or storing old photos. It's for the easy stuff, maybe to do homework and some research. Just keep that in mind before you consider purchasing or products like this. Because I used it gently and it feel apart, PLUS BROKE DOWN 5 days after recieving, I DO NOT RECCOMEND TO ANYONE to purchase. PLEASE $AVE YOUR Ca$h for a better product. ***And most importantly Do Your Research AND READ THE REVIEWS!!***NOT HAPPY!

The media could not be loaded. There are two models of this Chromebook - one with IPS display and one with TF display. Unfortunately, Amazon didn't mention this fact in product description. I bought the laptop without knowing that there are two models. I got the TF display version. The colour and viewing angles are at level of cheap displays from 20 years ago! Very disappointing.
I haven’t been able to fix it but right now is useless
So far, just opened up and right away tried the touchscreen. Product specs said it was. It is not. Debating on returning after minutes or of the box.

I ordered one and the entire two bottom rows of keys stuck, would click like there was sand under the keyboard, or wouldn’t pop back up so my sentence looked like this“Mmmmmmmmy nnnnew laptop Is unnnnnnnnusabbble”So I reached out to Amazon support who processed a replacement. Unfortunately the replacement was also unusable because the charging port would not hold the charger in it. So unless I wanted to sit there and hold the charger for 2 hours to charge it I had to return that one too. So I reached out to support again and processed that return.I ordered a third one hoping the third time would be the charm but alas, it was not. This one has a battery life of about 18 minutes from full charge until it’s dead. I understand these are refurbished but I have some major concerns about quality control at this point as it doesn’t seem like random bad luck that I’d get 3 laptops with major problems.Also adding that these are listed in excellent condition however there are also significant cosmetic issues as well. Scratches, deep dents, bent corners. Not something I’d look at and say “yeah this is in excellent condition”. I hope the seller takes more care in refurbishing these in the future because it feels like they are just out here taking in a computer, restoring it to factory settings and listing it for sale. No way they could do even a cursory check of these and not notice 20 sticky keys or the inability to charge a computer.This process has taken me about 3 weeks from placing my first order and has been a headache all around. I wouldn’t recommend these unless you are fully aware that you’ll need to dedicate time and money to making the computer you receive able to be used.

The battery needed servicing. Had to have it plugged in or would shut off after 30min. When removing my information, restoring to factory settings, a folder with big question mark showed up. Talked with apple support who was unable to restore it to factory settings. Apple support booked me with a certified apple repair place (London Drugs) and they told me there is a problem with the hard drive too! I would not recommend this apple refurbished seller. I love apple products but sadly would not buy from this seller again. Faulty product the was supposed to be checked and in good/excellent condition. This was in poor condition.

The listing said excellent condition but the laptop I received was bent in every corner. Looks like someone who didn’t know what they were doing tried to refurbish it. I asked for a replacement and that one was broken and cracked. I know it’s used but this is very low quality all around and I’ll never buy electronic equipment here again. Can’t be trusted.

I'm not a newbie, but this was too good to be true. A decent Chromebook at 10% off. Well, it worked for a week, now nothing. Dead. As in dead. Brick. I'm being offered a refund (instant Amazon credit, up to 2 weeks to original payment method....seriously? 2 weeks? It's 2024). My suggestion would be to avoid the headaches, and time wasted (Amazon suport, Lenovo support, troubleshooting, lost productivity) by finding a different brand. Don't be tempted by the price. This brand is not worth it. Don't say I didn't warn you...............UPDATE: a replacement is scheduled to arrive tomorrow, which is good on Amazon. We'll see if the original was a fluke brick and not a manufacturing flaw...

The description is misleading and should change. These must be old surplus Chromebooks. We bought ours as a Christmas present for our child in December 2023. In the FamilyLink app, it shows up as "Intel Kaby Lake U Chromebook." That Intel processor that was discontinued in 2020. Looked at the sticker on the box, manufacturer date is March 2021.

I received this device last week. The screen would freeze and I'd have to restart device to get screen function back, then yesterday it froze and the screen went blank . So much trouble in so little time. Returned it today. so disappointed.

It's a waste of time and effort to buy this HP laptop, as I could never get thru OS setup1) OS won't load because it is not a licensed Win 10, but a bootleg OS2) touchscreen doesn't work, probably because OS isn't loaded3) the screen flashed off and on several times, glitching, during attempt to load OSIn addition, there are several major hiccups during attempted setup that indicate that the OS is a bad bootleg copy of Win 10 -- a non-licensed non-authentic Microsoft Windows OS.Nowhere is there any indication that the Win 10 OS is a licensed copy.this explains why it has so many problems. Bootlegged SW should not be sold as a genuine product.Shame, shame on the seller - PT ELECTRONIC TECH LLC - and on Amazon as well for allowing them to continue to market and sell this bootleg Windows 10 trash that doesn't load the fake Win 10 OS.

1st unit bought from seller Chrome Source which was horrible. The mac arrived rattling around inside a medium sized Fedex box. Opened it to find the mac was just wrapped in single sheet of bubble wrap then tossed in the box. No fragile label or anything on the outside. Luckily the cosmetic appearance was still good. However, I tried to power on and battery was completely dead. Plugged it in, turned it on and had to wait about 2 hours for battery to fully charge to test it. Checked the battery life and found the "Battery Service Recommended" warning. It had a total of 749 cycle counts on the battery and 4049 mAh life remaining. Nowhere near the guaranteed 80% battery life or better on this unit. The unit was very dirty, hair and crumbs falling out of keyboard and every port including power port had dirt and lint built up in it. This is by far the worst "renewed" product I have ever bought. I immediately contacted seller, took them 2 days plus going through Amazon customer service to get a response offering to replace. I opted to just return it as I already purchased a second unit from Platinum Deals which showed up very clean, in like new cosmetic condition, packaged well in an aftermarket computer box, full charge on the battery that had 6100 mAh of battery life remaining well over 80%. The second unit I kept. Point is, be careful what seller you go through. I would absolutely buy from Platinum Deals again but will never purchase anything from Chrome Source again. I will be leaving a positive review on the second unit purchased from Platinum Deals.Update: For whatever reason I can only leave a single review even though I purchased 2 of these from 2 different sellers. I am leaving the negative star rating due to my first experience because I feel that is more important for others to see but hopefully my entire review will be read. As far as the 2nd unit purchased from Platinum Deals, I give it 5 stars in all categories.

I purchased this MacBook Air after several issues with Amazon and other laptops. It arrived quickly but worked for only one day. Tons of error notifications and indicated an update was needed to a completely new IOS and is about 6 updates behind . It never turned on again. I would think the seller would refurb and update to work in current time before shipping.Save your money and the hassleStill haven’t heard back from seller and only option is a refund that takes 5-7 days after they receive it back (despite my data being on the machine and the delete via Apple is throwing an error code).9/8 update: seller has responded. Asked for photos of a cosmetically perfect laptop to “send to their quality team” when they were told numerous times that it was a software issue. Escalated to Amazon several times and reported seller. Really cautioning against buying from them. I’ve had a laptop I couldn’t use for almost 2 weeks while they’ve held my money.

The laptop looked really good cosmetic wise but once my daughter started high school and started using it after only about 4 days, the device got stuck in tablet mode. I immediately contacted amazon support and they tried getting me to change it through setting but the "tablet mode" they had me search for in systems WAS NOT THERE. Even on the task bar there is suppose to be something that switches the mode on or off but absolutely nothing!!!! I am truly disappointed in this because I am an international buyer and now i need to figure out how i will get the device back to the US so i can return it. I really hope other people have better luck with this than me but I don't think i even want back a device like this. VERY BAD EXPERIENCE and no one that i spoke to from the support team could have helped.

I absolutely loved my first Chromebook, which I bought in 2018. Since it had been awhile, I didn't realize Chromebook wasn't a brand and now everyone has a Chromebook. Because I was so happy with my first one, I checked and Lenovo was the manufacturer. So I figured they got it right the first time. And they were highly rated, you know by the people paid to highly rate companies by the companies. And I had been doing research for a couple months! Boy was I wrong. Even if you get the same cellphone, you expect certain improvements, all things being equal. Someone explain to me how the NEWER laptop is worse than the OLDER laptop! I'm so disgusted, is it weren't for the fact that my old Chromebook had a cracked keyboard and wasn't getting updates, I would have returned it immediately. But I'm lazy and didn't feel like going through the whole process again. But very angry since this is something I'm stuck with for a few years. It's slow beyond belief. It's glitchy beyond belief. YouTube is constantly freezing and the circles keep going so that when you click on the one video you want the whole screen will refresh and down the rabbit hole you go because now you've clicked on something else and now you gotta go back. And if I have two games open, the second game to be open will forever have the task menu bar showing, but the picture isn't adjusted for that so it cuts off the graphics.Oh! Oh! And let's not even talk about the volume. I'd shout but you wouldn't hear it through the Chromebook. Pathetically low volume, but the thing I really didn't understand was that when plugged up, yes plugged, not even Bluetooth, the volume was the same pathetic level as it was on the laptop. Last I checked, we used speakers to get louder, but not with this bad boy. This was not the case with the first Chromebook. I used my old Chromebook as an entertainment system, all the time! Even without speakers it kicked butt, but now the new one- this one, is quieter WITH speakers than the old Chromebook was without!
The description is very inaccurate and I will be returning ASAP. I have a high schooler and middle schooler and they can not use a computer with 4gb and 32gb.
This is advertised to have 512GB of storage but only actually has 32GB. Very misleading. My son is super upset.
I didn't realize you can't make the screen larger on this HP laptop
Says 128GB, But its only 64GB w/ and SD card (Which it does say 64GB+64GB) but the laptop has no SD Card Slot
This laptop quickly became defective and the seller refuses a refund

1. The laptop and the battery got so hot that I could not touch. These are old laptops not covered under Lenovo warranty. The website description is incorrect on many points— came with windows 10, not original Lenovo packaging, and not under Lenovo warranty.
Would not recommend this seller (Chief Computers).Sold defective laptop.

After having this laptop for just 3 months it started running into a slew of issues. The laptop is slow and unresponsive, tons of pop up ads despite turning off all notifications. Keyboard buttons stick and cause issues when typing. The battery life under little to no use lasts only 2-4hrs tops before needing to be recharged. This issue has happened to a friend as well as we bought these at the same time for work. There is no support past the return window so we are now out $260 each for half working laptops. I would steer clear of this model

laptop was slower than I expected and it has a poor manufacturing quality.On top of that it came as defective. Touchpad never worked and didn’t even have a touchpad driver.USB mouse connection was pretty flaky with longer response time.

This seller is peddling garbage. Brand new laptop won’t turn on or take a charge less than 2 months after purchase. Hasn’t done anything aside from sit on my nights stand apart from the few times I’ve used it. I’ve owned quite a few laptops and never had one bite the dust this quickly, not even close. “Brand new” batteries don’t degrade that fast. Period. Seller says “sorry to hear it”. YOUVE BEEN WARNED.Update: Laptop is now completely trash. Certain keys began to sporadically stop working and now it won’t take a charge at all. Transactions like this are the reason I’ll never buy another computer or piece of tech from Amazon. People can just screw you and there’s no recourse. Awful transaction start to finish.Update: Purchased a Dell from Best Buy for about a hundred dollars more than I spent on this one. Two months of use and it works perfectly, plus I have the peace of mind knowing that because I purchased the extended protection I can take it in should any problems arise. I should’ve done this from the beginning and I recommend that anyone who reads this do the same.

I have to send it back. I've changed this unit for two days straight! and it does not come on. I've spoken with a technician and was told this is a hardware problem. The charge light comes on for 2-3 seconds, then goes off. Since I received this unit, it has not worked at all. Please replace it or refund the money. I am not happy with this unit at all!

I saw this item for sale used for a good price and I thought it might be useful as a travel laptop: functional, small, cheap enough that it wouldn't matter if it was broken, spilled on or left behind while traveling internationally. When the Chromebook arrived I checked that it had several years of updates available, and it did. However the Chromebook is too low quality to be any use for anything: the screen is low-res, washed out and awful. The keyboard is so bad it's impossible to type on: although none of the keys was broken, half of my keypresses (on any key) didn't register, and it felt like there was sand under the keys. The hardware is hopelessly under-powered for basic web browsing tasks like reading email: having even 2 or 3 tabs open slowed the machine to a crawl. And the laptop isn't particularly small or light. I pity any schoolchild who has to do homework on this, it's a terrible experience to use. I returned mine for a refund.

Firstly, the chromebook I received has less ports than the images on the Amazon page. On the Amazon page each side of the chromebook has 1 x USB port and 1 x USB-C port, for a total of 4 ports. On the chrome book I received only one side has ports, for a total of 2 ports.Secondly, the keyboard was filthy. It didn't go through a basic cleaning process, so my first experience with the device was scrapping gunk off the keys. This wasn't even regular grey/brown finger keyboard gunk either, it was orangey-red. The only time I've seen gunk like this was when I drank too much wine in university and puked everywhere and it was somewhat dry the next morning. Pehaps that's even what happened to this chromebook.On a possibly related note to the filthy keyboard, the '8' key does not reliably work. It needs to be pressed very hard for the pressing of the key to register. It is possible other keys have this issue, I've only noticed the one so far.There is also a crack in the frame above the tracking pad. If everything else was okay, I wouldn't let this get to me, but a crack in the frame is more than the 'superficial' imperfections that were advertised.I would be returning this unit immediately, but I need a laptop in a couple days for work. It does seem like it would be a decent unit if it were new or atleast didn't have keyboard issues.What I received was clearly not what was advertised.

I thought this was just the right PC for us. We don't need much, web browsing, some gaming, some MS Office work. Yesterday I saw that the laptop OS needed update so started it. Noticed it was taking some time so I just let it do its thing all day. Went to turn the laptop back on that evening, and got a flash from the monitor but nothing else. I knew it wasn't a power issue because the separate mouse (not included) was lit, indicating it was connected. Tried everything I could think of then went to HP website. HP tells me there's 15 days left on the warranty ("whew!") and gave me repair options (phone, chat, local warranty provider [Best Buy]). I chose to go to Best Buy. They worked on the laptop for about 25 minutes, and while I can't tell exactly what was done, I do know it was a series of keystrokes and a flash drive. Geek Squad hands the laptop back to me and tells me it's a hardware issue and not worth the cost of repair. I take the laptop back home and get in a chat with technical support. They have me do what appears to be the same steps Geek Squad did. Then they tell me I need an empty flash drive to reset/reinstall the BIOS. Now I'm not really that tech savvy, but I know enough to tell the technician that all the steps that they have had me do I already had done by Geek Squad, their authorized repair center. Tech tells me that without doing that last step with the empty flash drive they cannot determine that it is truly a hardware issue (really??!) and that they won't be able to give me a repair/replacement if I don't take that last step.Sorry, HP, but you cannot convince me that the cost of a replacement laptop is worth more than the bad taste in my mouth, and my withering review (not only on Amazon, but to anyone who asks) of your inability to honor your very limited warranty. I can't imagine why you wouldn't send a replacement of a low-end laptop just to keep positive goodwill towards your customers. And it's why I strongly suggest anyone reading this review to search for a different unit.

The laptop stopped working after 45 days. I sent it to DELL they would not repair it, stating that it's refurbished. The description states new and it wasn't. I spent $599.00 on a refurbished laptop without knowing it.Don't waste your time with ASURION either, they will only repair it as well.AMAZON is useless as well, stating they can't do anything because it is out of the return window. They know it was sold as new and still are of no assistance. Buy from a store, not this lying company or Amazon.

Within 30 days, my screen was blank and the system needed extensive updates. Within 90 days the adapter is broken and their warranty is not covering it as they’re saying it’s damaged. I have another Dell laptop and several HP laptops and their adapters have lasted for years. Not sure what’s wrong with this device.

Battery did not work from the moment it left the box,... I'm sure way before. Not exactly the sellers fault, but if they weren't making money hand over fist there would be more time taken to insure products are in working order before letting them be shipped out. They can just afford to get this, refund the money and never see or touch it again.
Battery is almost dead!!It doesn’t start up !!!!

I purchased a Dell Latitude 7490 from OLIVE Computers on the Amazon Renewed store, and the experience was extremely disappointing. The laptop arrived with a range of defects: the left mouse button did not work, the back cover of the laptop was loose, and, to top it off, they did not include a USB-C charger, which is essential for this product.I decided to return it immediately due to these issues, but to my surprise, OLIVE Computers charged me a ridiculous 15% restocking fee! This is completely unjustified as the return was due to the defective condition of the laptop, not a change of mind. I have since filed an Amazon A-Z claim, as this is covered by the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.For anyone considering buying from OLIVE Computers, be cautious! Their poor quality control and unfair business practices make them a seller to avoid. Save yourself the headache and choose a more reliable vendor.Final Advice: Don’t fall victim to predatory companies like this. Read reviews and take action!

"certified refurbished" - yea, right. It's not. The battery can't hold a charge at all, and every time I turn it on I get a loud beep and an error message about how the battery's so degraded that it won't work. Amazon won't let me request a replacement, or do anything about it except tell me to send it back in for a refund and buy a new one - which of course is conveniently more expensive, because this has gone up in price $50 over the last two weeks. Would give zero stars if I could, for both the product itself and the "customer service" around refurbished products.
Disappointed because the laptop won't charge with the charger that was delivered.Not sure if the laptop is faulty or the charger!Unpleasant experience

This was a purchase for my daughter, and she wanted to buy her own Chromebook with her own money. We found this one that was within the price range she was looking for. And even though it was refurbished I figured it would be okay since I was planning on buying the protection plan through asurion. When she received the laptop it worked for about 2 days without any issues. Then it started randomly rebooting on her in the middle of using it and would not turn back on. She plugged it in to charge thinking the battery was dead on multiple times, and it would only restart on like the 50th try. Then it would stop working, reboot and repeat again. I called asurion to make a claim. They told me due to the multiple issues they could not replace or fix the Chromebook and referred me back to Amazon for a replacement. Amazon told me they could not replace the item, they could only refund the money. So my frustration is that I purchased a protection plan that can't be honored, and also a device that can't be fixed. I'd be furious if I hadn't bought the protection plan and Amazon wouldn't have refunded the money.

I got this refurbished. I have had multiple problems since I got this. The keys are not working properly. The touch screen is not working. Then the battery is not staying charged. I work at a school and I purchased this so I could stop using my school district issued chrome book. It is sad for me to say that the school district issued chrome book is working better than this is. I also purchased a protection plan and they are refusing to fix this under the warranty. They are telling me that if I want them to fix it that I will need to pay for it and it will cost at least $400. I did not even spend $400 for the thing to begin with so I refuse to spend at least that amount to get it fixed. I have contacted the seller multiple times and have not heard back. The address they gave is a bogus address in Texas. Then I looked online and there is no phone number that I can find. I finally told them that if I do not hear back within a certain time frame that I am going to my bank to file a fraud complaint. Then file a complaint with consumer protection. I feel scammed out of my money.

The media could not be loaded. I bought this macbook thinking it would be good quality since it stated “excellent” for the condition it was in. I’ve bought other apple items that have been refurbished and they were like brand new. The key board and mouse pad did not work as shown in the video. The left corner look like it was dropped. There were multiple scratches on the bottom and then computer itself was disgusting with crap in it. I would never recommend this product. Do not buy!

It's cheap and can maybe help a poor college student who doesn't have much money, but don't expect to do much else with this clunky, languid hunk of plastic - I have just got this thing as of a few hours ago and have all but on thing open (Chrome - which you MUST disable S-mode to use) and the words are lagging as I'm typing this review - which is unfortunate because this device also has some unresponsive keys so I'm having to return frequently and make sure that I haven't (actually the device, but I'll be generous and take the fault) misspelt anything. Don't even think about opening more than one tab; the device will start spinning and start asking you how to deal with unresponsive pages should you attempt to open even so much as *one* additional tab while you've got only one open. I have just attempted to test this while typing my review, and not only did it need to reload the page on a tab I already had open prior to this, attempting to return to this page after the frustration generated by trying to revisit a page I already had opened resulted in this page freezing and needing to reload before I could continue my review. This is because the thing uses eMMC storage, which I am now finding out is notoriously slow. Get this thing because you are poor and only need it for one thing, and pray that it can even do that one thing reasonably.EDITED AGAIN: It's almost comical how bad this thing is; the first few attempts I made at connecting it to the my network ended in failure, only for the 4th time to be successful. The device froze and became totally unresponsive and I was forced to turn it off and turn it back on (it was laboring under the burden of 3 tabs being open), at which point I had to turn it off and on AGAIN because it wasn't able to reboot after being restarted. It installed some updates (lol), and then proceeded to lose internet connectivity again, this time taking at least 6 attempts, manually, to get it to connect. Moreover, it does not display any icons on the taskbar, you have to hover the mouse icon over them in order to get their names to display in order to figure out what you're clicking on.I recently suggested that this thing should be used only for school purposes and nothing else, but after seeing what a craptastic job it did of facilitating MyMathLab, I'm halfway reconsidering even giving it commendations for scholastic or educational purposes; it took it 8 tries to finally display anything in MyMathLab, and that was WITH pop-ups enabled, on a browser recommended for use by MML.The mouse pad is also frequently unresponsive. Really, just don't get this awful contraption.

I wanted to be very excited by this purchase. The laptop is beautiful and the system runs well. But, this product, inspected by professionals??? Was shipped to me unable to charge… I am going to do some of my own trouble shooting and if it goes smoothly I’ll report back with a better rating. I really want this to work out. It just seems like charging is such a basic function I don’t know how the hell it was the thing that was missed by these “experts”.Edit: Best Buy are the real hero’s here. Was able to get the problem diagnosed. Amazon wouldn’t even send me a replacement charger, even tho it was established the initial one was faulty. So much for a warranty.Over all good price- but you might spend a little more time and money covering for amazons “experts”
Bios is password protected and not provided. Contacted HP support and they have a policy not to assist with resetting bios passwords.

I have only 4 months with this laptop, overall is OK but the problem is that the battery is charging but it doesn't hold the charge when the battery is off and now, I can only use it when is plug in.the whole idea of a laptop is that you can take it with you even in places where you don't have an outlet available. big ball drop. problems with quality or perhaps not the pest quality.

Amazon, I sent a cogent and thoughtful review previously, supported by imagery, which you deemed to be in violation of your guidelines. I don't know what part of my message was or could have been in violation since my comments were factual and supported by imaging.1) The device was represented as "new" as supported by an image.2) The device screen "floats" plus or minus 5 degrees, which is plainly defective.3) The serial number of the device was marked out which is a deceptive practice calling into question the legitimacy of the Windows license.This is not the service I expect from Amazon or Amazon vendors.Regarding this PC, buyers; I suggest caviet emptor. I'll return the PC and if there are any issues I'll dispute the charge with my credit card company. Amazon, I suggest you have customer support contact me if you chose to mute this review, as plainly there is something deeply flawed with Amazon and the vendor.Everyone have a good day.

I cannot emphasize enough how disappointed I am in this purchase. Four months have passed and the computer is dead - the boot drive cannot be found. The drive cannot be found!I will never, EVER be buying HP again, and I strongly advise anyone who buys this to do so with extreme caution, because 4 months is a pathetically short time for a device (that is treated with the utmost delicacy) to fail.update: I sent it back to HP because it was still under warranty, as it was only 4 months old. I finally got a message back claiming it was "user induced" ----- they laptop has never left the desk it was put on since I got it, it has no scratches or anything. Perfect condition, except it doesn't boot. So not only is their product complete garbage, but their warranty system is bogus. I cannot stress enough how you should not trust HP and their products.
3 months right after receiving the laptop battery started to die. after so many follow-ups they're claiming its not sold from them. how funny

Bought two of these and had to return both. The first one arrived and had a defective wireless card and would not connect to a network, which is required to set up Win11 (no ethernet port on this laptop). So I returned it and purchased another one same day as I shipped the return because I could not wait 3 weeks for an exchange. The second one arrived 3 days later and I did manage to get it set up and it worked fine for a couple of days. Then it would no longer power on. Completely dead. Tried leaving it connected to charger overnight. Still dead next morning. So I returned that one as well. And bought an Acer instead (which works great!).Be careful to review the return policy. Amazon does clearly states the return policy, but buyer beware. Both of my purchases were from Amazon Marketplace sellers, marked with Amazon Prime and "Shipped from Amazon". Amazon will not refund computer purchases until after they receive the item back and have time to inspect the product. Then it takes 7 days to go back to your credit card. It is not like most Prime purchases where you get the refund almost immediately after UPS scans the return package.On my first return, it took 3 weeks. That was from Seller "Snow Bell" and I eventually got a full refund. Then the second return took another 3 weeks, so I was carrying $1200 on my credit card while having to purchase a third replacement elsewhere (another $700 on my credit card). And now I am fighting with Seller named "AmazingDeal Arrived" on the second return as they are trying to charge me a $231 "restocking fee" despite the fact the laptop was damaged/defective and the restocking fee is inapplicable. Very frustrating and basically had to put $2k on my credit card and carry $1200 for 3-6 weeks waiting for refunds.

Not sure if it's because it was refurbished but the chromebook just would turn on after 4 months. I took it to 2 Techs and they said they usually problems was not it so I need to pay more so they can go in and replace any parts...at this point it would cost me more to repair than it is to replace the whole thing..more money out of my pocket
No lead or plug came no instructions some keys would not do what they were supposed to do, sorry but rubbish

This is a nice laptop, very portable so I wanted to use it outdoors or for presentations. The battery was dead and was never able to hold a charge always displaying zero. This laptop is supposed to be refurbished and checked for defects before shipping. Why did they send me this laptop and just wasted my time and their shipping costs? I wonder.

Bluetooth does not pair with Logitech mouse. No Touchscreen to enable, does not work. Nothing mentioned on site. Only Touchpad is operable, no good for Excel. Very displeased with his model. Only able to use Touchpad not mouse. Difficult to use.

I knew when buying a renewed laptop it was going to have it's minor flaws. As amazon states in the description, "excellent condition" is as "Excellent (Screen: no scratches. Body: no signs of cosmetic damage (scratches, dents, etc.) will be visible when the product is held 12 inches away)." and "Fully Functional (exceeds 80% of original battery life, generic or OEM accessories and packaging provided)."This laptop came filthy with hair, dust, and other junk within the keyboard and on the screen. The charger also came in the same condition with noticeable stains on it as if it was never cleaned. Furthermore, the keyboard was making weird clicking noises when pressing down some of the keys (ex. the arrow keys, alt, or space bar). The top right corner of the keyboard cover was also warped as if some sort of liquid had been spilled on the laptop, also somewhat consistent with the key board noises. Finally the screen had a large 6-7 inch scratch noticeable from well over 12 inches away, as well as additional scratches near it as if a cat had walked across the screen a time or two.Overall the macbook and its physical parts were okay and working good, but the cosmetic condition was no where near as described. The laptop was returned for a refund.
Keyboard keys are not matching, sometimes cursor could not functioning well. And battery life is short. Not happy about my purchase

When I received this laptop it had the wrong battery installed in it, so it wouldn't stay on unless it was plugged in. After several weeks of back and forth with seller, I received a new (and correct) battery. Finally, the laptop worked as it should . . . for a minute. After about a month, it got to where it sometimes wouldn't power on. That went on for about a month and then it just wouldn't power on anymore. I took it to a reputable repair shop and they told me the motherboard was bad. Price to repair is about what I paid for the laptop to begin with. Clearly, this was a terrible purchase and a total waste of time, effort and money!

Bought this item from this company . From the day 1 started to shut off and on . Send it back to the company and they received few days ago . StillWaiting for my refund . Send them 2 message not 1 response from the seller . Beware of this company . Avoid at all cost !

I bought this computer in “excellent” condition and the screen and body were scuffed and scratched, it was overheating when doing basic tasks, and worst of all, the charger would not stay plugged in, and the battery life on the computer was shot to hell. It was unusable. The seller was unreachable, I had to ask Amazon customer service to reach out to them for me. This seller is ridiculously difficult to deal with and it’s not worth the risk. It took me forever to return the computer for a refund but it finally worked. Never buying electronics from Amazon again.

This computer has been nothing but problems since I bought it. I've had to factory reset it myself after receiving it because it won't stay logged in and the os tells me my password is incorrect even though I've written it down and copied it perfectly, then won't let me reset the password. Microsoft won't let you talk to a person and now requires you to pay to access their chat feature. I can't log in anywhere, bought their office 365 for this computer and am having to resort to google docs because the product key doesn't work and, like I said, I can't log into my account to try to fix it. I've never liked apple, but microsoft will NEVER get another penny out of me. This is the worst purchase I've ever made.

I purchased a used MacBook Pro 15-inch, hoping for a reliable machine, but it was a huge disappointment. It worked fine for only two months before it started malfunctioning. First, the battery life became unpredictable, draining within a couple of hours. Then, the touchbar started flickering, and now it won’t even turn on. I expected more longevity, even from a used device, but it seems like I bought a lemon. I tried reaching out to the seller, but they were unhelpful, and now I’m stuck with an expensive paperweight. Would not recommend!

Please do not buy a chrome book from them.. horrible condition, the screen does not turn on, scratches all over it. This is a scam i think these people are passing around the same damage chrome book nobody wants and keep returning. I pray amazon flagged them from selling this product. The chrome book should be a donation to goodwill instead of trying to sale it to anybody who would take it. The pawn shop would probably not take the reason they are scamming to sale it online to people when it should just go to goodwill for somebody 2yr old kid to play with it as a toy since it not even that functional at all i would not sale that book to dog its was horrible. No way anything on Amazon should be sold looking like that. I want my money back. Go donate blood if you looking for money instead of trying to bleed money out of people passing around the same damaged chrome book you know do not work and not functional at all.

I've got a few of these because I need backup a lot and some of the women I live with need these computers. They're being sold like they're resell quality but they're not. Some of them have the whole number line not working and some have a charging problem where they can't charge correctly.

This one is going back! I needed an inexpensive Chromebook for a Ham Radio project and I like Dell so this seemed like a good deal. It is a low end Chromebook so I expected it to be slow and have low storage capacity. Both of those are true and I was willing to work around them. I normally steer clear of "refurbished" equipment unless I am very familiar with the seller but I took a chance on this one.What I didn't expect is that it would arrived damaged. Please look at the photos. At one point it had been dropped hard on the right rear corner so who knows what other internal damage still exists. (That's why I got the extended warranty.) It was shipped in bubble wrap in a plastic envelope so I don't know if the damage occurred during shipment or if it was sent that way. The box I sent it back it offers VASTLY more protection than the envelope the seller shipped it in.But it still worked so I was willing to live with it until I attempted to install some Android software from the Google Play Store. I can't! Seems this laptop is so out of date that it hasn't been eligible for updates since September 2021. As a result I cannot load anything from the play store and almost two years of security and system updates cannot be loaded. I didn't see anything in the description that warned about this so I am returning the laptop for a refund.The description reads "This product is in "Excellent condition". The screen and body show no signs of cosmetic damage visible from 12 inches away." Look at the photos: you can see that damage from 12 FEET away. And, naturally, I have to pay return postage which will be about half what I paid for it.Beware when you see a computer "deal" on Amazon that features a "renewed" product unless security and functionality is unimportant to you. This seller, "Tech Magnet" is now on my permanent "NEVER AGAIN" list of sellers on Amazon.
I can say that you get that you get what you buy. Cheap mini laptop, but mine came with battery issues. Doesn't hold any charge and Chrome OS version is outdated

When I received it I was given a charging brick that would NOT even plug into any outlet I had so I ended up using my iPad brick. It finally turned out but I instantly noticed battery issues the second it was at 15% or so and it would jump up to 40% randomly then back to 15% or even less or just a tiny bit more in the 20% range, after trying to even log into my iCloud account, the laptop would just be in an endless loading loop so I never managed to log into my iCloud account. In addition to all of this the laptop would randomly just shut off (more battery issues) which is when I just gave up on it completely since no matter if it was plugged in at all times, it would randomly drop to 0% and die on the spot with minutes long wait times to boot back up again, some other issues were in the keyboard, the “n” key would have to be pressed deep to type the letter or it wouldn’t budge at all, same thing for the spacebar. This purchase was a complete waste of time, even at the highest price of $440~ I basically just bought a useless piece of junk laptop that can not function at all.

I bought the computer and it came the next day. On arrival it did not want to charge and when I looked at the battery health— it needed to service. Why they sent this computer out, I have no clue. Along with that, certain keys didn’t work and they were all sticky. I took a chance on buying this one from Amazon, and I was highly disappointed with the product. Take your money and spend it on another product since this seller does not properly take the time to evaluate what they put out.

Well, it did arrive when they said it would.Took it out of the box, and it did have some life in the battery. OK, so far so good.Took the after-market charger out of the plastic wrap, and plugged it into the wall outlet. Plugged the other end into the Macbook Air...... hmmmm, the Macbook isnt charging. Tried another outlet, still not charging.OK, so now I tried the other Thunderbolt port, and it worked. There was also some case damage around the thunderbolt ports, So I wouldnt call it "excellent condition".And when you spend this kinda $$$, the ports better be working.So it got returned.
This computer doesn't work and we brought an extended warranty for it. They won't help unless the seller does.

The media could not be loaded. I bought this laptop on May 30th 2024, it had some signs of use but I would say its normal for a refurbished product. The laptop worked fine until Sept 15th 2024 when it was not booting up. I tried a few things but the only sign was that Caps lock was flashing 6 times. When I decided to to see whats inside, I noticed that the Memory RAM is glued to the motherboard with silicon. I am still trying to figure out how to fix it but quality of the refurbished work is very bad, and definitely it seems that they just do minor repairs to re-sale those laptops without really solving the root cause of the problems. More updates to come..

The laptop arrives on Christmas Eve and after unbox it I charged it for hours and the screen never came on. I tried different ways to turn it on but the laptops is dead. I guess someone is going to be disappointed for Christmas. It's a shame that the Inspection Sheet in the box says that someone already inspected and tested and the item works fine but it looks like someone didn't do its job right. This was a refurbished item so I guess the lesson here is just spend a little more and buy new.

I was deceived as the description and specs of this laptop says anto-glare, backlit keyboard. I opened my laptop today and the function key for the backlit kb is blank (see photo). No backlit icon on it. Tried other function keys to see if the keyboard lit up but to no avail.I ended up checking the support.hp.com site and typed in the SN to see specs. To my horror BACKLIT KEYBOARD is not listed as a specification of this laptop. I purchased the backlit keyboard specifically to use the laptop to work at times in a dark room at home at night.To return this item is very costly.Not a happy customer at all.

I wouldn’t recommend purchasing these laptops. I know it’s advertised as being refurbished and in excellent condition, but the condition part is not true. it was a great deal. My daughter needed it for school. the number 3 didnt work and now the screen wouldnt come on i have had to return this product and the replacement

DO NOT BUY - computer arrived broken - Assuron told us to return it . We started the return and brought it to Apple - it had been recalled and was worth 60$

This is so horribleDon't sell someone something that like thisPlease don't waste your money not worth it
