The feel cheap and flimsy but get the job done.
Great when it worked but broke after about 100 toothpicks

First the good: I received my Chromebook in excellent condition! Considering its age, it looked like new and has great performance. Not one scratch or blemish on it. 2 in 1 touch screen works perfectly. No issues with hinges when placing it in tablet mode. All keys worked. Not mentioned on product page is that it had 4 ports (2 USB C style and 2 older style) and a micro SD slot. All of which work fine. Now the bad and my only complaint: The product page list this Chromebook as being released on 6/16/2022. I purchased this Chromebook based on this information. When I first turned it on, I checked through OS settings and saw that the Auto Update Expiration date is 6/2027. Only 3 years from now. Upon further investigation, I found out that this device was released in 6/2018. IMO, This is very DECEPTIVE!! I purchased this item based on the listed release date on the product page. If I had known it was 2018, I would have purchased a newer, i.e., 2020, renewed Chromebook I saw out there. Lesson learned for me. I would have given this product 5 stars, it really is in excellent condition, but due to the deception, I am knocking it down to 3, and debating whether to keep it or return it. I also wasn’t pleased that a few hours after ordering the Chromebook, all of a sudden it was around $10 cheaper than what I paid for it. Then the next day it was back to around what I paid for it.If you are OK with a Chromebook that will receive OS updates for only 3 more years, then by all means purchase this one. New Chromebooks with 2 in 1 screens are not cheap. The one I received really is in great condition. Maybe I’ll just buy a used one every 3 years.

The thing runs good enough for my school work. It came in pretty poor condition and had a stupid sticker covering the scratches. The stylus was not included and the charger for it was ripped out of the machine. It was legit glued together 🤦. I cant complain though, it was $100 and can browse the web.
The computer seems fine, but the product description says this is a touchscreen and it's not

The product is an attractive, utile piece of hardware, albeit one that is at times distractingly low-fidelity. It is sensibly priced for its modest specifications, however, and makes for a perfectly reasonable piece of equipment in the hands of someone who wants only for functional, uncomplicated tools. For such people, I am sure you will not be dissatisfied, but it is possible you will find better bargains for technology of this caliber elsewhere.

11.024...I am an email, platform / charting user. big improvment from my 5 yr old HPlike: quick start up (dump edge and bing and it will be better)...key spacing good for my stumpy fingers...touch screen good... overall performance works for medislike: POOR BATTERY LIFE -4+ hrs continuous use, set to optimize performance...needs a newer mag-set power plug (the 3.5mm's stick out and are a hazard).. 256 memory is minimal (I knew this going in) and I find the SD slot card protrudes to far out.recommend you look for a similar deal but with a better battery, more memory or a better slot.

I purchased this HP Chromebook 14" G5 hoping for a simple and lightweight laptop to handle basic tasks like browsing the web, checking emails, and streaming videos. While it performs well for those tasks, I was disappointed with its speed. The Intel Celeron N3350 processor is simply not powerful enough for multitasking or more demanding applications. Unfortunately, this limitation wasn’t clearly stated in the product description, which could mislead potential buyers looking for a faster device.That being said, there are some positives worth mentioning. The Chromebook’s design is sleek and lightweight, making it easy to carry around. The 14-inch screen is bright and offers good resolution for watching videos, and the keyboard is comfortable for typing. Additionally, the device arrived in excellent condition, and for a renewed product, it looks brand new.If you’re looking for a budget-friendly laptop for very basic use, this could work for you. However, if speed and performance are important, I’d recommend exploring other options.
Very misleading! I needed a laptop for school and to be touchscreen. This one was on the Black Friday sale and it clearly states touchscreen. It is NOT touchscreen.
I don’t like how fast the battery life goes down. For example I charged it all while I was at church and i got on it to send a email and it said it was on 16 percent.
If you're gonnaa use this laptop for anything other than doing homework, you're all set but if you stream, multitask, make music, play game; the lag is, not even exaggerating, unbearable.
Was for my 11 year old and his school work, does what it's supposed to but the screen is sub par

Do not use Combination Studios as seller for this laptop. They shipped a defective product which appears to have been a retuned item. Lenovo claimed my recent purchase was for an item sold months earlier and it was out of warranty.

I ordered this pc and I got it early. It works but it won't hold a charge. I'm going to send it back and get a new one. It takes a while to set up so that sucks i have to do that again. but i need it to charge. i dont want to be stuck with the cord all the time. sometimes i gotta move with the pc.

This is a good little computer and it's an annoying little computer. It is good that it is light weight and easily slips into a knapsack with no noticeable weight increase. Watch the battery life, it drains rather quickly and is slow to charge. The unit also cannot be used at night, unless, and this is a big unless, you are a master of the keyboard. The reason I say this is because the keys do not light up. That is a big deal to me, because my last little laptop key's lit up and I could continue to work into the night.Perhaps this is a new feature, or I haven't figured out how to fix it, but the icons line up on the left side of the screen and do not save. Meaning, every time I want to go to Google, I have to manually type it in. I set Google as my default search screen and it always defaults to Bing, another thing I do not like.So, in the end, I believe this was a get what I pay for system. It's good in that it's light weight, the processing speed is awesome, but that could be my internet provider. I do not like how the websites that I go to on a daily basis do not save on a top rack that I can just click on. The keys do not light up and that is a big downer for me.2.5 stars for this unit, but I gave it three, because it really is a solid little computer, the set up is just not to my personal liking.

This Chromebook unit was refurbished. Paid $99. There is a vinyl sheet glued to the top so I suspect the top was scratched or badly worn. The edge of the sheet is peeling.The unit did not come with a charging cord so I called Amazon and they shipped a power cord a few days later. This unit has two USB ports and one HDMI port. Also has a port for a micro disc. The key pad has a mouse touch pad but I use one USB port for a wireless mouse, The unit is working properly.Chromebooks offer a good option for school work and new users to computers. The 11.5 screen is adequate and the operating system if fine for web browsing . There are several system applications and more can be downloaded from Google Play, much like an Android phone.The Docs app can be used to write letters, The Sheets app is for spreadsheets. Also has a camera for virtual meetings.Not a good unit for gamers. Similar to using your smartphone. Connect to internet using Bluetooth or tether to your phone.

The pictures for this chromebook show it, a nexstand, a mouse, and a bag. The only items in the box were the chromebook and charger. This is false advertising. Other than that the chromebook arrived in perfect condition and is super fast. It was also advertised as touch screen and it most definitely is not.

Cute and does what I need it to do. Its a bit slow, but I wasnt looking for speed...I wanted something that did the basics and had memory all for a bargain. My 1 complaint is the battery. Im used to my battery holding a full charge if the laptop sits unused a couple days. This one doesnt hold its charge very well. Dont get me wrong, it has a standard battery life when im using it.
Functions as I need it EXCEPT battery only lasts about an hour. If it is plugged in, no issues. Not sure if is the model or just a crappy battery included with Amazon's refurbishment.
Pretty fast laptop in great condition, only issue is it has an American keyboard. As and when I need to type a £ sign I may struggle. Why sell a laptop with an American keyboard in England? Baffling.

I like this computer overall MINUS the camera glitch. I purchased this elitebook because I was looking for a budget friendly personal laptop. I have used a similar elitebook at my job, and it performed just fine. So, I figured why not. One con is that it is a bit heavy compared to the other elitebook I am accustomed to (don’t remember which specific one, sorry). This is minor.HOWEVER… I do a lot of work from my computer, including work that requires my presence on zoom and other video call softwares. Therefore I MUST have a laptop with a properly functioning camera. I contacted Amazon support and their troubleshooting method did not work. I contacted HP, downloaded several updates both on the computer system itself as well as the updates offered through the HP Assistant. Restarted several times. Camera still does not work.I am SO DISAPPOINTED ☹️.
the laptop arrived wtih part of the chassis broken off.

I’ve had this computer for about 3 weeks now and the exterior and condition of the laptop is great but I’ve noticed it does not keep a charge for more than 3hrs. I will have it at a full 100% and quickly starts to die if I don’t have it plugged in constantly. A few of the keys are worn out so you have to push them with more force than others. May seem like a minor issue but leads to a lot of autocorrection needed which is not ideal for those who write lengthy assignments. The sound quality also is diminished once it’s turned up over 70%, it starts to sound as if part of the speaker is blown. The last issue is the speed of the computer is not nearly as fast as my previous Mac which is actually older than this model. I definitely want to return this product but can’t afford to wait over a week for a replacement.
The media could not be loaded. Hello laptop battery Life not good only 3.5 approx. Window 11 pro not licensed product. I want product key for windows 11 pro. Pls let me know
The product has discoloration and external scratches. Also, some keys on the keyboard do not work properly.

The computer is very very nice, It had everything but the fingerprint reader which is mainly why I ordered it. It was suppose to be a special feature that was in the description on the item. Amazon has contacted the seller just waiting for a response to get it straightened out.

Unfortunately, this was one of those purchases where the negatives out weighed the positives. The positives are that it's a working lap top for 80 bucks and it's a Chromebook, so it will probably keep working. The negatives were: (a) the enclosed power cord was so wrong for the computer that it wouldn't even plug and I had to order a new one; (b) it was advertised as a 2020 model and the sticker on the back plainly says 2019. This matters with a Chromebook because they have updates for a limited number of years and once the updates are over, so is the computer. So, this effectively knocked a year of usage off the laptop. Finally, the screen of the computer very definitely does NOT fold over as shown in the pictures - it's a standard 45 degree hinge. I've been very pleased with refurbished electronics on Amazon in the past and consider them a wonderful deal. The quality control from this company, however, is either incredibly poor or just plain fraudulent. Not worth the hassle of returning, but very definitely not satisfactory.

I bought this renewed Dell Latitude on July 20th, 2024. At first, I noticed that some of the keys need to be pressed harder than others, but everything else seemed to be working fine. So, I adjusted my typing to be more firm. Now, I'm having issues with the monitor flickering occasionally, sometimes for 5-10 seconds at a time, and I can't read what's on the screen. I've made sure to update all of the software and drivers, but it still has issues.

We used this device for YouTube, google docs, kids’ school and email. It did what we needed it to for a great price. It came with a junky charging cord that needed to be replaced right away, but that was still under warranty. I purchased it in July ‘22 and now March ‘24 it died. It was inconvenient to wait for a new charging cord and 2 different batteries as I tried to trouble shoot it. Nothing has worked to power it on, and I am not paying asus to fix it as their warranty was less than a year.
I returned it! It was too far behind in the past.
Mine snapped not even a month into owning it.

We bought this Chromebook, just to run an app for a Smartboard for my wife's classroom.The unit was nice and clean, ran the Smartboard fine, and we were happy with the price. After about 2 weeks, one of the shift keys stopped working. We asked for an exchange, and got a 2nd unit. This one had issues right out of the box. The scroll pad, just does not respond correctly. Also, the Smartboard won't fully function with this unit.We were going to get a 3rd unit, but you can't, until the others are returned. But my wife is at least getting by with the original, until we get a fully working replacement. We decided to try a refurbished HP Chromebook, and are going to return the two Dells for a refund.

I ordered 4 of these. They shipped quickly and chromebooks work well. My kids are homeschooled and they needed them for their schoolwork. One of the chargers came with frayed wires and won't charge. I contacted seller about getting it replaced and never heard back. Kids are sharing which is annoying.

don't get me wrong the computer is in great condition. its fast and does everything i need it to do..but when setting it up everything was in chinese..EVERYTHING and it took 2 hours for me to get back to normal and then i realized i received a MacBook with some chinese keys on it. the caps lock button is in chinese and the "enter" button doesnt even have words on it so that was very inconvenient makes me feel like i have a fake. and I'm scared to get a replacement cause i don't wanna get one with the correct keys but a worse computer compared to this one
not so pleased, it does not hold the battery long enough , ended up using my old laptop instead and later bought a new apple laptop, because, just not pleased with the features and the speed
Very bad battery

What I really liked was it arrived on time and package was very neat and boxed just perfect. One small thing, not really much to complain about, but after ordering an Intel i5 cpu, which I really thought was swell, I opened the neat brown box and slid the shiny new laptop out, opened the lid and saw it was actually an AMD Ryzen cpu, which are really good, but not an intel i5. So I reluctanty got them to send me RMA for return. Seller was very happy to help me.

It works like a charm. However, the hinge cover thingy was missing leaving the hinges and the display wires vulnerable. It also came with some slightly visible surface damages near the edges. Overall from the performance side, it's great. From the visuals side, it's meeeeh....fine.Edit: -1 star because I found that it couldn't handle basic chrome tabs load, it would start to freeze or act slow.

The screen is totally washed out and faded. It works fine but the screen gets me everytime - all colors are washed out with a blue tint. Otherwise, it has handled being hooked up to an external monitor and speakers, extra USB hub. I used it as an interim computer so I was doing tons of computer searching, emails, and a bit of a 5D planning website that I use for work. It kept up well.
Didn't work upon delivery. I returned it

NB the documentation does not say this, but the pen actually works better if you use it in the stand.The device is very light. It feels flimsy, but maybe the light weigh is good as it may be easier on the handI was interested in this, because the previous mouse I was using was irritating the arthritis in my right thumb. I am hoping this will be better, but it might be too soon to tell. In any case, it's generally better to switch up hand positions to relieve repetitive use injuries.It did not come with a battery. The battery cover was hard to remove. I had a friction sheet that I use for opening jars. That helped me open the battery cover.The battery was hard to get in, but eventually I did.At first the laptop did not recognize the clicks on this mouse -- but then it seemed to figure it out. Maybe there's a learning curve -- not sure.Otherwise it seems to work.I'll have to get back to this review after I see whether it helps my hand feel betterOne disadvantage is that I use the mouse on a pull out drawer, below the surface of my workstation. This device is too tall to stay on the drawer when I close it.-----------------I've been using it for 2 days now. I've knocked it on the floor at least 20 times during that time. So far, it's still working, but I wonder how long it can survive like this. A lot of times I accidentally knock it on the floor when I'm trying to reach for it. Other times, it's because I forget it's there. It's very unstable.

This review is for the Adesso iMouse S8. I was looking for the smallest wired mouse that still has a DPI switch button. I believe this is one of the only mice that fits into that category.The Adesso S8 is a small and light weight mouse with a retractable cord. It is very comfortable to use with my medium sized hands. I used a much smaller Verbatim Traveler mouse and it was just too difficult to control. I did notice less strain on my wrists and elbows with this mouse over other much larger mice that I have used in the past. However, this is a benefit based on the size class as opposed to this mouse in particular. I do have a few issues with the Adesso S8.The main problem I have with the Adesso S8 is the build quality. The Adesso is light because it is made out of very thin plastic with the inside having a lot of empty space. The retractable cord is thinner than any mouse cord that I have ever seen or used before. That might be acceptable if retracting the cord was not so tricky. Even the buttons and scroll wheel have that cheap feel to it. Some more metal or thicker plastic would have improved build quality and added some much needed heft to it. For me, the light weight makes it a bit difficult to control. Another thing is that I have seen other mice with a very similar design and look to this one. So, this is probably a generic mouse that Adesso just puts a name on.Overall, this is a comfortable mouse that actually has 4 DPI settings. I would prefer a mouse with a little more weight to it. I do not believe this mouse would last that long given its flimsy build quality. In the end the price does seem to match the quality of mouse that you get.Note: Amazon.com does not allow half ratings. But if I could I would give it 3.5 out of 5.

I bought this one because every other mouse with a retractable cord is about the size of my fingernail.This one is a nice size but the cord doesn't retract as well as I'd like; it tends to be a hit or miss.But that is not why I docked it two stars..When using it, the cursor shakes uncontrollably on the screen... or just moves every which way, but the one in which I directed it to go.It was starting to feel like an out-of-control Ouija planchette.

Some problems when first received - No instructions - Wire would retract and not stay at desired length. There is a switch for different sensitivities - but without instructions it is hard to know what the positions are. I went to the Adesso website, but could not find any explanation of the switch settings. After pulling the retractable wire in and out and playing with the wire retractor I was able to adjust the wire to the length I wanted - I don't know what I did to make it work correctly. The mouse is comfortable and is working OK. If more information had been available, I might have given it another star.

I like this mouse and it works well. I just don't think a regular size mouse like this one should be on a retractable cable.I feel like I should have gotten the mini size mouse on a retractable cable. I say this because of the weight of a regular size mouse doesn't allow the cable to pull back together on its own. I have to monkey with it quite a bit to get it back together when I'm finished with it each time, which can get a bit aggravating sometimes. Unless paired with a stronger retractable cable, I would recommend the Mini size mouse because of this issue.

Its an OK retractable and good for travelling with a Laptop and not depending on bluetooth or battery. The problem with this mouse specifically that it works with blue led and not working on white surfaces.

I bought this keyboard largely because of its backlit keys. It's good looking, ergonomic, smooth key function. It's a great keyboard with one glaring problem -- the battery dies very quickly. Even though I've started keeping it connected to a charger and turn it off when I'm not using it, the battery does seem to last more than a few hours at most. In fact, this morning when I turned if on it was already dead and it took a while to charge enough to connect to my Mac. The battery is a huge disappointment to what would otherwise be a great keyboard.

bluetooth range is 1 and a half foot from my desktop, if i put the board closer to me but still on the desk, it looses bluetooth! cannot replace since it was a renewed and they don't have any more in inventory
I love how small and portable this is, it folds up to a box a little bigger than my phone. But it feels kinda flimsy and is a little hard to pair.

For it's price, it's a pretty decent Bluetooth keyboard. I got this one because it's so slim and fits easily with my smaller iPad Air. But some of the keys have an issue where if you press it once, it doesn't actually register and type the letter. Other keys if you press it once, the letter registers it twice and types it twice.A bit frustrating, but it was pretty cheap. I don't use it very often anymore though so I can't say how it's held up.
Not bad but feels kind of cheap not gonna lie. Concerner about longevity and sometimes the touchpad acts crazy in wireless mode when im not even far from the dongle.

Overall I quite like this keyboard. Key feel is firm and responsive, well separated, and slightly concave, making it easy to feel. No double letters or missed spaces common to many wireless keyboards. Ergonomics are not bad and tilt legs help customise to preference.Minor qualms are that the ergonomic curve is pretty flat, so it's not particularly ergonomic. The legs on the front are too short - I'd prefer to have it tilted more aggressively backwards like my MS Ergonomic keyboard. I also dislike the up/down arrow keys being minimised and centered. The upper arrow **needs** to be above the side arrows, even if slightly. I use arrow keys a lot for moving around spreadsheets and documents and this makes it unnecessarily challenging. It makes far more sense to make the left/right arrows smaller instead.I can live with these as this is a secondary keyboard that floats around the house when I mix up my work space. However, two critical dedicated keys are missing from this keyboard - the home and end keys, which I use constantly. Yes, you can use them as alternative keys on the num pad, but I'm often also entering numbers, so it's frustrating to keep switching it on and off. I notice the absence of these frequently every time I use this board.These keys could be in place of the source switching keys above the numpad, and those could've been shrunk and located in the empty space in the middle of the keyboard under the indicator lights. With this layout it would be a 5 star product. As it stands, it's more of a 3.5.

I'm going to write this review without correcting any istakes made by the keyboard. I assure you, i am doing my best to type as accrately as possible,,, wih no spelling errors. Straight out of the box, the keyboard does look nice. I bought it because it looked like it was a well-made product, and i wanted to treat myself. It is very light, and I can se it on my lap without discomfort. However, the u key is bent and sometimes rfuses to type. I also notice that when I am yping at a faster pace, some letters do reepeeat. While it is trivial to correct these mistakes, it is not helpful in a live text chat situation to continuously backtrack in order to correct istakes when others are already moving on from the previous topic. The bluetooth pairng also has to be reset almost every tme I pair the device bck up (reset, n this case, meaning to forget the device from the syste's bluetooth menu), which is rather interruptive if I want to type something right t that moment. It also disconnects after some inactivity, which I did not see specified in the uuser manual as a power saving feature - it only says it is supposed to trn off when the devie is closed. I will continue to use they keyboarrrd for a week, and if these problems do not improve with time, I will retrn it. I made an attempt to contact theee seller to see if these problems could be resolved, bt I did noot find the option nywhere, strangely enough.Anyway. The keyboard looks nice and does afford some usablitity I did not ave beforee, such as the arrow keys allowing for quicker corrections to text. The keyboard itself is not excessivey noisy, nor is ittt uncomfortably small. It IS small, but not in a way that impedes my typing. Hopefully the crret problems resolve theselves, because I do like the keyboarrd. I hope the nintentional typos speak for themselves as to the qualiity. I've nly had the keyboard - inside - for a little less than a day by the tme of writinng this review.

I love the form factor and great price. Solid keyboard - 5 stars for functionality... Ok maybe 4+. However...at first the keyboard wouldn't even turn on. I thought it was the batteries and after two sets I kept monkeying with the connections of the battery holder....and it finally turned on. Fine - no problem. Stuff like that happens. That's when realized the on-off light glows red...not green? Hmm - So - I read the ultra-brief 4-page 3 x 5 directions and it doesn't describe the three LED lights on the upper right of the keyboard. I have no idea what two of them do or what they should indicate. The instructions indicate that one of the lights will blink on and off if the battery is low. Mine was steady red. and is labeled "1". Not on or off but "1". What does "1" mean? Who knows. There are some instructions for the alt function keys - and the keyboard seems to work fine. For me - it has a great feel. It's just annoying that the engineers did a fine job - but the marketing guys couldn't put together better instructions. Even weirder - who ever thought we'd ever need instructions for a simple keyboard??? Also - there is an addition to the numerical pad on the key board "00". It's where the "0" normally is....so - you'll have to get used to that if you are used to using a keypad.

Overall, this NULEA keyboard has a nice feel to it, but it does have some issues. Quiet, but responsive feedback typing. Squishy hand rest.My main (maybe deal breaker?) complaint...The ENTER key is abnormally small & the DELETE key is abnormally long & close to the enter key! Who designed this & decided to change standard design?The round "FN Lock" key in the middle of the keyboard is an important button. You need to have that on if you want to use the volume or brightness buttons on a Mac. At first didn't think any of those features were working.I bought this ergonomic keyboard for home use to get the feel of ergonomic typing while waiting for the one at work to arrive. I am now using a fabulous Logitech ergo keyboard & mouse at work. The Logitech is FANTASTIC (& pricey), but it is so easy to get used to. The NULEA keyboard I'm reviewing/using is not as user friendly. I find myself hitting the wrong keys due to the enter key being smaller than any other keyboard I've ever used. The delete key is so long, right near the Enter key. So many mistakes & frustrations.

EDIT: After using this for a couple of weeks I removed a star because some of the keys (particularly the "N") are prone to not getting typed, especially when I'm using the keyboard on my lap. Also, the numeric keypad is a great idea and works in a pinch, but I almost never get all the numbers I try to type in. The keys on the lower half of the keypad have a faint, but satisfying "click" when you press them, but the upper two tiers have no feedack at all. And it's all too common to press numbers that don't actually get input. This gets particularly frustrating because, since there is no physical way to distinguish the keys, you have to look at the keypad to use it, meaning you will not know until you look back at the screen whether the numbers have been entered correctly, and usually they will not have been.One thing I think is missing from most videos and photos is something representing the remake size of the keyboard, so I added a couple with my medium sized hand as reference.This device is wonderful out of the box, is easy to set up with multiple devices, and the TouchPad/NumPad works extremely well.I removed one star because it doesn't snap open, so it is unstable if you rest it on your lap - tends to fold back up in on itself. But for most common uses, this is a perfect keyboard/trackpad.
Usually a good brand, but this one has a problem with num locks. Still usable, right size for my travel case.

This is pretty, but the water runs out very quickly and I have to refill it almost daily to keep it going without it making loud noises. I've kept it for a year and continued to refill it, but now I am going to get a new one and will not purchase this one.
It looked wonderful at first. but now the light is out and there is not a simple way to replace it. S
Water often leaks over even when I put only a small amount.

The media could not be loaded. I picked this fountain because I liked the window waterfall I thought it was cool looking and reminds me of a yoga pose, but the sound was so loud it sounded like a running sink. I found an easy fix as the sound is coming from the screen so you just have to pull it up so the water can fall though. I like it much better now!
Water sounds are good

I'm a little disappointed with this fountain. It comes with two water flows that you can change with the switch on the pump. Keep it on the low setting because the high setting will splash water outside of the bowl. I tried it on high, adjusting water levels and position of the elephants, but it always ended up with splashing water. I filled the water to the recommended level and even placed a thin sponge in the base. This reduced the vibration sound but I continue to hear the pump rather than the sound of trickling water. The fountain does look cute. I added some rocks in the bowl to give it a nicer appearance and some weight. My clients seem to enjoy the appearance of it but I just wish that I could hear the water rather than the pump. Kind of bummed out. The seller did send the fountain in great condition and in good time. They were very quick to answer my questions and generously offered to resolve the issue.

First take was it was definitely small. But ok, still liked the design. Well, hmm, no instructions as to how the pump suctions inside the base - doesn't line up. And to stop the pump from buzzing louder than the fountain had to put stones around the pump to keep it from free floating inside the fountain (thus causing the buzz). Then, since it's so small, the water splashes out of the unit - enough that I have to place something all around the fountain to absorb the splash. Would return but as I said, like the design. Not worth the effort.
Beautiful, but look little bit "cheap"

When I first got this fountain, I found it absolutely beautiful and relaxing. But after a while, I started to notice that there were water stains around the table and floor in the area it sits. I keep cleaning it, but it is splashing a lot, so I turn it off when I am not in the room and have put a mat under the floor area where it sits.Overall it is a beautiful fountain. The sounds are relaxing and the light is gorgeous, but it splashes and if you have hard water, it will certainly make a mess and need to be cleaned often.

It's so Pretty! The balance of water you need and the flow of the fountain is awful. This will be a High Maintenance fountain. I bought 2, so high maintenance fountains! :( For the price, it's so flimsy. Save your money. Spend more money and get a better quality fountain!
I like the soothing sounds and pretty design buy I wish it was a bit bigger. It's easy to put together. I like the light feature too.
I like the soothing sounds and pretty design buy I wish it was a bit bigger. It's easy to put together. I like the light feature too.

Tiny, itty bitty fountain. Disappointed by how big it looked in the pictures. The hands must be photo shopped. Paint isn’t metallic and really is just brown, not copper/gold like pictured. I will say that it hums, so if you’re wanting water noises this isn’t a great one for that. The marble spins and is fun to watch, the lights work great and it’s a nice display. Have to fiddler with the water pressure though. It has a dial to change the pumps strength. It had no instructions so you had to just kind of play with it to put it together just right
I had to have help with the assembling, but it works fine. The water is a bit noisier than what I had in the past, but it sits far enough away that it is tolerable. For the money, it's a good buy.

Unfortunately water pump stopped working after 1 week due to use of tap water instead of Distilled Water.If product description had implicitly advised the use of Distilled Water; the thoughts of purchasing it might have been reconsidered.

At first I thought this was the easiest, low maintenance fountain I have gotten since normally the rest are quite an ordeal to acomodare and clean. This one is quite simple in that aspect. HOWEVER, set up was not easy and you’ll have to tinker with it ALOT every time you need to clean or move anyting around to get the motor to silence. It will not be enough to just fully cover with water.The tube that came is super hard and long so you will have a terrible time cutting it until it’s exactly perfect. Don’t do it all at once because if you cut it too short it’s done. The tube is way too small for the connector so you will do quite a bit of struggling and I can definitely see how most people never get it in. Once I did I couldn’t get it out. So now it’s too long and since it’s so hard and won’t sit upright suction-cupped to the bottom as it’s meant to but instead sideways.Even when completely submerged the motor makes sound that’s louder than the splashing water so you need to continuously tinker with it and move it around until you get it to stop making noise. Unfortunately with other systems I’ve had when this happens eventually there will come a time the noise won’t stop.I love the design and simplicity of this style. My concern is how long with it function accordingly.We shall see!
Be aware of the size.Although I did read the dimensions, I was still surprised when I saw it. Very small!I kept it, because I did like the style. Just put it in a different place.

I got this to replace the "River Bend" fountain I had in my office, which doesn't seem to be available any more. The River Bend had 3 broad lips for the water to fall over, so it produced a very pretty, soft waterfall/rainfall noise if you scattered pebbles across the lips.This bowl fountain has 3 narrow spillways. The first two are so close to the bowls that they produce no sound at all. The third sounds like a faucet running or, like one client said "an old guy taking a leak". I've put some strategic blockages in the spillways and managed to get a fairly decent sound -- one I can live with, anyway -- but nothing as pretty as the Riverbend.The fountain is quite sturdily built and easy to assemble, and I've had no problems with splashing or spillover.

I bought this for my little greenhouse cabinet. It’s good for the price but certainly constructed cheaply (obviously). When I first pulled it out of the box and filled it with water, it was spurting water out of the bottom and not the top. So I took it apart, gently pulling the tower from the base and unscrewing the top cover. It was broken in one corner and the pump wasn’t connected to the tube leading up the tower. I snapped those together and found whatever the little light was attached to was snapped off broken as well. So, while all the parts and pieces work, it didn’t arrive ready to go and required some tinkering. If you buy this and it doesn’t work correctly, try taking it apart and checking the pump connection. I’m happy with this purchase overall. I’m including a photo of the type of pump used in this fountain. Once I connected everything and got it assembled, it worked great. Use distilled water in this only to avoid the mineralization.

Product was fine at first but the light stopped working 3 days ago and it was delivered on Oct. 14th. I thought I had 30 day's to return this which I was going to on the 6th. I am very disappointed that I am out $31.

This is a pretty product, but way too loud for my office as a therapist. The sound is quiet sometimes but unpredictable. Also when it is quiet the water makes virtually no noise which I dislike. I love the sound of trickling water. This fountain overall is not worth it

The product was okay but could have been better. The packaging came broke which was a little disappointing. It really did not meet my expectations.Noise level is medium, fountain size is accurate to the description and the functionality is great. Giving 3 starts coz of the damage.
I found it very small but working properly so far so I guess I’ll use it for now
The flower looked great on table top but difficult to assemble and the petals and flowers kept falling apart.
The listing says it makes soothing noise. But the water drop each level is half an inch so it's soundless. Otherwise the light and pump work well.We returned it as we wanted the trickle sound.
Please, no matter how tiny the fish are, do not put fish in here. They will die. One minute they will disappear into the abyss (the back area) and some will die from the rapids.
It's cute and I like that it has the candle holders, but even on its highest setting, you can barely hear the water flow. Motor is quiet, but I expected a little more noise from the running water.

I received the item today. Per the instruction manual, I put the item together.The issue I have with the product is there is no control switch (on and off). You have to physically plug and unplug the device, which I find antiquated because most products have a control switch.In addition, the machine is not quiet but loud.

this item has a light in the top bowl, which doesn’t make a lot of sense. You can’t see it unless you’re looking right into the bowl from the top. It would’ve made better sense to put a light in each one of the bowls.

I purchased in Sept 2022 and it stop working today in Jul 2023. It was fine while it lasted. It recommends to use filtered water and gunk can build up. I cleaned it out maybe 2x a month, which helped it. This morning it simply stopped working; no lights, no hum from the pump, nothing. I won't replace it for the price, but take care of yours and hopefully it lasts longer than mine did.
Absolutely no directions in the box. Once inside the device pump kept falling apart. The hole in the back is not big enough to fit both fingers and pump in at the same time. Would NOT reccomend.

This waterfall is great. Quiet pump and very attractive design. HOWEVER, it burns through water pretty quickly. I refill every 2-3 days. I have it on a timer for about 4 hours a day. The frequent water refilling is the only caveat. Other than that, I’d buy again.

I bought this fountain in November and have used it daily. I used only Reverse Osmosis water in it, and cleaned it regularly to remove the sort of “slimy” buildup that occurred in the base. It is now August, 9 months after purchase, and it is splashing so much water out both left and right sides that it has become unusable which is disappointing because I was enjoying it!Pros:* Easy assembly* Nice appearance* Didn’t require daily refilling (only about every third day)* Pump was quiet* Fairly loud water sounds. You could hear the water sounds in other rooms. This could be a pro or a con depending on what you’re wanting.Cons:* No adjustment on pump. Maybe my pump arrived broken, but there is no way to adjust the strength of the flow, so it was only high. This meant…* Splashing. No matter how I tried positioning rocks, or removing them altogether, this fountain left splashes around it, particularly on the left side. **This got significantly worse over time.*** Loud water sounds. I wanted more of a “trickling” sound for relaxation purposes, and this was definitely stronger than that, again because the pump lacked any way to adjust the flow strength. This didn’t stop me from enjoying the fountain while it was functioning properly, it just wasn’t my preference.If this fountain hadn’t become so splash-y, I would have rated it higher. As it is, though, only giving 9 months of use, I don’t believe it gave good value for the money I spent.

Product was nice while it lasted, had this set up in my bathroom and it ran most of the day. ALWAYS made sure it was full with water, product last about a month and the pump went out. Don’t recommend buying unless you plan on having it on very rarely. You will be buying another or buying another pump.

The fountain looks really nice. The main issue was the instructions. Very vaugue and wasn't clear on the tilting was needed not that it might tilt so I made a mess. The cord will not go into the place where there is an opening for it. So yes it is pretty, but sounds more like a leaky faucet instead of a nice flow. Not sure I want to keep this.
Pump has suction cups but need to put pump in at an angle to avoid slurping sounds and need to add water many times a day otherwise slurping begins again. Overpriced.
There should be water sound too. Which is missing

This is a cute little fountain- it gives the relaxing, trickle water sound one may be looking for. However, the emptying leaf only works when fountain is on a high setting and thus, water splashes everywhere. As a matter of fact, no matter what setting it's on, water is splashing everywhere. It's very messy. I do love that it is easy to clean. The lights aren't bright enough to use as any type of true light- gentle lighting as part of the ambiance. Think christmas lights.

Purchased this fountain last year in July. Loved it, but the light quit late summer and now I plugged in for spring and the fountain does not work at all. Very frustrating! Thought this fountain would last longer . Probably would not buy again. I have other fountains that I have had for years and they still work. Guess I will have to use this one as a centerpiece!

The media could not be loaded. PROS: Beautiful water area, overall design.CONS: Loud overall, needs extra assembly.In short: if better constructed, I would’ve kept this potted tree fountain.Hot-glue work was sloppy and needed to be redone, the pump tubing was too long, and although the water sounds were good unfortunately with the sounds of the pump it was overall too loud for my taste.
It was smaller than I expected but it’s nice and relaxing!

Such a cute little water feature for the price but you can hear the water trickle (which is kind of the point). Luckily you can't hear the motor either. The glass ball that came with won't roll. It's too heavy. It was the biggest pain to put together we had to cut a piece of the tubing to fit. The rocks are cute. If you think the little water holders are wood covered. Nope. They are just plastic made to look like wood. It's not horrible, but I wouldn't gift it to anyone unless you warn them it's not high quality.
Good product but misses on the water flow sound, silent water doesn’t make sense

When I first got the fountain it was smaller and not as loud (water fall noise) as I wanted it to be but it worked well for what it’s worth. However a month into the product it started leaking and that’s where the product gets the rating from. It’s unfortunate that it started leaking a week after the return window closed.
The media could not be loaded. It has an unpleasant sound and not comfortable to hear.

The dish is nice works well so far. My complaint is due to the cheaply made parts and construction. The stand is awful and not sturdy at all. Any pressure and the weak legs unscrew and falls to the ground. The plastic parts are also frail looking and weak. Getting the rubber grommet in the bowl to plug properly was also very difficult to secure. I'm keeping it...I think...but wouldn't order again due to being so poorly made.
needs to clean often

The media could not be loaded. I love the style of this little water feature. As you can see in the video, I have placed it in a larger vessel and placed rocks around it for a larger look. The light comes on, and I’m very happy with that but the ball does not flow around like it says it’s supposed to. Disappointing.

i have had many fountains. this is nice, quiet water fountain but needs a lot of effort to assemble.when you read the title, you probably think i'm a dumb axx. if you have this fountain in front of you, and you would know what i said is true.first of all, the main tube is slightly short, so the pump would be easily disconnected if it was pushed down or when you tried to wiggly insert into the fountain. you have to leave pump unsecured and hope when you put in, either tube or pump connector wouldn't disconnect.Secondly, it has connected tube for 2nd water flow which is too long, so tube is bent when everything connected together, the 2nd water flow would have very little flows. in the mean time, you have to be careful not to disconnect the pump (my 1st point).other than those, it works well.

I didn't buy this for the beauty, it's okay to look at, nothing spectacular, I bought this for the relaxing sound. But it's barely a trickle. I kept it because I wanted to spruce up my at home office space, but it's just okay. I wish I could find a good fountain that actually had a louder, fountain sound! Any recommendations, I'd gladly take them.
I only use it when I have guests over as it dries up too fast. Watch the water or it will die.

This fountain makes barely any sound, unless you take the marble out. (The light is bright form inside of it)First thing that happened is the little plastic bowl the marble sits in. became unattached while trying to connect the pump to the hose. Had to super glue that back in. Also only comes with enough rocks to cover right in front of statue. They also needed to be washed before put into the fountain. So much dust and dirt.Will I buy it again when it dies? No.But it’s cute and perfect for now.
Good quality, looks good. I’m disappointed it makes zero noise. Not even a single trickle of water sound . That was whole reason I bought it

Absolutely love this fountain except the motor died after the 1st use. If it wasn't for that I would give 5 starts but I had to purchase a second motor and that ended up increasing the over all price of the fountain. Not very happy about it :/It doesn't make much water sound because of how smooth the ceramic is I believe. I places couple of rocks on each level and it resolved that issue. Over all I love it but I wish the motor was better quality.
Really pretty desktop fountain but the pump stopped working within 3 months. It also seems to run out of water significantly faster than other fountains.
Nice, perfect for my decor,

Smaller than I expected but I’m bad with measurements. Probably not worth the price but it’s cute enough and it’s really for my boyfriend’s cat. She hasn’t seen it yet. If I’d know the cord couldn’t be hidden or tucked into a notch for it, I might not have purchased. Stars are based on value for the money.
The picture shows a pleasant green light in the fountain and this is just not the case. It is white only. I really hate false advertisement.

I bought a used fountain, and when it arrived it didn’t work. My husband, being a handyman, took it apart and found the issue. A small plastic ring had broken off part of the section that spins to push the water up the fountain. After some superglue and a little sanding, we got it work properly.Even if I had purchased a brand new one, the fountain is very cheaply made and likely won’t last long. Is it worth $70 for a one time use in your wedding cake or at an event? If your budget allows, sure. Please don’t purchase expecting a lifetime of use from it. Advice for others: order it early to give adequate time for a return and a new fountain just in case it doesn’t work.
Didn’t feel it was worth it, also wish it was a bit louder. The finishing looks and feels cheap. Ease of assembly was helpful. Would not purchase again.

If you are looking for a water feature to fall asleep to at night, this is not the one for you, however, if you are looking for one for your desk at work to help, call me, then I would suggest purchasing this. Minimal maintenance, easy to assemble and works well. I purchased it for my basement bedroom to possibly help me fall asleep at night with the water sounds but it’s not quite loud enough. I moved it to my desk at work and it’s perfect.
It's cute but way smaller than what I expected
Has a hole in the bottom so glue before you even try to fill it. It’s almost like it’s intentionally put there. Other than that it’s been fine and great little office fountain on my desk
... stop working... I clean it once a week to mantain properly but just stop working😒
I love how easy this was to set up. It looks great, even if it is a little smaller than I thought it would beOften overflows and leaks Have not yet figured out why

This fountain is definitely pretty to look at but assembling the pump is a pain in the rear. It took a while but I finally got it working, I had almost given up though. You have to fill it pretty often if you plan to leave it running all the time. Also the way you turn it on is to just plug it in, there's no on/off switch. If the outlet you're using isn't easily accessible it turns into you not wanting to turn it on at all, especially if you have to move furniture or stoop to plug/unplug it. A simple switch on the cord would be a HUGE improvement.

It's a really charming little fountain and it makes a wonderful flowing water sound. My only problem with it was the sound that the pump makes. It's almost as loud as the water itself and very distracting when you're trying to relax to the sound of the water.

I was disappointed and embarrassed when I purchased this fountain for my parent for Christmas and it turned out to be a cheap, lightweight resin instead of ceramic. I thought for the price and the size of the item, that it would have been the real deal. There are other ceramic ones that I have purchased from Amazon for a comparable price, but I chose this one for the color. If you want a ceramic one, make sure that's what you're paying for. Also, although it has pretty lights, it makes no trickling noise whatsoever, so it's not that soothin--borderline pointless.

Nice little water feature if used without the fog atomizer. The atomizer is a very cool feature but I can't keep it from spitting mist/water no matter how much I adjust the water level. Solution anyone? As I write this review I'd probably have not purchased due to the price. And because of the spitting water and secondly very disappointed in the plastic plants; they are pretty cheap looking. But if you can get past the negatives it is just okay.

The media could not be loaded. I gave this product 3 stars because it does work as the description states. However, I regret the purchase and do not recommend unless you live in a place that is always sunny.- The fountain will not work unless it is in FULL sun, hence, it will not work in the shade of a tree or an overcast day. I added a video to show what it does on a cloudy day, it gurgles. The fountain doesn’t charge like some of my other solar items. I wanted to put it right under a tree branch for the birds because they prefer to come down for a drink and fly back to a tree for safety. I’m unable to use the fountain as I wanted.- If the sun comes and goes, the fountain does too. The water will spurt out the top.- I did appreciate the little plastic straws that help keep the fountain in the center.- The water has to be at least 2 inches deep to allow the fountain to work. If working as stated, the fountain will shoot too high and it ends up splashing water out of the birdbath. Maybe it would work better with something deeper than what I’m using. I’m constantly having to fill up the bath.- My birdbath was a happening place until I put the fountain in. Enough said.

This fountain is powerful (like the Texas Sun where I am)! I didn’t have any cloudy days when I tested it, sorry. I’ve no complaints on the powerful spray itself. Creates a nice pattern, and there’s plenty to choose from. Easy to assemble and choosing a spray is easy and fun, using the glossary and testing it out.* note* the fountain works instantly! That’s great, but it also doesn’t store energy, so no spray at night (or I assume on dark days). For all the above I give it 5 stars. However, here’s the problem I couldn’t overcome:This is a free floating device. The spray moves it around the birdbath, and it inherently stays next to the side, causing half the spray to land outside the birdbath until it drained all the water! I tried fixing the gizzy to various items, but never was successful. Maybe something could be epoxied onto the birdbath for gizzy to be adhered to. For you crafty types and for this cheap price, maybe you can figure it out. I gave up and put my St. Anthony statue in the birdbath instead.

I wanted to love this so much! The directions were easy to follow, set-up was a breeze, and it made a beautiful fountain. My plan was to plant flowers along the perimeter of a large pot, then put a smaller pot in the middle for the fountain. Unfortunately, the pot I used is too small in diameter (8”), so all the water splashes out of the pot and it runs out of water too quickly. It even splashes over the side of the larger pot on the bottom, which is 14” in diameter. I went through 1.5 gallons of water in about 1/2 hour. I’m bummed this is so impractical because it looked so good. I’m going to see if I can find something wide enough to contain the water so it can be reused instead of splashing out.
Only works in bright direct sun. It also fell apart after a short time.

The media could not be loaded. Update: I have added another star to my review for customer service. Seller reached out to me giving me several different suggestions to improve quality of situation at hand. I believe the product itself isn't the issue possibly just wind in the environment that pushes fountain to the side. Seller offered full refund, when I declined offer due to device not being defective, seller still refunded money due to not being 100% satisfied with product.Purchased this with excitement for my bird bath and quickly realized it's not quite functional. The product does work, has many different spout options for different flow opoptions. I like the solar power, very easy to set up and use. As you can see with the pics/videos I have had to find things to secure the fountain in the middle of the bird bath so it doesn't spray all the water out.

Got this to put in a stock tank with goldfish. It stays afloat, and it isn’t bothered by the sludge (so far after three months of use). But it floats in and out of the sunlight, only working in the direct sunlight. Not surprising, as it is solar powered. Wish it was a little more stationary to stay in the sun. But it is cute, and it does its intended job. I would buy it again.

The fountain was easy to setup and activate. But then the fun started. I filled the bird bath with water until it almost overflowed and I set the fountain on the lowest setting inside which auto entered with the plastic arms. After 45 minutes the bird bath was empty. So I placed the fountain in a water trough that holds 10 gallons of water. 2 hours later the trough was half empty. I filled it to the top and again hours later the water was low. I’m surprised that much water evaporated so quickly. The fountain is now in the garage not being used. Nothing wrong with this product it just requires way too much effort to keep functional

This product works as far as flow and pump. But was disappointed because it does not power on if you do not have it in direct sunlight. I was hoping it would charge during the day which I AZ is very bright and the be able to run on a charge when the sun goes down. Well, that didn't happen, if you do not have it in direct sunlight it doesn't work. My porch is extremely bright and sunny but it will not work. Very disappointed that I can't place it on my porch. Plus it gets really hot in AZ and the directions say not to use in hot temperatures, well we get over 110 degrees and the fountain doesn't work if not in direct sunlight. Very 😢

The product initially came defective so I requested a replacement. The replacement came 6 days later and worked beautifully. The instructions were poor, but it was easy to figure out. The problem I had was not the fault of the product. Each sprayer worked beautifully and looked great, but 3,5w was simply too much for my 17” wide, 3” deep bath. Set on the lowest spray setting and using the head that did not go high was even too much. 5 mph wind on a sunny day blew the water out of the bath leaving nothing in the bowl within 2 hours. The only one that worked without spitting the water out of the bowl was the bubbler. Additionally, the first and replacement set did not come with the pieces described and pictured, although I did like the ones it came with, you may not. It did not have the high center tube. The birds were attracted to all the spray settings. The instructions lacked a description of how and when to clean the filter, which is an important piece of information. I’ll keep this one, but will order a different brand in the future.
Worked beautifully in the beginning now it doesn’t work at all.

bought this thinking i could have a fountain in my bird bath but it doesn’t work well. For starters you have to have a bird bath that holds a good amount of water at a depth or it will not completely submerge. secondly you have to have full sun if it’s overcast in any way you get a constant splash instead of a solid flow

Clever design and well made. Multiple nozzles are easy to install. Works great-in bright sunlight. HOWEVER-The slightest bit of shade or a cloud in the sky is enough to shut it down. Needs direct sunlight to work. I know it’s solar powered but these are the weakest solar cells I have ever run into. Should at least work on a bright cloudless day without needing direct sunlight beating down on it.

I thought I received a dud also, until I realised that the pump when working was blowing air so I connected the hole of the pump to the underside of the solar disc, the suction cups seem to be for attaching to the bottom of a shallow surface to keep from floating around. The instructions are not clear at all.Tested mine in a bucket which I could move around in the sun as it is now winter and my bird bath is in the full shade.Let's see how long it works for, will be putting away until warmer weather and more sun.

Really great addition to a kids water table! There is one problem I had with it, however. There are four little plastic “straws” that attach to the sides to help pull in water for the fountain. My standard water table does not allow for all four to fit, so I had to cut them, and now the fountain does not work quite as intended. Still a fun toy, but definitely be aware that if you are purchasing for your child’s water table, measure beforehand! Also…don’t leave it out in the sun in an empty water table. Or else you might go crazy, as I did, trying to find the wounded-sounding animal in your yard…. (The solar panel aspect makes it continue to try to pump water even when not in said water!)

The fountain has lots of different attachments and is easy to assemble. The biggest downside is that it MUST stay in full sun to work. It depends on your location. I only get a couple of hours of use do to the sun location and shading, it must not have any internal battery because it doesn’t store the solar energy.

Used this for the water dish on our deck for the birds, but it is only working when there is absolute direct sunlight. Any shade and it does not work. This is similar to one we previously purchased but the other one would work when there were clouds. Definitely would not buy again.

If this is in a more shallow bird bath it just sprays all the water out. If it’s in something more deep then the sun can’t get down enough to power it. Three stars because it pumps water through decently enough so I’m sure it could work in some scenario. But did not really work for my circumstances
did not like this product. doesnt work as said on descrition

Works great but…in an hour it had pumped all the water out of birdbath - had to place rocks on bumpers to hold in center. Still it emptied water!! I need a way to restrict pump so it’s not so powerful!! Right now Inhave a slim rock leaning over hole to make itMore like a bubbler - anyone have an idea? It’s frustrating
Couldn't figure out why it wouldn't work until I found the suction cups out the pump were put on upside down
This product worked possibly one month. Then, one day...just stopped working!!! Don't waste your money.
