did not like this product. doesnt work as said on descrition

I bought this to replace the pump on my bird bath in the front yard. One issue I knew going in - there's no battery as part of the system so any shading turns the pump off right away. My old one had a small battery that would keep the pump going for quite a long time after the sun was off it, or through temporary clouds.The other issue is that the shut off isn't very effective. It will eventually shut off, but many a time I've gone outside to hear the pump grinding away with no water and the pump is still just moist. Living in the South West where it is > 100F all summer my small bird bath can dry out daily so I assumed this wold cause the pump to burn out very quickly but so far it has kept going through the summer. YMMV.My previous pump was either more sensitive to the water level or the sensor was better placed, I don't know. I guess the solution for me is to bury a big reservoir of water below the bird path so it runs of out water less frequently.

I bought a different one a while back but it didn't light up or hold a charge. It only works when the sun is on it. If a cloud moves over, it would turn off. So I saw this one, and I loved that it had lights. I felt the $30 price tag was too high but I really wanted to try it out. I sit out with the dogs a lot at night and I have tons of solar things all over the yard. This fountain was a waste of money. It does light up, but barely (doesn't matter that we've had nothing but straight sun with no clouds in 2 months), you can't see it unless you get right up on it and only then because you're looking down at the little bulbs. The suction is weak so it barely puts out a spray (no matter the nozzle used) and the charge only lasts about an hour after sundown. My original cheap one is much better, I get a nice size spray from the fountain. Ah well, it's like everything else ... all those bells and whistles (the lights and longer solar charge) are just a way to raise the price for less product.

The media could not be loaded. This little solar powered fountain works great for the money. If you’re looking for a simple and cheap fountain the different nozzles included and the pressure of the fountain will scratch that itch.-Here’s what you need to know - the pressure is dependent on how much sun the solar panel gets.-Shady? Don’t plan on your fountain working.Sunny? Your fountain will be the star of the garden.-It would be nice if there was a stored battery and an on / off switch to control when the pump ran or for when the clouds came by so the pump would continue to run.-As you will see in the video the pump is working nice, but if I step in front of the solar panel the pump stops working.If your fountain runs out of water the pump will continue to run. A shut off float would be nice, but is probably an added cost to produce.-For the money this is a good value pump. Overall I would recommend and buy again.

No installation needed works right out of the box. But, it does not work in my bird baths as they are not deep enough. I’ve tried other deep bowls but the fountain sprays out of the fountain needing to replace the water frequently. It works fine, spray is great, it just needs a very deep, large bowl so you do not need to refill water all day. Love the fountain, just have not found a bowl deep enough to work with it .

It works really well, easy to set up and is a nice addition to our bird bath. My only issue is that it doesn't last as long as I would like in the Arizona sun but that's to be expected. It's budget friendly enough that I bought another when my first stopped working. Really like this fountain and highly recommend it. If you live in a very hot and dry climate, keep that in mind.

I have turned my backyard into a bird oasis complete with several bird (and squirrel) feeders. The only thing that is missing is a bird bath. I decided to purchase a bird bath because the birds like to get into the water dish on one of the bird feeders so it is always dirty and full of seeds, etc. I saw this solar powered fountain and thought that it would be a nice touch to add to the bird bath. It is solar powered so i don't have to worry about charging it or replacing batteries in it. It is very easy to set up and use and it makes a wonderful addition to my backyard bird oasis.

It's a really nice little fountain. It only functions when in direct sunlight, there's no battery to store charge for night or cloudy days. Having multiple nozzles for different water effects is great. The trouble is, unless your water receptacle is really wide, most of them just spray water or and you have to keep refilling it. But if your receptacle is big enough to catch all the water, the fountain won't stay centered because the brackets aren't long enough. Luckily two of the nozzles don't overstay, and those look really nice.

I have a multi-tier bird bath/fountain that I used this for. It worked great, exactly as stated it would. Turned off if the water got too low. The solar panel actually worked well even on some cloudy days. I was very pleased. Then it stopped working very well. Then it stopped all together. It hasn’t even been a year. But for the price? It was worth it.
Died on me after about a month. Cleaned it, just stopped working . Had to order a different solar fountain

The fountain has lots of different attachments and is easy to assemble. The biggest downside is that it MUST stay in full sun to work. It depends on your location. I only get a couple of hours of use do to the sun location and shading, it must not have any internal battery because it doesn’t store the solar energy.

Edit: I’m changing my review from 1 to 3. The little motor *does* work, but the water temperature can’t be too hot.Unfortunately for our little fountain, we live in the south and our summers are brutal. Yesterday morning it was working great, but as the day went on and the water heated up in the sun, its power dwindled. It needs full sun (no clouds whatsoever) to run consistently, but the temperatures also have to be just right.Basically, you get what you pay for with this little guy. It’s inexpensive, but with that price point comes definite quality limitations. I wouldn’t recommend this to someone who lives in an especially hot climate, but if you live in a more mild area, I think it would be just fine.———The little motor works great outside of water, but it almost completely stops as soon as it’s submerged. Water spits out sometimes, but it’s not a steady or significant stream.

After a few month water barely comes out. I cleaned filter where items may get stuck and clog it and the tubing for water but still not much power. It use to work great. Fountain is in full sun for 6hrs and there is always water so I don't think it's over heated

Bird bath fountain work ok when basin is full of water,... EXCEPT wind blows all he water out and then it stops working. Also, the 4 plastic tubes attached to fountain are supposed to stabilize it, but they come lose & end up floating in water, and sending the fountain askew. Now one of the plastic tubes has disappeared, so the fountain won't stay stable. I bought 2 other fountains and have used one, which is much better and cost about the same amount.

This compact solar fountain is a good choice for areas of full, uninterrupted sunlight as it does not charge and continue to operate out of full sunshine to which I was disappointed with as my backyard patio is covered, but gets nice morning and evening sunlight in late spring through early fall. Thus this fountain barely performed in that location. I moved it out to the front deck which is full sun all day and it worked amazing. I spent several minutes changing out the different spray attachments to see how each worked and looked before selecting one. Changing the attachments is very easy so that is a plus. There are also four clips and plastic tubes which attach to the underside of the fountain to help it stay centered in whatever basin, birdbath, bowl or container it is placed, if you want, and the tubes can be cut to accommodate. Once I had it situated and my container filled with water, I was initially pleased with the power of the spray and the overall look. However, upon returning about 10 minutes later to check it, the fountain had STOPPED! It had used up all the water in the roughly 10inch diameter x 3inch deep basin! My conclusion was that most of the water spray had gone up and over the edges of the basin thanks to a light breeze and the attachment I had selected. Since I live in an area that is always a bit breezy, I'm going to need to reevaluate the size of the container to catch the falling water and/or a way to fully secure the fountain to the center of whatever container I use to avoid water spray over the sides.After all this, I'm not sure I will keep the product or if a submersible fountain set up will work better for what I want.

Like many have said before, if you get even the slightest misty cloud in the sky the power of will be greatly reduced. But when it is full sun it shoots extremely high in the air which basically clears out your water bowl.So make sure to have a pretty wide water bowl or something to stop the water from shooting straight into the sky.I had to modify the holes on my piece to be a little bigger so that the water pressure wasn’t as hard. That helped with the distance

I wish I had read all reviews and all of the details of the item itself. It really does not work without the solar panel being in direct sunlight. I don't have one area in my yard that is full sun all day so no matter where I've moved this is doesn't work for more than a few hours at a time. Unfortunately just doesn't work for my yard. I guess I assumed that like most solar panel it would store solar energy for the shady time of day. Otherwise it works well for the size and cost.

It has no gradient of operation, it is either running full speed or not at all. I guess I expected in moderately overcast conditions it would run slow, it doesn't. It needs full direct sunlight to run. When it runs, it runs great. But I live in Ohio, we get a lot of days where it is partly cloudy or slightly overcast. It does not perform well in these conditions.

Very pretty , easy to use - suction cup broke off right away, but I tied it on with fishing line :) Fountain worked for 8 months perfectly... then died... no amount of cleaning (which it didn't need) brought it back to life :( Too Bad!
I have like 4 solar fountains I like them this one is for the most part good but sometimes the it doesn't work and the lights and ok but don't look like pictures
It's cute
It worked great for a few months and has stopped working. I bought three different size pumps and only one with a different brand solar panel is still working.

It's a cute feature, but if the smallest bit of shade crosses in front of the solar panel (even the shadow of palm leaves swaying back and forth) the amount of power the pump has is greatly diminished.

I like this solar fountain, I use it in a bird bath to add some ambiance sound in our backyard and it attracts the birds and even bees drink from it. This one floats around though and often goes to one side because of the wind (even with the clear stick things). They make them now with build it "wings" or "legs" so it stays in the center. This also helps the bees so they don't drown. There are several different attachments to create different effects.It sometimes doesn't work when the full sun is on it. It goes on and off like it's confused and it annoys me. I wish it worked consistently with the full sun.
It's cute. And small.Instructions in English instead of Italian would have been very helpful but I figured it out.

The usual issues with made in China stuff, the instructions appear to be written in English but, the translator is not fully fluent in English. They at least added some trouble shooting ideas....I bought two of these, with the thought that some parts might not work that well and I was right.The implication in the instructions is that if the pump fails it is due to either a lack of sunshine or a clogged filter...no mention is made that the motor itself can simply stop working, which one of mine did.If you hold the apparatus in the sunshine and you do NOT hear the motor, assume it has failed and NO apparent way to fix it exists.
I really loved it when it worked. Purchased mid June, now it’s early August and broken, super disappointing.
average product, only works under direct strong sun

Works great as long as it has direct sunlight exposure at all times.Spurts at sun rise and sunset, cloud obscuring, tree leave filtering ..... anything more than full direct sun is a detriment to function. If you desire fountain effects anytime, solar is not for you.If your fountain is in the middle of the desert, away from all obstructions, this is for you.Otherwise, best find a different toy :D

I love the options with this fountain. It’s very soothing to watch and listen to. My birds have enjoyed it. Nice size and easy setup. However, like most solar products, it stops working after a while. I got my first one at Christmas and purchased another one to replace it. So, for me, they last about 4 months. I’ll eventually get another.
the pump works, but was disappointed with the length of the power cord - it was not 9ft more like 3ft.

This is a pretty cool fountain I bought for use in our bird bath. It worked to keep the water moving. It doesn't have a lower button, runs only on solar. If it's in a shaded area or cloudy it didn't work (to be expected as it's solar). It lasted about 3 months before it had become clogged and unable to run.

I ordered this and it worked fabulously for two weeks. The panel is in full sun, water level was kept high and clean, cleaned filter when needed and interior parts. It just stopped working this morning, period. No troubleshoot helped. Asking for a replacement since it's within the return window, hoping the next one is fine because this is pricey for something that doesn't last. I have other smaller ones that have the circular panel built in and just float in the wAter that have been working for months, but bought this for my bigger fountain since I liked the ability of the panel to hold a charge where the others don't. We shall see!
The media could not be loaded. I loved the fountain at first, it worked great for a while but after two months its on and off intermittently, even in full sun 🙄

It works only in sunlight. does not keep the charge to be in the shade. If you don’t mind having it for a few hours of sunlight this is for you. Because it’s in the sun it does require more water as it evaporates faster.

It needs full on sunlight to work and I don't have that anywhere in my yard. During regular daylight, it spurts periodically. Kind of disappointing, but I bought another one from a big box hardware store and it does the same thing.

I liked the solar fountain and it's different spray options. It does not seem to work as well in less than full sunlight. After 3 months it suddenly died. We tested it for clogs etc but to no avail. For the price it is nice for the summer but don't count on yearly enjoyment.

The media could not be loaded. I didn’t realize this was the same one I bought last time. It lasted about 6-7 months last time I bought it, which isn’t terrible for the price. My biggest issue is the ad clearly says their solar panel will work “even with a leaf on it” compared to other brands and this is simply not true. The moment any tiny shadow is on the solar panel, even in direct bright sunlight, if a tiny corner or anything is covered it stops working entirely. I’m already finding myself moving the panel constantly to keep it in the sun so I can enjoy the sound of running water. I decided to just return it for one with a battery back up since it’s only a few dollars more and they’re built to last longer and just work better all around.The pump/suction works well but these are not built to last. My last one worked for quite a while, but it very obviously wasn’t putting out the same amount of power after only about a month, even with cleaning it often.
This has a one year warranty & it quit working 8 days after warranty expired.

I have been looking for a solar fountain for our 18’ above ground pool. We live in Central Florida so we have mostly strong sunshine. From the first time I put this fountain in the water, it struggles to spray 2 inches. If just a slight shadow crosses over it, it stops spraying, and struggles to regain an 1” or 2”. I even tied it to the side of the pool with some fish line to keep it in direct sunlight. I contacted the seller and they told me the sun may not be as strong now as in the summer 🤔 After several messages back and forth and troubleshooting, the seller offered a full refund. I will keep looking! I think this would be great for a bird bath, I need a fountain for an above ground pool! Communication from the seller is a 5 star ⭐️
My location is not optimal so it stopped working,but with full sunlight and consistent cleaning once a week it does work
Seems to be clogged and I can't figure hiw to clean the filter. Directions seem to indicate pulling it out but it doesn't come out and I'm afraid of breaking it.

Unfortunately with the size of bird bath we had the water would blow out and empty the bird bath fairly quickly. We tried different nozzle sizes but even the low bubbling ones emptied the bird bath. Others may have a different experience but I did read this in the comments as a primary concern for others, and the book describes several methods of helping to prevent this so obviously is an issue for others. Net, neat idea but for bird baths it's impractical. If you have a small fish pond or other water feature that's larger it indeed would work well.

Our bird bath is located under some trees to keep the water cooler in the bird bath, so when the sun was out the fountain kept starting and stopping. The birds around my house were afraid of it. That might be because it was cutting off and on, but the birds abandoned the bird bath until we removed the fountain. It was unsuccessful at our house. We were hoping the birds would play in it, but it didn’t happen.
Two out of five attachments are missing still I'm keeping it. Fountain is working perfectly.

I have a bird bath that I put this in. The arms that stick out keep it from moving around and shooting the water out of the bath. It will work if the sun is directly out and over it but it can get sluggish if not completely sunny. The plastic piece gets clogged up sometimes so the fountain part doesn't always work really great. I guess it helps overall to keep the water moving.
Worked great until about 3 days after return deadline. Lights continued to work but pump stopped working
Pumps well for my fountain but get hot at outlet plug in!

It is an okay pump but nothing special. received it today and added the connector(The one I bought locally) to the wires, that I need(It does not come with a plug-just 2 bare wires). Wiring is very thin. Am guessing 22 to 24 gauge wire. Really too small for a max 3 amp motor. Had to fix a loose connector from the red wire that plugged into the motor. The connector had not been crimped enough and was loose on the motor plug. Also noticed that the motor is not completely encased. You can see that on the description page of this motor. That is not good. No matter where this motor is installed(inside or outside), dust and moisture will get into the windings. It is not a waterproofed motor and does not claim to be. I will be using mine on a 15 gal sprayer pump pulled behind my lawn mower. Dust will get into it and I have to be careful if it starts to rain while using it. As stated by other reviewers, the 2 small clamps that come with it are useless. Go buy a decent pair, if you cannot reuse the ones on your bad motor. I also have to reverse the motor/pump 180 degrees from the old bad pump-as the water flow through it is opposite. All in all, it is not bad for $22.00. Will install it tomorrow and see what the pressure is like. If I can get 6 months use out of it, I will be happy. 6/25/2018--Installed motor/pump today. Will have to buy another piece of intake line(From inside of tank to input plug on motor) due to having to reverse the motor position 180 degrees. Intake line is now about 8 inches to short. Pressure is not bad but not real great either. It will do what I need it for but would not recommend this motor. 7/22/18 edit-Pressure turns out to be pretty good. After 2 uses, had to turn down the pressure as I was going through too much weed killer to quick. Nice pump but the exposed windings are my main issue...
Have gotten two pumps so far and they only last a few days before quitting.

I wanted to love this so much! The directions were easy to follow, set-up was a breeze, and it made a beautiful fountain. My plan was to plant flowers along the perimeter of a large pot, then put a smaller pot in the middle for the fountain. Unfortunately, the pot I used is too small in diameter (8”), so all the water splashes out of the pot and it runs out of water too quickly. It even splashes over the side of the larger pot on the bottom, which is 14” in diameter. I went through 1.5 gallons of water in about 1/2 hour. I’m bummed this is so impractical because it looked so good. I’m going to see if I can find something wide enough to contain the water so it can be reused instead of splashing out.

The thing about this pump is it requires perfect conditions to operate. A spot that you know is going to be sunny (Clouds permitting) at as many hours as can be. However, a butterflies shadow will interrupt the panel and cut off your pump.
The pictures do it no justice, it was just way too small for what I needed it for

All solar products I've ever experienced have 1. Diminished productivity with lower light levels; 2. Advised "full sun" by the manufacturer.These fountains work fine when the solar panel is completely sun-exposed. But there is no useful in-between. Even a 10% or less shading allows the pump to cease operating. The sellers ad did not disclose this very well. I was under the distinct impression it would work just like any other. The pools in working with have shifting partial shade through the day. These pumps will spurt water only during brief periods of total sun, no shadows.

This is a nice little fountain that works well. I mainly planned to enjoy it during the daytime so nighttime operation was not a big deal. That’s good because the battery power doesn’t last that long. The worst part about the fountain is the weight distribution. The fountain motor and battery are all on one side of the fountain, causing it to tilt sideways. I have yet to attempt to add Wait to the other side to balance it out, but this is a design issue to be aware of.
Ok product didnt compare at all well in a pond to similar priced solar pumps with a panel.
This is an ok solar fountain. It works fairly well in full Sun, however, anything less than full Sun and it doesn’t do anything.
This tiny pump can lift the water column in 1/2 Vinyl Tubing 5 feet, not 5M (Five Meters) as advertised.For what it is, it's fine, and a deal.

We have tried both this filter and the box filter and both work pretty well with some drawbacks. The biggest complaint is that although we use the largest 1900 gph pump, the largest corrugated pipe and that is connected to solid pvc piping, the connector from the filer to the pump is only 1” diameter. This cuts down on the flow of the pump drastically and thus makes for a smaller waterfall. The cylinder prefilter needs to be cleaned frequently! We don’t have fish to make the pond dirty, but get a lot of pine needles and pond worms in it. The box filter can go quite a long time without maintenance, but it is hard to make it stay on the bottom of the pond. I fill the box with 5 small rocks, but sometimes it will still rise to the top and cut off water intake to the pump. It is also difficult to screw it onto the pump with the rocks inside. If I cannot find a way to attach larger tubing to each of these devices, I am going to try putting the slotted cover back on the pump and place the whole pump in a mesh bag.
This unit has leds for night, but I'm 4 days with abundant light, the LEDs peter out before dusk.The pressure is ok but not like the pictures at all.
Good product and nicely made would have given 5 star but instructions where not good had to figure out in my own and the cord is short so limited to where I could put
I was replacing my existing pump thought I had ordered same one, but once I hooked it up realized it didn't go have a on off switch like my old one.

This worked great at first. With a full birdbath it worked fine, but as soon as the water level dropped at all it didn't work. Also, the holes are so tiny they are easily clogged. So it's cute, but you get what you pay for.
Great design to keep in center of pond. Color is really good, but the water flow in the fountain sometimes works and sometimes doesn't. Disappointing

This pump, well pumps. It works great. However it makes a lot of impeller noise. As a result the pump had to go back.If you have an application where it is not important that it be quite i would highly recommend this pump.

I had this pump in my fountain for 3 weeks and it completely stopped working. It's not clogged or damaged, the motor just stopped. The ad said good for koi pond, but it's tiny! Good for a bird bath maybe. None of the connector pieces actually fit into each other, so we had to jerry rig it to make it work. If my husband wasn't as handy as he is, I would have had to return it. Surprisingly, it shoots a pretty big fountain of water! I give it one star for assembly, but 4 stars if you can actually get it working as it does the job and it's a good price.
I am not very impressed with the power of this pump I can barely get it to pump water was
I received these on Sunday and used 2 right away. It is now Wednesday and as of this morning 1 is not working.

The plastic stabilizers could be a bit longer. Too short even for a bird bath. When first installed, the pump will not be consistent. I was told to fully charge the fountain for a couple hours and that worked.
Directions were not clear, but it works well. only thing i can’t understand- i have a fairly deep birdbath, and after a little while, all the water is almost gone? why?
Keep a watchful eye on this product. Purchased for bird bath. Must constantly provide water or they do not work properly. Used in a pool, it could drain your pool, be careful.
No longer floats level after about a month lights dont work and now the tube I. The middle blew off and the fountain cannot work without it. Pump works but that all.

owned it for over 1 year for a 125g pond. after 1 year the pump loses power. now its pumping half the water it was when it was new. i cleaned it hoping it would help but it didn't change. i bought different pump to replace this one as it seems like its on its way out.
Ordered in hopes it had enough lift but sad to say it did not. Thought they may be strong enough, but no luck. No fault of the pump. So had to return them

I loved this fountain, and it worked great === for awhile. All of a sudden it stopped working. Took it apart and cleaned it. Left it in the sunshine to charge up--- nothing. I have had this less than a year (purchased in August 2023) and am not happy. Should last longeer than a few months.

The media could not be loaded. Would have been 5 stars when new because it looked so nice; but, it hasn’t lasted as it should with the intended/original features.I loved this last summer when I got it. I was happy that I spent the extra money over previous fountains. The colors & fountain at night were truly beautiful.BUT by the end of the summer, the lights didn’t change like before…. Not in a consistent sequence that lit up the water spray as colors changes. It still worked as a fountain & lights did come on, but disappointing by the end of the summer. It’s like the lights were dying (fizzling out? Shorting?). A couple of the small light sections (not sure what to call them) don’t change color…. They’re colored, just don’t change or project.I’m still using it. I cleaned it (as I’ve done before). Lights come on but they’re hit or miss & nowhere near as ‘magestic’ as before. It was so cool!I want another one because it made me happy last year, but I don’t want to spend the money every season.I’m compelled to write a review now because I was initially very happy with the purchase, but when I see it now I’m disappointed. I understand there was a year warranty & I missed that window, so obviously my neglect there.I’m sharing pics from last year. The fountain would be all one color, then change to the next color. Now (pic/video taken 7/20), the fountain works, but the lighting isn’t what it was.So, I’m conflicted in my recommendation…. Really nice/fun at first, but won’t last.

This may not be a fair review, but I can only report my experience and let the readers reach their own conclusion. I have a 4,000 gal. pond, presently with no vegetation. I do live in an area subject to substantial wind blown debris (leaves, seed pods, mown grass, etc.) too numerous to effectively skim from the surface. Therefore, the pump is clogged with both large and small particles and must be cleaned on a weekly to bi-weekly basis. My pump is a Little Giant, rated at 3,200 GPH., with two discharge ports, one to the filter the other directly to the waterfall. This splits ths discharge into two equal, more or less, quantities of 1,600 GPH. The filter's internal parts further reduce its discharge to about 1250 GPH.I was sure bagging the pump would solve the large debris problem, but immediately on enclosing the pump and placing it back on line, the discharge was about one-half its unbagged quantity. Seems the mesh of the bag in itself was acting as a blockage by small debris. I left it to run for the next 24 hours. That evening we had a tremendous storm which resulted in flooding the yard and washing soil and other debris into the pond. Later I noticed the pump discharge was a trickle. When I lifted the pump from the pond the bag was completely covered with soli particles which were blow or washed in by the preceding storm. Good news is that the pump itself was clog free, so I guess I could say the bag did its job to protect the pump.End of story, this may be the answer for those with a small, debris free pond. If you do decide to bag you may want to increase your pumps discharge. if you are in an area such as I, and/or you cannot increase your pump's capacity, you may wish to avoid the bag. For a small pond, easily skimmed of debris, the bag might work.

Fountain runs strong. There is no way to secure the fountain to the foundation provided, or to the bottom of the pond. Suction cups would have been brilliant! Have it propped up with rocks but a breeze will likely blow it over :-(

This is a very good pump relay but avoid putting it with an Orbit controller as it may initially work but will fail to engage later in service. I believe the Orbit products do not put out the required amperage to engage the relay and you will get a "double clunk" as it tries to engage and the Orbit timer will indicate pump failure.

Bought to wash my dogs with warm water in the back yard. No included hose adapter. Other users report that a 3/4-IN MHT x 1/2-IN FIP adapter will work to connect a hose. This is false. There is no standard off the shelf adapter to convert the discharge threads to a garden hose (MHT) male fitting. The only solution is to buy a sacrificial hose and attach to the barbed adapter included with the pump. I used a 15' 5/8" $15 garden hose from lowes attached to the smallest adapter. Pressure was barely adequate for washing the dogs.

This was amazing when I first used it. I changed a nozzle that didn’t work for my display and went back to the original and the fountain hasn’t worked the same since. Most of the time the water spouts but the lights no longer work. Bummer!

The Biling Solar Pond Aerator with Battery Backup, 3 Modes Solar Air Pump Hydroponics Air Pump, Solar Powered Pond Bubbler for Outdoor Fish Pond Stock Tank Aquarium works, it puts out bubbles but slightly. I wouldn't go to deep or the bubbles would barely blow. I would put it in a 10-15 gallon tank not a pond. I replaced this pump with one that burned out. The burned out pump I had running would churn the water as if it had undertow ripples. This pump barely moves the water with it's highest settings. I'm going to keep this pump because I like the fact it runs on solor, so far it comes on when the sun comes up and runs for a while after the sun goes down. For this reason and this reason only I'm going to keep this pump. Would I recommend this pump for a deep pond or tank no!. But if fishing and you want to keep the fish alive yes it would be great for that. Otherwise no, I don't recommend this pump for ponds and deep aquariums.

This controller has little impact on my 2.8 Amp 3/4 HP pump. I think the current draw of the motor has to be higher than mine is for the controller to slow it down. This slows my pump a little, but it also starts making a worrisome noise when i use it for that. I just leave it on full, and use it as an on/off switch for my pump.

The media could not be loaded. Like the title says, it works but is surprisingly loud. I'm using it as a coolant pump for a CNC router, and imagine that some people use it to cool their CPUs, so it's likely in their bedroom, so be aware. The video doesn't do it justice - that's as quiet as it gets. If I lower it to the bottom of the bucket it gets much louder. Will be contacting the seller to see if this is "normal", or if I got a dude.Edit: The manufacturer was initially very responsive, agreeing that it's loud, asked for pics, and asked me to check several things. Good little fountain for the price. We fully charged the batter once received and it last about 3.5 hours . The lights are bright and definitely add character to our pool. The fountain is actually about 2ft in the air so provides a nice accent to the pool as well. Happy that we purchased. Definitely would not cool an above ground pool down much during the Texas summers.
The product itself was acceptable, however the power of the fountain was disappointing. Didn't find it was very tall at all.Thanks!

Im updating a fairly negative review I previously left. Although it's definitely not ideal that blunt end wires have to be connected and it would be helpful to have a manual showing how all the parts go together, the owner of the Amazon store contacted me directly after some not super productive correspondences with Amazon chat and provided clear answers that showed a strong understanding of my question and the product along with offering a substantial (and id say generous) partial refund on the product. Id stand by my initial complaints about it the kit requiring wiring and not having good instructions for combining the separate parts, but in the end I did receive good customer service and the issue resolved.Initial Experience:I don't know if the system works. If you order this you will receive a solar panel, some additional wires, and a pump with their own manuals but no instructions on how to combine them.To connect the solar panel and pump directly requires connecting two blunt end wires which isn't a trivial task, although I'm sure it's super simple to people more experienced in this. Not only do additional connectors need to be bought, but when I've contacted customer service several times to have them recommend a connector or further guidance on how to connect the blunt end wires they just send me back a diagram showing that black goes to black and red goes to red, which is already on the listing, and doesn't help actually physically making the connection.Additionally, the pump came with a manual saying that intricate prep like greasing and pulling back the wire coverings was required for the pump or the warranty would be voided, but that had appeared to already be done for my pump (as confirmed by the company) but is another example of the materials poorly matching the instructions.I hope to get this working with only $15 or so in extra parts. After about 6 back and forth a with their customer service, I'm largely giving up on them and trying to make it work with friends with more electrical experience.

The manual indicates that the company is to include some oring grease and possibly some other pieces for an electrical splice. The company never returned any of my calls asking about this. Also no wiring diagram is provided on how to wire the solar panel, battery and pump to the control panel as to which wires go where.
It was okay but not for my application

I bought the small unit as a larger one I had ordered (same mfr) hadn't shipped after a week and Amazon couldn't tell me with any certainty when it would arrive. I had to cancel that one and get one that promised two day arrival. My rating is with the understanding the pump has only been running for a week now. So I am really not addressing longevity. I am using the pump in an outdoor fountain and for that I would say it is undersized. The description says it can pump to six feet and includes a fountain as a use. My 3 level fountain is maybe four feet high (and not that big) yet at full open it works but not much "oomph" coming out of the top, and this is brand new with no debris or hard water buildup impacting performance. I wouldn't go any less than something in the 400-600 GPM for an outdoor fountain if I had to do it all over again. An aquarium should be no problem. Also, pay close attention to the two connections that come with it. They are very small and if you are trying to connect to a threaded hard plastic pipe to move the water up to the top of the fountain, you are likely to have connection issues. The bigger pumps generally come with more connection adapters. This one is more suitable to plastic tubing. Other than that, size is nice and compact and it is easy to install and is quiet. I actually bought this brand for the dry burning protection. Only time will tell on that feature. So just pay more attention to the description and measurements than I did to make sure it will meet all of your needs.

I've had my Aero Garden for about 4 yrs and this style pump always needs to be replaced like every 6 months, the last time I ordered it only lasted barely a month, but they sent a replacement so that was good, but they guarantee a 1 yr warranty which I wished I would have known, but I do now

I ordered the green. Read the reviews about it being lighter than expected...yes, it is lighter - a soft silver-sage color (not too blue like teal/not too yellow like olive). I will be keeping as it works for my needs. I am concerned about the fold creases throughout. I washed it in cold and dried it in a cool dryer but they'er still there. I'm giving it time and then might try washing warm/drying hotter but I don't think it should be ironed (?). Quality it good though with a medium weight - more bedspread weight than light comforter weight/thickness

The product was loved by my daughter. We had no issues, it connected easily, charged and the sound was good. Now that we had the product issues are arising. The right side is very low, I’ve cleaned it but it was rarely used because she used one side only. The left is not going on, doesn’t indicate if it’s charging and no sound is coming out. I’ve watched the video for troubleshooting but nothing complies to our situation. I know It’s been a long time but Im trying to connected to the company but there is no site to help. I just want to know what I can do to fix the problem. If they only last this long then that would really suck.

I have not had these a year now two different luggage out of three luggage wheels are broken. All three liner are broken and inside zipper broke on two. The personal size I used once and the liner and zipper is broken. I would use these for a quick trip, don't expect it to last long.I ordered these for our vacation for spring break. The inside liner broke on two of the three luggages. On the big luggage the wheel busted while it was being unloaded out of the van. When my son pulled it out and it hit the ground the wheel busted off. The screws pulled through the plastic. I wasn't out there so I don't know how bad it it the ground. Other than that they are great for the price.
It works, but the zippers are not strong and the clasp inside is not strong either, it is good for very few trips a year, not for many.
It works, but the zippers are not strong and the clasp inside is not strong either, it is good for very few trips a year, not for many.

Five weeks, 11 time zones, 33,000 km by air, and 5,000 km driving overseas. <23 kg and <7 kg [for those who know the drill], but never needed to open the "expansion zippers" on either hard bag. Bought a *second* set for my 13 yo daughter, so this review reports on BOTH sets, which had similar problems.a) Nearly every screw on the extendable dragging / pushing handles came loose, the first one by the third airport. We scrounged a tiny screwdriver and kept resetting the things, but had not my farm-girl noticed the problem and fixed it temporarily with the nail-file on my toe-nail clippers, it would have been a huge PITA. Now home, we will reset all of them with Loctite. Too expensive for the Chinese manufacturers, apparently.b) Nearly every internal zipper failed, on all four "hard-case" pieces, and the only zippers on two of the four (much smaller) soft-case pieces. They split apart, jammed, and were generally uncooperative on a consistent basis. Inexcusable, since an extra 10 cents per zipper probably would have taken care of the sucky-quality problem.c) The fabric for the zip-close sections of the "hard case" luggage ripped in a couple of places. Annayance, not problem, but SHEESH, people, this is not high-dollar stuff I'm asking you to fix.d) The "hard case" is not as "hard" as suggested. I had one "casualty" even though well-packed and set to contain any mess.We'll keep using this luggage, since it's basiclly decent, but if you're a serious traveller -- like 150,000 or even 100,000 ... go up a notch for quality.
The luggage it self is sturdy but the zip keep give trouble to run smoothly. And the zip do not extend

They seem durable, they look good it is the color I wanted, they expand well and hold a lot. I am currently using the carry on bag as my toiletry bag because I ordered a toiletry bag and it never showed up and the carry on works great as a toiletry bag. The lock is a joke I took them off and left them at my house it's like a child's diary play lock they don't weigh much at all. Now the cons. The handles that extend out seem week and flimsy like they will break any minute, the bags don't stand up well because how the wheels are and the zippers like to stick and when I got the luggage the zipper things were closed but the zippers teeth were separated (if that makes sense) all in all I am happy I got these when I did because if I got them a few days later I would have been pissed that I spent money on them. I bought these in desperation.

This luggage look awesome, however they are not sturdy. My husband took them on his trip and I felt it was going to pop (not sure if the hoodies are too bulky). I did pack with the weight restrictions under 50lbs. The size is comfortable. Was not stop for the carry on size I guess it depends on airline & staff.

I loved these cases the first day I got them but then I took the large one on a international flight. When I returned home the zipper lock was broken (easily repaired) but the pull handle foundation was also broken in the body of the suit case. I was expecting it to be metal but it was made of plastic. The suit case functions the same way but I know in a short time that pull handle is going to fall off.
The item is beautiful but not very good quality. Not easy to meave, to move the luggage you cannot bend. Always should stand straight. I would rate 3. Color and design good

This suitcase is small of course it is carry on size but it’s really cheap light weight plastic and very aware it does not zip to expandThe large bag that comes with it may save the day I’m sure more items will fit in the bag than in the suitcase
OK its cute luggage but they way they have the inside zipper, you have to kind of fight with it to zip even when its empty. Not the smoothest rolling either. It's cute though

I really wanted to love this set. But, the wheels don’t perform as they should.Rolling to & from desk at resort took more effort to keep balanced than should have.The inner packing bags were a nice plus.I will return if that’s an option. Only used 1X

Love the suitcases but was sent a Champagne color instead of the Cement Grey. Not exactly good business but the color is tolerable. Suitcases seems sturdy and the wheels are very quiet. Great buy BUT if getting the color you ordered is important to you I suggest you pass on this company.

When I first opened the box, i noticed what appeared to be scuffs in the largest suitcase. Upon removing them from the packaging, I realized they had a "protective film" covering the suitcases. This immediately brought to mind the question "if this is a durable finish why does it require a protective film?" I began removing the film and encountered 2 primary issues. First, I have arthritis and chronic tendonitis in my hands, it has taken me almost an hour to get the majrity of the film off 3 suitcases. The film does NOT come off easily at all. Second, with out the use of something like a utility razor, there is NO way to get all the film removed (see pics). The film simply stretches and tears to shreds when you try to remove it from the edges and fasteners. I would prefer to not have to take a razor or knife to my brand new suitcase before I even have the chance to use them. So my brand new suitcase set looks quite ragged, as if the finish is peeling. Why, if a protective film was necessary for shipping, did the manufacturer not make certain the film was not trapped under every edge of every fitting to allow for full remaval. And if the manufacturer was confident in the durability of the finish, was a protective film necessary in the first place? Another concern is they feel rather cheap. There is a flimsiness to the structure and fittings that does not inspire confidence. Also, there are no included instructions on how to reset the lock codes from 0-0-0. My next step will be searching online to try and figure out how to reset the codes for some degree of security for my belongings.On a positve note, the color is lovely as is the current finish and design. The zippers, handles, and wheels all move easily. They are lightweight. And they were inexpensive.As a side note, I bought a simlar set of a different brand for my son at the same time I bought these for myself. The price of the other set was comparable. It felt much more durable and did not have a protective film. My suggestion to anyone looking to purchase a new suitcase set is keep looking. There are other sets in this price range without the hassles I have encountered simply removing these from the packaging.*I travel several times per year for work and pleasure. If I don't forget, I will update my review at a later date once I have put these to use a few times.

First of all, the luggage comes wrapped in a plastic film that took me 2hours to get off, had to use an exacto knife around corners and edges to remove. Once off, luggage shines beautifully. Very cute set (I get a few compliments in the airpots when people see them) but not well made. Very thin plastic shell, wheels cute but too small for luggage to maneuver smoothly, if luggage is packed to the max it tips over when trying to roll. Ive taken all three pieces on two trips now, by the second trip, on arrival the smallest luggage, the plastic around wheel was busted after I checked it under the plane. These also do not expand or have a tsa lock. If you want cute luggage, go for it, if you want luggage that's going to last and be reliable I'd look elsewhere.
I'm using the luggage for the first time and the handle is very flimsy. I may be returning
Thin flimsy plastic. Easily dents and leaves a crease. Maybe it will survive one flight

This set seems to be durable enough to last for several years, but not the strongest luggage set I own nor have owned. We purchased another name brand set for my wife which had a slightly different locking mechanism that felt smoother and stronger. Have returned this set for these reasons and will be purchasing another set. Looks good and will probably work for some. Good luck if you do.

first trip, one month old, and already the top handle and one zipper tag is coming off the big luggage. Not impressed and 30 day return policy is expired. waste of money. too bad, they are light, roll easy, and look nice.

UPDATE: After spending a significant amount of time looking into warranty information on this set, I've discovered that this is NOT true Travelpro luggage.It's made by Travelpro, but it turns out it's a low quality set made for discount retailers. It's not even listed on their website and appears to have no warranty backing. I have had Travelpro for several years so, when the time came for a new set, I hopped on Amazon, found a set that I liked (and was happy to have scored a great deal) and purchased it (shame on me, I guess). I was completely unaware that Travelpro had watered down their product line and were pushing substandard items.It feels like a terrible bait and switch from a company that used to mean quality and durability. If you can, spend the extra money for the Platinum or Maxlite lines or switch brands completely, like I may be doing soon.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I love Travelpro luggage and this is my second set from Amazon (I travel about 40% of the year) but this set is just really frustrating me.The carryon tips over with anything set on top. Neither case rolls particularly easily, but the carryon is a nightmare. The wheels seem to "snag" constantly and the whole thing tips over while I'm rolling it, even on flat hard surfaces.I'm trying to look into warranty options, hoping I got a lemon and it's not a flaw with all of this line. I've been shopping other brands recently due to the issues I'm having traveling with this set.

Loved this set when I saw it and HAD to have it. It was even prettier in person when I got it. That’s the good part. The bad part far outweighs the beauty of it. If you’re going to use it on vacation make sure you bring two other bags because these hold nothing. Normal suitcases have 2 sides you can load up stuff in, this one only has one side and half of it has the metal roller bars in it and the other side had a “net” that you put some nail polish bottles in it and MAYBE a book if it wasn’t a big book. For a normal four day trip I had to bring all four suitcases, (I bought the big one which had a little one in it and then I bought the smaller one which also had a little one in it). Then, if you’re dumb enough like me and brought it on a plane and let the thugs that throw around your luggage, Will most definitely ruin it. The very first time I used it, when I got to my destination and saw what was left on my bag that came off the carousel was unbelievable! It’s seriously looked like I had dragged it around for years. All the rose gold snaps and locks were all scratched up, the white straps that snap close, one of them is gone. it’s so flimsy and so not durable that I would say the only thing it is good for is to make your room look prettier. It’s not super sturdy, the rollers were not very good, I had to lift it over every threshold because it wouldn’t go over. I’m keeping the two little bags for carry-ons but the other two are ruined. So don’t spend 250 or $500 for this beautiful luggage unless you’re just leaving it out for show So you will not be as disappointed as I was.

I ordered this luggage as the price point was great, and it would be here on time for a work trip. It arrived on time, the packaging was great, and the luggage looked wonderful! The color is a bit lighter than expected, but I really like it!! I used the med sized bag for my trip, it held everything i needed and rolled great! Unfortunately the durability just isn't there. I had a direct flight (only 1.5 hours) and when I picked up my bag, it was already damaged. There is a hole and a couple gouges. I didn't expect it to be perfect, but this seems like alot for such a short trip!! I couldn't imagine what would have happened on a long haul, or if this was on/off loaded multiple times. I understand now, why quality luggage is much more expensive. You definitely get what you pay for!

The product itself is cute. Feels nice to the touch & as pictured. The sound is fair for an affordable electronic. Nothing fancy and gets the job done. The cons did drive me crazy. I needed to sync them to my iPhone all the time. This is especially true when I use it one bud at a time. They also provided the wrong charging cable. I received a micro usb and not a type-c. Overall an okay experience with these.

They came on time bought for the blue and red color as advertised for my 7 yr old grandson, comes with 2 sets, however the EarPods are white. Too late to return but hopefully he won’t be disappointed and think I ordered the wrong one.
But they were a little smaller for his ears
Sound quality is good for the price, connecting to Bluetooth was easy, and they are the perfect size for kids
My dog chewed them up, they stopped working before then and now they won't even connect to anything

Not good for small ears. I couldn't get them to comfortably stay in, and every time you push it back in your ear it activates the pause or play setting. Getting both simultaneously paired, connected, and on was also kind of a mysterious pain. Sound was fine when in. I wish there was a kid or something as it is easy to push them out of the mag charger.
The touch part is really sensitive. And they dont sit in the ear. They kept falling out no matter how i placed them. Sound was still good. Perhaps it was a user error on my part.
It sounds like POOP

The media could not be loaded. When I first opened it, it came with a little scratch even though it was brand new, wrapped in plastic so I have no idea how that happened. I bought it because has such a cute design, the earphones fit snug in my ear and are overall comfortable, noise canceling as well.After maybe almost a month or so using it, the right side just suddenly… stopped working?It works well when you use it but putting it back in its charging case is the problem. The magnet seems to just be rejecting it and the connection keeps interfering with other Bluetooth devices even though I disconnected it several times; I had to “forget device” in order for it to stop completely. I’ve wiped it clean, I tried to press it back in place, I just don’t know what to do at this point.If you want to buy simple, inexpensive Bluetooth earphones, might I suggest not getting these. For sound quality, go for it. Otherwise, don’t.

The product was loved by my daughter. We had no issues, it connected easily, charged and the sound was good. Now that we had the product issues are arising. The right side is very low, I’ve cleaned it but it was rarely used because she used one side only. The left is not going on, doesn’t indicate if it’s charging and no sound is coming out. I’ve watched the video for troubleshooting but nothing complies to our situation. I know It’s been a long time but Im trying to connected to the company but there is no site to help. I just want to know what I can do to fix the problem. If they only last this long then that would really suck.

The media could not be loaded. I Love winnie the Pooh! I was super excited when i found these ear buds. I charged them, used them the next day, everything was fine. The day after i put them in and my left Ear bud kept beeping. The battery was at 10% after being in the case for 2hrs i noticed it still wasnt charging. I noticed on the bottom the connectors arent evenly placed which is causing the ear bud not to charge or hold a proper battery life.
The ear pods are really cool but when I bought them only the right earpiece works and that made me really sad but it still is a coll thing.

I was drawn in by the photos that showed the Fanta can-sized case, but it turns out that picture must have been photoshopped. I was expecting something the size of a mini Coke can, which would’ve been perfect for my car's cup holder. Unfortunately, the case is much smaller than that, which was a letdown.As for the earbuds themselves, they work fine, about what you’d expect for this price range, but they’re not exactly premium quality. The case is cute, and it comes with a very short USB-A to USB-C charging cable, instructions, and the earbuds themselves. They start charging as soon as you put them in the case, and they don’t take too long to power up, which is nice. The soda can case has a USB-C port with a rubber cover and an indicator LED to show the charging status.The touch controls on the earbuds are simple—one tap to play/pause, double tap on the right to increase volume, and double tap on the left to lower it. They fit snugly in my ears and don’t fall out, but don’t expect any sound isolation.All in all, the product photos were a bit misleading, and I feel a bit tricked. If I had known the real size and quality, I wouldn’t have bought them.

This pair of diet coke earbuds has ups and downs.The earbuds comes in a branded box as shown in my first picture with the soda can charging case, pair of earbuds, instructions/information paper, and a very very short USB-A to USB-C charging cable.When you put them in the charging case they immediately start charging and don't take terribly long to charge. I haven't used them a ton but that will come in my downsides. The top of the soda can has a USB-C charging port covered with a rubber cover and it also has a indicator led next to it to show if it is charging or finished.There are touch controls on the ear buds, such as tap once to play/pause, double tap on the right to turn the volume up and double tap the left to turn it down.The earbuds actually fit and stay very well in my ears without coming loose but there is no sound isolation or anything on these.Moving to the downsides, as I just mentioned there is no sound isolation or seal that this forms in your ear so you will hear everything around you and if you have these loud enough, anyone around can probably hear what you are listening to as well. That also brings me to the sound quality, it's just not great. Using a 20$ "gaming" headset produced better clearer sound with more bass than these could produce. I also noticed a few milliseconds of delay between what I see and hear if I connected them to a computer.The soda can isn't the easiest to open to put these back in for charging. There is little to nowhere to grab and because the magnets are good, it stays sealed.For some reason when you use these earbuds via Bluetooth, they ALWAYS are flashing blue on each ear bud to signify they are connected.Overall, not the best headphones but they are official and even in the bluetooth list they show up as "diet coke earbuds" which to me is fantastic so I know what I'm connecting to. The sound quality just isn't the best, the soda can isn't the easiest to open, and the constant flashing blue lights on the earbuds isn't great either. However, they do fit my ears very well, the touch/tap controls work as they should, and they last a decent amount of time just listening to music and other audio.

There is a picture where they detail the measurements in millimeters, and in that same picture they show the can in someone’s hand but it must be photoshopped because I got the sense these were the size of a coke mini can. That was kind of what I was hoping for; not that the earbuds would be ginormous, but that the case, sitting in my cars cup holder could be mistaken for a coke. These are too small for that.Otherwise, they work fine. They’re as good as anything in this price point but not much bigger than other earbud cases.While the words didn’t technically lie, I find this product page a bit misleading based on the photoshopped product shots. I’ll own my part in falling for it, but is that how you want to buy products? Knowing what I know now, I wouldn’t buy again.My rating system breakdown:1 Star = Safety hazard, gross misrepresentation of product, or flat out doesn't work2 Stars = Needs improvement3 Stars = Meh, likely wouldn't buy again.4 Stars = Meets expectations5 Stars = Exceeds expectations

THIS IS THE MOST UNDERATTED ALBUM IN PRIORITY RECORDS HEYDAYS. I CAN'T FIND ANY OTHER MUSIC BY THEM EXCEPT 1 OTHER SONG ON A COMP. CD THAT IS MORE THAN TEN YEARS OLD. IF ANYONE KNOWS WHERE I CAN FIND SOME MORE MUSIC BY THESE GUYS LET ME KNOW. HASTA, AND DRINK OLD ENGLISH

The sensor installed and worked OK. Make sure you have the special 7/8" socket with the slot in the side in order to remove the old one. This O2 Sensor is not exactly as pictured, it deos not have the metal spring cable support on top of the sensor. I wonder how long it will hold up since the cable is not supported very well and seems to be a bit shorter than the original.

A wealth of important and useful information. However, AVID editors will find not one word in this book about preparing material and exporting from AVID systems to DVD Studio Pro 4. It's bias is Final Cut, which is the default standard for this guide

This product is affordable. it arrived with all parts and some (extra screw was nice). The instructions are horrible. Drive is slow and USB port was rusted and/or corroded. comes with tools too! I was expecting at the price just the enclosure and nothing else (except a decent manual which is mandatory).Pro: affordable, comes with partsCon: you get what you paid for, Damaged port, Piss poor user manualTip: Dont use this for important data. This is not for back up.

HDD Enclosures are always confusing as there are so many available in the market with so different ways of connecting peripheral/auxiliary devices. I went through a large list of HDD Enclosures and after couple of days purchased this item - waited for couple of days only to find out that this enclosure does not fit my internal hard disk. The board had some soldering blemishes but never had a chance to test the connectivity. The build looks pretty ok and it was a great ide to include the screw driver as part of the package - It was really helpful. Be sure of what Hard disks you are using - SATA is common these days. I ended up buying a SATA to USB cable that served the purpose of transferring data from my old hard disk to a newer one. This product may be good for the price advertised but ensure that this one serves the purpose. This would fit only HDD of laptops cos its 2.5inch and would not work with the bigger solid state drives - the ones which are normally used for desktop

The device works, but you have to be careful with it. The IDE connection is not very deep and doesn't seem to be reliable. On the top of that, IDE connection is the only thing that hold the drive inside the case. While I am moving around with enclosure, I can hear the hard drive rattling inside.The Enclosure is OK for the stationary setup, but would not work for any mobile tasks.

This product is not for you if your going to use this as you primary portable hard dive. The only use for this enclosure is to retrieve data from another HDD.The solder joints are weak and look like their about to break.This product is not going to last very long so get a this is not for you if your going use it long term.

Apparently, not all 2.5" laptop drives are the same, or perhaps what i have isn't exactly a 2.5" drive (IBM Travelstar, DCXA-210000, out of an old Dell laptop(?)). It didn't fit in the aluminum case... real close, but no cigar. Maybe if this drive had ever so slightly rounded edges along it's length it would fit.Fortunately, this is acceptable for my needs. It electronically edge-connected to my drive & provides the USB2.0 interface, but i do have to leave the drive out of the case, naked / exposed. O-well. 'Works.Karl*----->

First things first, this enclosure is not blue, as listed. It is silver, and looks very similar to my other enclosure, which causes me some confusion, and is why I bought (or attempted to) a blue one.Otherwise, it works fairly well. Can get a little hot since it lacks fans, but keep it off of any insulating surface and it's fine.

it took me a few extra minutes to plug in my drive and the usb cable came with the drive didn't work at first, but I figure out that problem and now it works great. Quiet, fast and slim.The vendor sent me a replacement usb cable no extra charge.Thx.

As an enclosure, it seems to work fine. I knew it was cheap; we'll see how it fares over a period of time.My only quibble is the cable. I don't mind the Y-cable for use with computers that need the extra connection for power. It's the fact that the cable is a nonstandard USB A-A. Almost every other USB drive is A-B or A-mini B. Why does this matter? Because if you lose the cable, it'll be a hassle to replace it. As a consultant I have a lot of external drives, and don't want to worry about keeping specific cables with specific drives.

Well, i have had it for a while and it was working. But then my computer suddenly stopped realizing it was even plugged in. So i tried another computer, and then my laptop, but nothing. I think it may be the driver, but I am just warning you people that you need to be careful.

This drive works as advertised, my issue comes from the fact that the connector on the drive is a USB A connector. This makes things a little tough if you lose the cable - because it isn't easily replaced with either a mini or micro USB end, or the standard USB B connector. I doubt I'll get another one - though once connected it did work as expected.

Like the title says, it does what it needs to and nothing more. I had to et one of these to do a data recovery from my brothers laptop.The case itself is well designed accept for the back plastic cover. It will take some jimmying to get it back on once the harddrive is installed in it. BUT YOU CAN DO IT.Also, don't loose the original usb cable. Its not proprietary but its a cross-over USB.Performs as expected and costs almost nothing compared to the alternatives I've seen in the past

Works fine with Windows XP but unfortunately I bought this to access data on my old drive from a computer using Windows 7. Windows 7 says the drive is invalid and only give me an option to format it. Odd too since the data on the drive was all created in Windows 7. I have not yet tried that because I wanted to pull some data off of it first. I had to connect it to my work computer that uses Windows XP and share over the network to pull data.On a side note: this comes with a USB cord that has three plugs and no instructions at all on which one goes to enclosure, which one is supposed to plug in or if it even matters. One of the plugs is longer and thicker my guess is that one is for USB ports that are further away from where you want to put the drive but then I don't know since there are NO INSTRUCTIONS.

It has teenie-tiny phillips screws to hold in the top. Had to stuff some folded paper down inside because the case is longer than my HD and it kept sliding back and forth. The did supply a little phillips driver for those screws but the head of the supplied driver was way too big for the screws. What a joke. It worked once mounted and modified but it should have some foam or something to account for different length HDs and some click-in type of mounting instead of screws like those that are in your glasses. These screws are going to get lost and screw into plastic directly so eventually will strip out its socket. It does have a nice slip-in case and sleek color.

This product was easy to set up and install. With a DVD it has pretty good surround sound and appears to be well balanced. The wireless rear speakers work well. One feature which was suprisingly missing, however, was the ability to connect the sound from your digital cable box by means of a fiberoptical connection so that you would get true dolby when the show is broadcast in dolby 5.1.

This book provides examples of how to do certain special effects.It was definitely more of a "tips and tricks" book than it was a learning resource. Just follow the steps, and go "WOW" just like the title.It doesn't really explain in detail how the trick was done and why you're doing a certain step. Most photoshop gurus will just scoff at this book, and most newbies will walk away amazed, but no smarter about photoshop than before they read it.The latter portions of the book was nothing more than a summary of the different photoshop filters found in commercial filter packages. I question why thoese filters were even in the book; it seemed like advertising that does not benefit the readers.

I absolutely loved the anime of Cowboy Bebop. This book is set in the same universe with the same characters. Their stories, however, have changed. The way we meet Ed, Faye, Ein, and the history of Spike and Jet are different based on the author's take on the characters. Some might not like this, but I like the new twist on their relationships. Plus the author has added a whole new badguy! Since the TV series is over, it is also like getting all new Bebop stories. I haven't read the rest in this manga series so I don't know how they continue, but if you are dying for more Spike and don't mind the alternate reality, I highly recommend the book!If you don't want the stories to change, consider picking up the Cowboy Bebop series by Hajime Yadate and Yutaka Nanten, ISBN#1931514917, simply called Cowboy Bebop Book 1 etc. These are more like continuing adventures that take place in between what would have been a TV episode.

This book was ok, but I was hoping for more. It's really just goes into the specs and options for each model. It include's production data, units sold, etc. and tha's about it. Pretty much just the facts...

This is a great textbook, very comprehensive information on the subject, the the writing could be clearer. It would be hard to make this subject into a page turner, but in this book it's sometimes difficult to pick up the relevant information because the writing is so dry.
i've read 100 prophecy outlines. this one's good. it's an encyclopedic, a-z style outline. takes a while to read from beginning to end.

Title says it all. Wasn't real impressed with this particular solo CD. I love his other solo work & keyboards/violin with UK. Actually got to see UK in a bar room In Baton Rouge, LA. The audience might have been 300 people max. Very intimate setting & excellent music with prodigy prog. musicians.

i like RBL and Black-C a lot. Taydatay is my favorite from 11/5. So this combo made me expect a lot. Production is not as great as I would have thought, but there are some cuts (at least a few from black c) that dont sound too rapmaster keyboard-drum machine style. I liked the title track w/ big mack. taydatay/big mac collabo album would be good. as i said, the lyrics overshadow the production- sean t (he did this title track), ric roc (its hard 2 b-legit) have the best in the bay right now..

I have to say..I just started using this series and thus far, the written portion is great! But how could I have known it required a very expensive CD? I sure wish that part had been stated before I ordered this series.

Offutt's strength is his prose and characterization, but his narrative is a little off here. A shame really, because his first memoir was solid all around. He himself admits to not knowing what the Holocaust story has to do with his own return to Kentucky and, quite frankly, neither do I. It seemed thrown in as maudlin filler and was blatantly incongruous.The ending seemed rushed too. "I am saying good-bye" and "I want to stay. I am ready to leave." I know he can do better and the rest of the book proves that he can do better.Still though, there are some stylistic gems here. Offutt uses words and characters wonderfully. You'll love them and understand them. He's a very solid writer and students learning to write creatively can learn a lot from his craft--overtly and subtly.Worth a read.

Three stars may be generous for the game. There is really only one way to consistently score: take the ball right to the hoop while using the "juke" moves. Short range jump shots don't work. Post-up game: forget it. Anything resembling a real basketball game: forget it. But if you do take the ball to the hoop and use the juke moves and you have one of the star players it is unstoppable. Play LeBron: he'llo score every time. If you like a pure arcade-style game then you might like this one.

I heard Neil say in an interview many years ago that he was going to write a book someday, eight years later I was excited to finally find this book. If you're looking to read a book about Neil the drummer or Neil the musician, you will be sadly dissipointed. If you want to learn about his passion and desire read this book. If your not a cyclist you might not find this book is for you.

Barbarian was a better film, a feast for the eyes, great acting etc, but Destroyer is more humorous and is worth watching for the Princess alone! A bit corny especially in the Wizard scene but all in all a good fantasy film

Conan the Barbarian is back in CONAN THE DESTROYER, 1984 sequel. Without going into a long review, if you liked the first one, rent this one- but chances are you won't be pleased. CONAN THE DESTROYER (1984) Rated: PG (Fantasy Barbarian Violence) 2 1/2 stars out of 5.

Among Arnold's early movies, this one stands out for the eclectic supporting cast. His early movies were remarkedly free of any acting on his part; I suspect he was still learning English then. But one way to make him look better is to hire nonactors, or miscast semiactors. Enter Wilt and Grace. (Later, Richard Dawson). This is as much a collectible as Terminator 2.

"Conan the Destroyer ", this disappointing sequel to the entertaining and well made "Conan the Barbarian" is an example of what happens when studios attempt to broaden the appeal of a movie for younger audiences. This movie tries to inject more slapstick humor and includes "big name" stars (Grace Jones and Wilt Chamberlain), while sacrificing much of the story line, effective characters, and raw action that made the first movie so watchable. The special effects were also weaker and often seemed out of place, making this a real step backwards.If it wasn't for "Arni", it wouldn't be worth the price of the DVD. Recommended only for die hard Conan and "Arni" fans.

After the succesful Conan The Barbarian the inevitable sequel took part 2 years after the first.This time Conan the Cimmerian(Schwarzenegger) must find with the help of a virgin princess a jewel that leads to the horn of a god Dagoth which a evil queen(Douglas) needs to give to their kingdom all the power of the world.Followed by the sorcerer of the first film(Mako) by a cure thief(Lester) and a agile warrior(Jones) they must face all the dangers of such a risky mission.With dign special and visual effects and the final monster made by the creator of ET the film has a whole dign production better than italian imitations(Ator) or cheesy and camp productions(Red Sonja,Barbarian Queen) and at least is entertaining and pleased to watch.
The last batman movie was great, this was plain ordinary. Overrated and far too generously reviewed.
this blu ray its anything you would expect i recomended and people should buy the box set too, thnkx e

Had eagerly awaited this one. Great movie, but the image quality was in no way up to BluRay standards. Not having seen it in the theater, I don't know whether this was by design.That said... Oscar-worthy.

Everybody knows the movie is fantastic, and I'm sure the transfer to blu-ray is equally as impressive, but I received this product with a giant puncture mark through the case. There was no damage to the box, so I assume it had to be due to how the movie was handled in the warehouse. It literally looks like somebody attacked it with a screwdriver. Luckily it didn't damage the disks, but regardless it's still annoying.

I absolutely love this movie. I hate paying $25 for blu ray discs though as even with my top notch equipment it's just not that much better. I already have two versions of the dvd.. yeah i like it that much and wanted the blu ray basically cause the price was right. However i was disappointed as when i got it there was a golf ball type divet in the blu ray which wouldn't allow it to play. I unfortunately had to return it. I am giving this item a 3 star for midway though because i received fast service and it was extremely easy to return at no cost to me.So yes quality control sucked that this got out as it clearly couldn't play for anyone but Amazon customer service support was top notch for returns.

I wasnt planning on watching this movie but decided to last minute. I saw it on the huge screen at IMAX.. special effects and action was great.. heath ledger was fantastic in the role as the Joker.. i had only seen him in romance and drama roles before this, but he really suprised me with this one. He really went out leaving his mark.If you're not a fan of his, or of the Batman series, you might not become a fan from watching this movie, but i do recommend giving it a chance at least. Its a pretty good storyline and even a bit scary towards the end.. i only bought the dvd for a friend, but i wouldnt mind watching it again.Definately watch it if you're a Heath Ledger fan though.. he was awesome in his role and you will love him in this one.

This was a solid movie, but way too long. It was as if they kept putting in another scheme for the Joker to pull off...then another...then another. Why? They could have cut 30 minutes from the movie easily.I have to say that I was expecting much more from Heath. While his performance was certainly solid, it was by no means the oscar winning portrayal I was hoping to see. And for him to have said that the role was so disturbing that it was causing insomnia and a lot of his problems--he clearly had some emotional issues then, because the Joker was actually a lot more tame that I thought he was going to be. All in all a solid movie, but it was too long and over-hyped.

Normally I'm pretty satisfied with my OtterBox purchases, but this one was a bit disappointing. Because the glitter case is clear, it's not made of a hard plastic like the others. For some reason I thought it would be a little harder but it's a flexible plastic. Also, as a side note, don't be dumb like me and use acetone or nail polish remover around this. I melted the side of it within the first couple of days of having it.
Love this kit as it is cheap but feels solid. It is easy to use and is nice and sharp out the box.
So far so good. Very easy to install, easy cleaning, super smooth operation and great water flow.

This is a pretty sturdy, safe alternative to the traditional mandolin (though still use caution). Has several functions that all work decently for the cost. Good for a college student like I was - just starting out and wanting food simply chopped (not pretty).
