Recently, I had the opportunity to experience the renewed HP 17.3" HD Touchscreen Business Laptop, and my overall satisfaction is noteworthy. Let's delve into the notable features and considerations:Pros:Speed and Generous Storage: The laptop, equipped with an AMD Ryzen 5-5500U processor, 16GB RAM, and a combination of 512GB SSD and 1TB HDD, delivers swift performance. The expansive 17.3" touchscreen enhances productivity by providing ample workspace.Windows 11 Pro Elegance: The laptop comes pre-installed with Windows 11 Pro, contributing an elevated level of sophistication and advanced functionalities for an enhanced user experience.Numeric Keypad Convenience: The inclusion of a numeric keypad is a thoughtful addition, offering practicality for tasks that involve frequent numerical input.Versatile Connectivity: HDMI, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and a Webcam provide an array of connectivity options, catering to diverse user needs.Cons:Charging Speed: A minor drawback is the charging speed, which falls short of expectations. Users who rely on quick top-ups while on the move may find this aspect slightly inconvenient.Conclusion:In summary, the renewed HP 17.3" HD Touchscreen Business Laptop impresses with its performance and screen size. While the charging speed is a minor concern, it doesn't significantly impact the laptop's overall functionality.Pros:Swift performance and ample storageWindows 11 Pro sophisticationNumeric keypad convenienceDiverse connectivity optionsCons:Charging speedDespite this minor inconvenience, the renewed HP laptop stands out as a reliable choice for business-oriented users seeking a spacious screen and robust performance.

The 15.6-inch Full High Definition (FHD) Touchscreen Dell Inspiron 15 3000 Series 3511 Laptop with an Intel Core i5-1035G1 processor and an outstanding 32GB of RAM was a recent purchase of mine. I must say that in every way this laptop has surpassed my expectations and is now an integral part of my everyday life.This laptop's primary strength is its outstanding performance. Thanks to the Intel Core i5-1035G1 processor's lightning-fast performance and responsiveness, I can run a wide variety of programs simultaneously with no effort. The 32GB of RAM significantly improves performance, allowing you to work efficiently and without interruptions even when using busy programs.The 15.6-inch full-high-definition (FHD) touchscreen is a joy to work with. Images and videos have never looked so crisp and detailed. The touch features are quick and precise, making my work much simpler and more pleasant than before.The sturdy construction and long lifespan of this laptop further amaze me. The construction is sturdy, and the style is sleek and modern, giving off an air of professionalism. The keyboard's layout and key spacing make for a pleasant typing experience.The Dell Inspiron 15 3000 Series 3511 has an excellent battery life. I'm not interrupted by the need to look for a power source, so I can focus on my work for longer periods of time. This convenience is especially useful for people who are frequently on the go.This laptop has a plethora of ports, making it ideal for use with a wide variety of peripherals. I appreciate the ease with which I can transfer and access my files thanks to the inclusion of USB ports, HDMI, and an SD card reader. I would definitely recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a solid, dependable laptop.
It's bulky, I wanted something smaller than my Dell Latitude 5300 2 in 1 but it seems to be tough and can be charged from the left or from the right. Battery life is similar like my other laptop.

This refurb laptop provides much better specs and performance for $150 than you would get for a $150 new laptop. Granted, the 6th gen i5 and Intel HD graphics are somewhat out-of-date but they are still great for everyday tasks and productivity. I also like how the SSD & RAM are upgradeable, and there is a second RAM slot so it only costs about $15 to buy a second stick of RAM and bring the total to 16GB. And while it is not “officially” upgradeable to Windows 11, I sideloaded it and I’ve got Windows 11 running great on this laptop. The 1080p full HD display is also a definite plus for a laptop of this price. My only complaints are that the laptop arrived with a subpar battery but I contacted the seller and they responded within the hour that a new one was on the way. The keyboard also isn’t backlit but that’s no big deal for me - but if it is to you than I would recommend you confirm with the seller first that it has a backlit keyboard. Overall this laptop is amazing considering its low $150 price tag.

I love my new laptop, but the colors displayed on screen are just ok...not very vibrant, average for my own use, and can be fixed a bit tilting the screen at a better angle. I was online shopping and some of the clothing looked very light and images were not very saturated...I wouldn't recommend this for anyone using this laptop for design etc. Good for basic home use, work use, student use. Beautiful background themes to choose from, excellent Google product use, and I easily installed a wireless bluetooth mouse. The screen is nice and large, especially at this price point of around $200. I bought this on Prime Day and I'm happy with my purchase. I can run Google with many tabs open without any problem. I do wish the speakers were a bit better. I listen to music on my phone or Alexa instead because the speakers are small and located in an odd place....right on the front outer rim of the laptop on either side of where it opens. I used it to watch a movie on my bed and had the volume at max and still had a little trouble hearing everything. The bedding also sometimes blocked the speakers because of their location. Basic volume on regular Zoom meetings, YouTube etc. would be fine. I recommend this laptop for normal basic use...it works fast, beautifully designed and has lots of ports which is very convenient. Another thing I wanted to mention is that it wouldn't turn on at first even after charging for hours. I had googled many troubleshooting ideas and nothing seemed to work. Finally after cursing it and almost giving up, it magically made a "bling" sound and came on. Make sure to charge it from a wall outlet; not an extension cord or power strip. I think it was still in shipping mode, so I had to google what keys to hold down to make it boot up for the first time. There are just those few things, otherwise I love the laptop for my needs, and would recommend Asus products. Touchpad is very quick and responsive. It is not a touch screen monitor...I'm thinking people are confusing touch screen with touch pad. Keyboard is comfortable and battery has been long-running.
like it, less updates, but too big too heavy. less apps. overall is good.

I bought this laptop which was supposed to be in excellent condition but when it arrived one of the two usb ports doesn’t work. So you might have issues with the one you buy. I plan on getting it repaired later on but overall it is a good deal.

Laptop arrived clean and in great condition.Everything worked as expected except my docking station. Called tech support, they were very thorough in troubleshooting and requested the Laptop to be returned. A few days later I received a call that they would be replacing the laptop.Great customer service. Very happy with the purchase and resolution to an unforeseeable problem.100% recommend

I mainly use my MacBook for productivity as well as for more intensive applications like virtualisation which it handles well. However, the battery life isn’t all that great my unit arrived with a battery cycle of around 450 which isn’t bad for a used laptop, but it drains relatively quickly even under a light load. What’s more is that it tends to heat up quite a bit. The keyboard gets uncomfortably hot and the backside can get burning hot, so much so I have to control the fans manually.I’d rate MacBook’s condition as average. On the surface the laptop was clean, however, the display’s anti-reflective coating was noticeably peeling (which looks like the picture I have attached) and the ports were also noticeably dirty. When I opened the inside the computer was incredibly dusty and dirty with grime buildup everywhere; the fans were even clogged by the dust buildup–it clearly had not been cleaned which I would have expected from a refurbished product. Additionally, charger supplied, although genuine, appears heavily used. It has multiple scratches and is bit grime, but works great.
Overall a good product. They could have specified that it's not compatible with Windows 11 due to the processor. I would've waited if I knew.

Honestly when I made the purchase I looked back and read the reviews people left and I decided to gamble on it & im glad I did! I got mine in excellent condition!I believe that the people that had trouble with their computer probably didn’t order in excellent condition and maybe order it in acceptable condition.I will say if you are having trouble with it powering on when you get it, it’s probably the charger cord or the box. I have the Ipad 13 inch (2024) so when I plugged it in to my ipad charger it turned on!When it turned on it was working great. All the keys worked and the touchpad work. Its was light weight and the sound was amazing! The screen play was clean and the camera worked as well. It does tend to get a little heat but something too bad.

This MacBook is honestly very good and I’m impressed. It’s in great condition but it did come dirty and I just cleaned it and everything is fine. I do have concerns about the battery life, maybe it’s because of the game I was playing or something but it went from 100% to 78% in less than 15 minutes. Another thing is the “i” key on the keyboard is a bit stuck and it types out twice like this “ii” but that really about it, everything else is great. This MacBook can handle basic gaming like Roblox and Minecraft. It went through so smoothly. Another thing is when I’m searching the web and try to go to a website, it doesn’t pop up it’s like it’s loading but it’s not. It isn’t with all the websites i look up but it’s with just some of them. Overall a great laptop I recommend!Edit: I think I’m going to bring this rating to a 4. Firstly, I forgot to mention the sound quality, it’s amazing honestly I can have the volume up about three to four notches and it dang near sounds like I’m in a movie theater, but the thing is I’m bringing this down to a 4 because this laptop is pretty old and doesn’t support a lot of things like I can’t even watch Netflix from off this laptop and I don’t even know how to access so many things on here. The App Store is stupid I’m trying to look up how to navigate everything because maybe that’s my problem but I don’t even know what year this thing is let alone know how to find out the year so it’s hard because if I just look up “MacBook Pro” YouTube thinks I’m talking about one of the newer ones. Like I said before this is a pretty good laptop but it’s so outdated and I can barely get any games on here. Like I got steam the other day but steam barely even have fun games that supports macOS. (Just in case anybody wanted to know about downloading steam). This is my review on this laptop.

I've had a pen mouse for years and love them. Recently had to get a new one as I broke my old one. Decided to try this model and it works great. A little caution, though, the left click button can come off if it's dropped so be careful, though it is easy to put back on.

Bought this after Logitech MS Ergo crapped out after 2 years so I can only really compare to the.The cheaper price was nice. The 3rd device is a handy option if you need it. The ball movement isn't as smooth but not far enough off to be much of a factor. The covering is slippery, sometimes I feel like it's going to slip away, the Logitech had actual grip to it. Battery life is about half. Often lags when switching between devices. The plastic base has me afraid I might accidentally snap, feels half as sturdy as the Logitech.Works well enough for the price, though if this craps out in the same amount of time as the Logitech then I'll probably shell out the little extra for the MX.

It’s bigger the mini, but still smaller then regular mouse.I was looking for retractable core mouse in regular size, but most of selling in line is mini mouse. This is the biggest so far I can find on Amazon
Works great, battery life is very good. Certainly not the quality of my aluminum Mac keyboard ... but it's backlit which is what I needed.

The media could not be loaded. The keyboard hardware is very well built, while it is made of plastic, the artificial weights inside it makes it feel premium. I also think the keypresses has a more premium feeling compared to Apple's keyboard. However, they put many software hacks on this keyboard to try to achieve the function row functionality, which causes the following problems:1. Pressing F5 does not start dictation, instead it brings up Spotlight, it is same as pressing F4 button.2. F6 key does not start Do Not Disturb on Mac, instead it puts Mac to sleep.3. The Fn key is not sending the Fn key event. I have the Fn key set to bring up Emoji panel, but pressing it only changes the input method for me.4. Pressing fn + F1, F2…etc does not input F1 F2..etc key press, instead it is still performing multimedia functions such as brightness & volume.Details of the software hacks of this keyboard:The Fn button is not sending the Fn key event, so I can't use the Fn key to bring up the emoji panel, instead it is sending a hardcoded Control + Space keypress event to switch input methods. Same for F3 and F4 keys, they sending hardcoded keyboard shortcuts (e.g. Command + Space) to bring up Spotlight or Mission Control, if you customized the keyboard shortcuts in MacOS, some of the function row keys will no longer work. Since the Fn key is programmed to send Control + Space keypresses, you can not input F1 to F12 by pressing Fn + the function row keys, so if you need to input F1 to F12, then you have to look for other keyboards.I really hope they can fix the software on this keyboard, I have one docking station and 2 MacBooks, I bought this keyboard so that I can use the 2.4Ghz adapter to connect this keyboard to my docking station, so I don't have to switch keyboards when switching between my 2 MacBooks on my docking station.Upon reaching out to the seller about the problems above, the seller is very apologetic and offered a refund, huge kudos to the excellent customer service!
The media could not be loaded. I like the keyboard. Travel distance is pretty short but it still gives a little mechanical keyboard vibe.

I order this keyboard, but a bigger keyboard and a $100 logitech keyboard. This is smaller than I thought it would be, but that isn't really bad. Yes, it would be a little easier if there was a row of buttons for the shortcuts instead of requiring everything to be a combo or triple combo press. But, it works good, the keys have a nice feel, it is easy to type on and the keys are where you expect them to be. You can turn the light brightness up and down. Plus, it has fn-lock, and an fn-lock indicator light, so you can pick whether the shortcut keys (most the F1-F12 keys) act like function keys when pressed or the shortcut keys. It comes with a manual but the instructions are also printed on the bottom of the keyboard which is a nice touch. It's very similar to a laptop keyboard. But yeah, apart from it being a little finicky when you go to pair it the first time, it's a really great keyboard. I almost never use the number pad numbers, and if I did need them for some reason, like I was playing a game, I could just switch to a different keyboard. I really don't see how a Logitech keyboard can be worth 2 1/2 times the price of this one. Granted, the Logitech comes with a dongle and this doesn't so maybe that will be an issues, but you can get a Bluetooth receiver for $10. The Logitech keyboard also comes with special software that will let you map the short keys to different keystrokes in different applications, but most applications already support shortcut key mapping, and Open Source programs like AutoHotKey and TweakKey for windows also allow you to do this for free will 100% for more more and flexibility. But yeah, I'm super happy, can't really speak on the battery life, but hopefully it is good.UPDATE 5/26/24:I didn't notice when I bought the keyboard or even when I reviewed it, but this keyboard comes with Left and Right Windows keys and No Left Ctrl. You have left and right Alt keys, but not left and right control, and a Right Windows. This makes it hard to use Photoshop and Illustrator on Windows because Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- are the default commands for zoom in and out, and if you have to use the left Ctrl key it suddenly requires 2 hands.Thankfully, there are a couple solutions. The easiest is to download Microsoft's PowerToys for Windows and go to the keyboard manager and Enable Key Remapping and then remap that key to Ctrl(left). This I have working.UPDATE:You can use a program called KeyTweak to remap keys in the Windows 10 Registry. I ended up having to do this because the keyboard doesn't have a delete and backspace button. The delete button typically works as a backspace button. You can press fn+delete to have it work as a delete button, but I need an actual delete button like my laptop keyboard has. This is the layout the Logitech MX mini uses (it costs almost $100 though).I used a program called KeyTweak to remap the PrntScreen key to delete in the Windows registry. Unfortunately, this remaps BOTH the print screen key on this keyboard, and the print screen key on my laptop.So, I have to unmap everything. Restart my computer, then map fn+PrintScreen (my laptop's "Insert key") to PrintScreen. Then map PrintScreen to delete. Then remap Left Windows Key to Left Control. And now it works the way I want, except I have to press fn when I press PrintScreen on my laptop, and I no longer have an Insert key, but I literally haven't used an insert key in probably 20 years.The reason I dropped my review to 4 stars is because the wireless keyboard seems to sometimes send double keys, or it will go to sleep (even when plugged in), and then it will miss a key, and then I'll hit it again, and then it will double send the key it missed + the new key. It's literally 6 inches from my laptop, and I wanted to see if I shut off bluetooth and just used USB-C if it would still mess up, but you can't shut off bluetooth and just plug it in :( So I'm dropping my review to 4 stars, mostly for the buggy keys but also because it lacks the option to work as a non-wireless keyboard. If it just worked good, I wouldn't mind having to rebind the keys, but missing keys and losing keys while typing it a big PITA, especially because I code. It isn't mess up enough to really warrant sending it back, it's maybe like 1 in 1000 keystrokes it messes up -- if it was any less I'd probably just think it was user error, but I've been typing a very long time and I can tell when I type something correctly and the keyboard tosses in an extra letter. Even just typing this sentence, it added an extra c in correctly and an extra s at the end of this and I had to go back and fix them.

I generally like this keyboard for its size and weight (it's sturdy enough, but not as sturdy as an Apple keyboard). In my pics you can see it's fairly thin and it features backlighting, if you want that (you can turn it off).I prefer a wired keyboard due to better response time and avoiding connection or battery issues, so I got this one. Overall I'm OK with it, but the keys are a bit too sensitive and have weak spring stiffness to them. During rapid typing, you can easily overtype a key and I find myself frequently hitting delete to edit typing errors that don't happen on my Apple keyboard at home. For this review I'm using my Apple keyboard and I've managed to avoid having to delete extra letters. If I was using the Satechi keyboard, I would've had to hit delete maybe 10 times by now. It can get annoying, but it's not a complete make or break sort of thing.After 7 months of use, my keyboard has a little fading on heavy use keys, but it's not glaring and you can't really tell in my pics. I like that the keys are black so I can avoid the nasty dirtied up look white keyboards easily get.

There are a lot of reviews saying it "Wont hold a charge right off the bat" or "Won't Pair". I thought I had the same problem, but found that it is supposed to display those things before setup. Magnets hold it closed, keys press alright, but the hinges are flimsy.Over all it works and I'm happy I can do homework on the go.

Works well, no complaints in the function. Wish it had a cross referenced manual that translated to all the keys and their functions. I just "hunt and peck" because i dont know nor can figure out the extra keys

I had reported that the s key got stuck but after slapping it on the desk it popped back up. after doing this several times it is ok. maybe something got stuck under it. the keyboard is small and light

I ordered the Tibuta Ultra-Slim Bluetooth Keyboard to use with my new T-mobile Revvl 10 inch 5G tabletIt connected really quick and easy by bluetooth, and all I can say is that it worked and I no longer have to type on that small on screen keyboard anymore. I knocked off 1 star from it's rating because it did not include a type USB-C cable, But I also had about a dozen of them in my desk drawer so that was not an issue for me, Now I would recommend this mini bluetooth keyboard to anyone looking for a nice keyboard, for their phones, tablets, and ipads...

Bought this for my MacBook Pro. Connecting the 2 was no problem at all. I find myself having to continuously check what I just typed as it often times doest register the letter I just hit, which after a litle bit gets annoying. It is very light weight and compact. The price is nice but with the keys often times not registering on the screen, its a real. I think your better off spending the money on a better keyboard.
Working properly, medium Quality Materials, 10” size . I Like it so much making using microsoft word , excel & power point on my ipad very easy

Keyboard is satisfying and responsive, touchpad registers as a mouse (doesn't mess with a laptop's 'integrated' touchpad for example), and connectivity is good. Keyboard area is a little smaller to accommodate the touchpad, but it doesn't feel cramped. The touchpad is not responsive enough though, it doesn't seem well-configured to be honest. It's good!! Just not great yet. But overall, if this does what you need, it will definitely be a good choice :)

Works great, like the soft keys and ergonomic design. Two issues for me, but it's just my personal opinion :-)1) No CTRL key on the right side of the keyboard. I use CTRL-Y often and not having the CTRL on the same side as the Y makes it a 2-handed move, not 1-hand.2) The Delete button is right next to the Bluetooth button. I'm constantly accidently clicking the 2.4G Bluetooth button and disconnecting the keyboard. Wish there wasn't a button right next to Delete, woudl be easier to "find" without looking.Again, other than those two little things, it works great.

I purchased two different USB keyboards to try out, and found myself absolutely loving this little foldout. The design on this is brilliant, keyboard layout is natural and just large enough to allow for comfortable, rapid typing. It's attractive, even cute with an almost toy-like feel. It works well and connectivity is simple and assured.Wishlist: It is plastic and not aluminum as listed. I would pay more for something built a bit more ruggedly with metal case and hinges. I like it enough to care. The foldout phone shelf: great idea! I wish it were deep enough to accommodate my phone in its case. I purchased a phone holder separately as a result.Overall, the design is brilliant and the keyboard is very functional. I like it so much, I would love to see the product produced with long-term use in mind. I will be using this all of the time.

Works well, but keys are small and tightly spaced. Best for slow, hunt-and-peck typists, people with quite small hands, slow typists with small hands, and children, especially children whose parents want to encourage them to reduce their screen time. This keyboard will do it.

Pairs easilyInexpensive split keyboardKeeps wires downKeys stick a bit- hopefully more use will help that, it's a bit frustratingMy 5x more expensive version is flawless but again inexpensive choice that works

It’s a good product and does what it’s designed for. I feel less pressure on my wrists but it will take some time to get a hang of it, it’s a bit hard to type initially.I also did not received batteries inside but my friend did.
There are times that I have to check the connection because I cannot type anything on my screen. Nice padded wrist rest, and quiet keys.
Easy set up, on & off button with place for USB so great for travelling between offices. Feels a bit cheaper than other models of similar price.

I bought this to add to a ham radio (project) that I am in the process of developing. The project is based on a Raspberry Pi 4 computer so it has Bluetooth built in which had this item up & running fast. One thing that really bothered me is the so-called instruction sheet. It leaves a lot to beg and of course covered a multitude of languages that I will never use ...One point of contention I have so far is that I cannot find a way to hold down a key and then scroll down the screen. Yes I have a touch screen but its crammed by the programming of the radio so having a way to hold down a key or pad and then use the touch pad to scroll down the page would be nice....it may well be there but I haven't found it yet in the instruction sheet (too small for my old eyes to read comfortably) ... the case is plastic and my concern is that this radio is going to be used in the field and I have to wonder how well it will hold up there .... if it were made say in titanium or aluminum that would enhance its ruggedness in a filed application.On the good side it is amazinly easy to use, very good size for my needs, and has a really great touch feel for use. The compnay was very fast to ship and I highly recommend it for anyone who needs a nice portable keyboard with a number pad system ... I'm very happy with the unit.

the keyboard buttons dont work so good for me they are pretty good i just dont feel that they are so fun to click isnt as satisfying as my old keyboard. the mouse works incredibly well amazing comfortable to move around, doesnt lag at all.
Easy to assemble. Working well. Nice sounding unit. LED lights very bright....almost strobe-like. Needed to move it from its original location as it was almost blinding to look at.....

I placed one in my office and it is a great conversation starter between new clients and I. I love the gentle sound of the water and the colors. I have 2 and the screen came apart from both but this is a minor issue. Simple & nice.

I read many reviews before deciding to buy. Several mentioned that it splashed a lot. I almost didn't buy it because of that. But some of those who said that used a rock or pebble to assist with the flow and prevent splashing. Okay, potential problem solved. Several others mentioned that the pump was loud. Again, I considered not buying. But then I read responses that said to make sure the pump is completely submerged. Okay, another potential problem solved. I didn't find any other issues mentioned (other than the water tasting bad, but I'm not buying it to drink or for an animal to drink so....) so I decided to buy it. It's lovely! It shipped quickly and was easy to set up. My only disappointment is that it does not produce sound of water I was hoping for.

I should have read the specs more carefully instead of relying on pictures. It's really small. But if this is the size you want, then it's great. The rocks are loose and you arrange them yourself. I've had this fountain for about 8 days now. First - as reported - the bowls/pots are made out of some kind of porcelain or clay and the fountain is heavy.Assembly is a snap. The top two bowls are a single piece with a molded stem that fits into the 3rd bowl; and then the 3rd bowl has a molded stem that fits into the bottom bowl. The water hose from the pump to the top bowl is fed through the same stems. Another poster reported that the mounting was flimsy, but I disagree. Actually the stems are very sturdy - to the point to where the bowls will only fit in the one position as shown, and have absolutely no wobble.The sound of the water trickling is the best (loudest) of any table fountain that I've owned, which I expected with the large bottom bowl of water for the water to fall into. As others have mentioned, you don't hear the pump running at all.I was a bit concerned about the water level in the 3rd-from-top bowl. There's a rim around the bowl, but the water comes up to within 1/8-1/16 of an inch from the top of the rim. If someone were to knock the table where the fountain sits hard enough, I would expect some water to spill out of that bowl. This is true regardless of the pump water-flow setting (I tried all 3).My biggest issue with the fountain is that there is some splash. As shown, the bottom bowl is a big bowl full of water. I've tried various water levels from almost full to not even covering the top of the pump as well as adjusting the water flow setting, but regardless, there is a small amount of splash - with droplets of water appearing on the side of the bottom bowl and some slight specks of water collecting on the table below the fountain. After 10-12 hours of running, there's enough mist/droplets on the table to have to wipe them off. On a glass or well-protected surface, not a problem, but I wouldn't put this on a wood surface. I've also tried tilting the fountain a bit (being careful of the water close to the rim of the 3rd bowl), but I can't figure out how to get rid of the slight splash. If it weren't for the slight splash, I'd easily rate this fountain at 5 stars.

I really love this little fountain I bought another one around the same time I purchased this one it was much smaller and much cheaper and the smaller and cheaper one works a little bit better only concerning the fact that this one runs out of water rather quickly I have to refill it at least once a day or every two days while the little one sustains for a few days that's my only complaint other than that I love both of my fountains and I would purchase again, maybe not for $30 though, considering. And also the background mirror gets really dirty and it's hard to clean👍

This fountain looks great, but I had to do so much just to get it to a place I was happy with. Obviously the pump has to be completely submerged in water to avoid the loud humming, which I did. Despite the water level, it was still extremely noisy, and I couldn't figure out why...After disassembling it completely and just having the pump plugged in by itself, I discovered that the source of the noise was coming from the pump vibrating against the base of the reservoir. Since there was no possible way to adjust the way the pump was positioned in the water, I had to resort to a very weird solution....I grabbed some pipe cleaners, shaped them into a circular fashion, and stuck them at the bottom of the fountain to make a make-shift bed to rest the pump on while it was submerged in the water, and it surprisingly worked like a charm. No more noise.Also the "rocks" that this fount comes with are absolutely pathetic. I happened to have a bag of black stones that I use for another fountain in my house that worked will for this one too.

My dad sprayed it with rum and it seems to be doing better

Easy enough to install and set up. The water falls quite a distance so it's loud, not a soft trickle of water. But pretty. The lights and actually distracting and their cable/cord isn't with the water so it gets wet and corroded on first use.

It could of came with directions but I went to the pictures on my order and figured it out. I wasn't sure how much water to put but it needs to touch the wheel I seen. It isn't as quiet as I thought either. Over all I give it a 3. It does work and its very cute. My son loved it. I put it in his room and its looks very kid like. He loves the light and how it spins.

The media could not be loaded. I bought this for my office to add some serenity for clients. Water is at full line and the motor is loud and obnoxious. I hate doing returns on Amazon it’s so inconvenient but this thing is going to have to go back. What a waste of my time. You can barely even hear the water. Cute tho for whatever that’s worth.UPDATE: So I turned it on again and it sounds fine. There’s a very mild pump noise but the water is the stronger sound now. I have no idea what changed. Not upping to full five stars though as it’s been an annoying experience. It’s a pretty decent water feature now, in any case. Yay for procrastination.

It's served me well over the months I've had this thing. I keep it right by my bed, on my bedside desk. It's very relaxing to listen to, and fun to run your fingers through, which is the most important bit as we all know.I've read some reviews that said it was loud or made a noise. Never happened to me unless the water got too low. I'm 90% sure most of the reviews that complain about this consist of people who forgot evaporation was a thing that happens.It is understandable though, it's small, so doesn't take a ton of water for it to go from the fill line (which is kinda hard to see/find) to a bit too low and you can start to hear the difference; if you were to keep it going 24/7 I'd imagine you'd need to add water to it every 12-ish hours or so to keep 'er healthy.One complaint I do have about it is the little light that they have shining on the sail: it's a bit too bright for night yet too dim for a lit room. It's also non-negotably a part of it. You can't dim it, or turn it off while the water is going, or change the color, etc. If it's on, it's got that orange light shining at it. If you had planned on having this by your bed like me, you either have to get used to the light and be sure it's pointed away from you, or just not have it on going to sleep at all. I eventually settled on the latter.Also, the cable is a bit too short for me, just 1 or 2 more feet would've been perfect. It seems designed to go on a table or something positioned right in front of/ directly above a outlet, but the place I wanted to put it is about half a desk length away, so the cable currently is pulled all the way taught in order for it to just barely reach. The on/off switch being on the cable itself makes this problem especially cumbersome.TLDR:• I like it a lot, especially for the price.• It needs refilling due to evaporation• Point above likely contributes most to the 'noise' complaints you may read about.• Light on it is unadjustable in its brightness, color, on/off state, etc. Kinda annoying.• The cable isn't very long, and the on/off switch is on the cable itself, so it must be close to an outlet with a length of the cable itself exposed and reachable.

This little fountain is just as advertised - pump gives a light hum, but with a pad beneath, it is hardly notable. The pleasant-looking statue holds a small but adequate light in its palm. The water barely ripples, has a nice trickling sound, very gentle.

It has a more plastic-y look than the picture and there is not enough rocks to hide all around the Buddha but those are easy to find in dollar stores, so I'll find more. Also, there is no on-off switch. You just plug it and inplug it to turn it on and off. Considering it's electricity and water, I don't really like that. I plugged it in a power bar. It also makes the cable almost impossible to hide since you need to always be able to access it to turn it on and off. Besides that it's cute and very quiet.
Beautiful with a positive message but water is silent flow. The rocks were dirty and soiled my new white lace dolly that I purchased to display the fountain on. Nope it washes clean.
Small fountain but fits great on a small table. It is very quiet and does not splash water.

One of the little fountains came with a tiny hole that allowed water to seep out and run down the side, covering my desk in water. Luckily I caught it before it damaged anything and sealed it with some silicone. The motor is silent, which is a big plus.
The fake vegetation kept falling off so had to glue it.Usually relaxing when in use.
Perfect size and the water sounds along with lights makes it soothing for late evenings. Helps to relax faster and sleep longer.

The media could not be loaded. I think this is a nice value and a pretty fountain. I did add a few stones to the bottom chamber so that I could hear the water a little bit better. Otherwise you can’t hear the water very well. Overall, I am happy!

Liked the look of this desktop fountain and it runs well. However not currently able to use it as it is too loud for my studio space due to the design and water drop back into the pool. I'm in a 12 x 12 room, albeit with a lot of hard surfaces (floors, walls, desks) so the water sound quickly moves from soothing trickle noises to reverberating distraction. To spin the ball the pump has to be on the second highest setting only. Anything less and the ball stalls or only vibrates, high speed, the water shoots off the back of the ball and on to desk and floor. It looks nice in our decor, so I kept it and have the LEDs lighting the ball without the pump and may rig it in the future as an atomizer to create a fog illusion in the centre design. It just doesn't work as intended in my office space - may be great in a different setup and if the limitations of my environment are removed, it's worth the 4-stars. Disappointed I can't use it in my space and so not advised for a smaller quiet office area or where lots of impromptu Zoom or Teams meetings are frequent unless you can unplug it easily / quickly. Sounds to remote users like you're in the bathroom, LOL!

I purchased these as it hit my two main criteria for work office decor, it was cheap and not terribly tacky.I wanted a quiet sound of running water in my office, the noise helps me focus. I was disheartened initially as it was nearly silent, and by nearly I mean it didn't even so much as produce sound other than the hum of the pump. I noticed upon assembly that it hard some sort of black plastic restrictor inside the hose that runs from the pump to the top bowl. I used a tool to remove this restrictor and that massively improved the flow. It now generates a delightful trickle!Not featured in the listing are the included small pebbles and glass marble ball thing. The instructions make no mention of placement for the marble in the feature, it only fits in the top ball. I assume it is to create the effect of the ball spinning or bobbing. However, it is far too heavy an merely acts as yet another restriction for flow. This is OK as with the pump turned to full with the restrictor removed it is a little aggressive, but slower speeds lead the pump to more hum.All in all, it balances itself out nicely. It produces the sound I was looking for and the design isn't terribly obtrusive.

The media could not be loaded. I like this little tabletop fountain and have it underneath our gazebo. It's a great addition to our morning coffee routine.I HIGHLY RECOMMEND removing the small black restrictor from the hose, (I pushed it out with a chopstick). This will give you better water flow.Also, watch your water levels. Too much and the unit goes quiet. Too little and it sucks like a small pool filter.You can find the sweet spot with a little adjusting of the rocks and turning the bowls.It's a nice calming accent for the price!

I really enjoy how the fountain looks! It adds a tranquil feel to the room. It is a great size; not too big, not too small. I would have liked it to have a water trickling/flowing noise, but it does not. If you remove the floating ball, you can hear the water sound, although it may splash water without it. I also would have liked the base to have a notch for the cord as the top doesn't sit quite flush with the base because of the cord. Overall, very nice fountain. Adding additional rocks (purchased separately) adds to the appeal.

The fountain is exactly what I wanted for my home office. It’s fairly sturdy and eye-pleasing for the price-point. The set up was easy and the LED light gives it a nice glow. I agree with other posts that it doesn’t make much sound, but I fixed that issue by placing a few small stones on each leaf at the spout. Theadditional stones created a little more water pooling on each leaf, creating that classic trickling water sound.
I can work with mine, but check your measurements, tho. They are small.
Decoration

Directions say to put something underneath it to quiet the motor, but it really doesn't bother me at all. I barely hear it. My only issue is: I don't hear water trickles at all. it was good while it lasted.
This is a very beautiful and decorative mister. Putting it together was a bit difficult as there were no instructions. A little pricey too. But very nice.
Perfect size for my bathroom, but the plastic does feel really cheap. It is very light. But it does work

The instructions show a pump with an adjustable flow rate. Mine came without a flow rate switch, so I can't adjust the flow. Because of the discrepancy, I did not give 5 stars.I like the amount of water regardless of not being able to adjust the flow, and it produces a nice sound for a 12X15 room. The rim is damp in the bottom/main basin, but after 8 hours of running, there was no over splash. On the shelf or the floor.The material is fairly heavy and it seems to be a nice color/quality. It fits in with the room colors and plants at my desk.It was mostly assembled. All I had to do was un pack, connect light connector, fill with water and plug it in.Very minimal. It is a tight squeeze getting the pump in and out with your hand and I had to use a pen to get the pump placed and pull the pump out by the cord. My hand would not fit in side. I can't reach an octave on a piano, but my hand muscles are fairly developed.The lights are better in pictures, but it is really nice.

I only gave 4 stars because there were so many reports of damaged items upon delivery and mine was one of them. Luckily, Amazon's procedure of reporting, quick response and fairly easy returns allowed me to get a replacement in 2 days. I love my little water feature. I DO wish the "tinkling" were a bit louder as I have it in my office for relaxation, but I'm glad it doesn't splash. I also have the ability to have my Google home add the sound of a babbling brook if I feel the need. I like the spinning and colorful orb and I'm looking forward to the evening to see it in the dark.
Nice product, really beautiful. Product as described.

If you are intending to get this fountain to create the sound of moving water, you will need it within 5 feet of your head to hear it. I hoped with this many stages of falling water, it would be loud enough to put it in my office or bedroom, to drown out some ambient noises. However, it's more of a decorative piece than an ambient sound machine.It definitely looks cool, but I was hoping it would create a lot more sound. In the description it does say "quiet" water sound, so I can't complain too much. Overall, it's a good fountain, easy to assemble and use. Just fill the bottom of the unit up until it's 60-75% full (in the outer, bottom bowl). I'll probably end up returning it myself, just because I don't care how it looks. I wanted a louder fountain, I suppose I could mod this one to make it louder.
I really liked this but I live in an urban area and the sound of the trickling water was lost under the traffic noise.

As I find happening more and more these days, products that arrive work exactly how they should but due to instructions that lack proper detail the setup is often frustrating and may even dishearten you enough to return it. The customer can even find themselves thinking they have a faulty product when in reality the instructions skipped over something that could solve the problem. Some times you may feel a little "stupid" when you realize where you messed up but let's just assume that you have no idea how ANYTHING works. So here are the few things that, if you have never owned a fountain before and have precisely no idea what to expect (which is what instruction manual writers should always be assuming when considering wording, what explanations should be included, and visual aid. Think of that instructions giving exercise you might have done in school during which you give step by step DETAILED instructions on how to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.), this is what you need to know.First. Have several towels ready. Put one down, put the fountain on top of it and be prepared to switch them out. Put a bowl of water under the table you have the fountain it on if you have to. After I write this I will be blow drying the carpet.In regards to the following steps.3. Check that the pump is firmly connected to the water tubing that is built into the fountain and the pump is sitting flat on the bottom of the reservoir.A bit of clarification: The pump and the water tubing are not actually connected already. However, because everything is packed in so tightly it gives the illusion that it may in fact be quite secure. There are warnings all over the place that if you damage the tubing your warranty is voided which gives the customer a sense of uncertainty about handling the pump at all. And of course you can't actually see anything in the reservoir so that isn't helpful. Also getting the pump to stay flat while the reservoir is dry is more trouble than it's worth so keep reading.Side note: There is a small grey slider on the pump that determines the strength of the flow. Make sure that is all the way on. Because it didn't seem to mark which way to slide it (there is a good possibility it is in fact marked however when I figured this part out the pump was inside the fountain already), keep this in mind for the bit of troubleshooting clarification at the end of this review.5. Fill the fountain with enough water to keep the pump fully submerged during operation, approximately 6 cups.Note: The image above the worded instructions shows the water being dumped into the bottom pool where the light is located. Don't do that. There is no way to truly feel or see if the pump is actually submerged. Get a funnel, make sure you have a good light source angled towards the back of the fountain (where the access panel door is meant to go once setup is complete. The panel should not yet be in place.) With the pump pushed in as far as possible but NOT holding it down, fill the reservoir, slowly, by pouring the water into the funnel first. Once the pump is submerged as much as it can be , remove the funnel, reach in and push it down gently, ensuring that the suction cups on the pump are properly secured. If the pump is now sticking out of the water, reinsert the funnel and add more water until the pump is submerged.Note on the note: At the bottom it states "Note: When first plugged in, there may be air in the pump. It may take several moments for trapped air to escape, allowing water to flow."When it says several moments, it means it. I'm not saying two or three seconds I'm saying give it a good thirty before deciding that the flow may not be strong enough.And on that note on the note, the troubleshooting I mentioned. If it seems that the water flow is terribly weak but it's clear that the water is not being backed up (the pool at the bottom isn't overflowing therefore proving that the problem is most likely not kinking or a break in the tube) reach back in and feel for the pump. Feel for that grey slider and push it in the opposite direction. The flow should immediately increase. This just means when you slid it over the first time you slid it in the wrong direction. If the flow DOES NOT increase, check again that the tubing is secured to the pump properly. Though I found once it was, it didn't slide off easily.About the visual aid.I can't even fully explain what is depicted in the little bubble next to the image of the fountain. There is a square pointing towards a line that has another square protruding from it and what looks like a chord dangling out of it? I couldn't tell you what that was supposed to signify other than don't have this thing plugged in when dealing with water. But it could also be referring to the light splitter which is used to, as I'm sure you've guessed, split the power so the pump gets the proper voltage and the light gets the proper voltage without needing two separate AD wall adapters. But because it isn't clear, that can put some doubt in your mind as to whether or not you're missing something.Concerning Troubleshooting SectionThere are an abundance of troubleshooting steps listed with this product. They are basically just for if the pump doesn't work at all. I mean it doesn't even turn on. There was almost nothing about if the product functions but not as expected. That is why I was fumbling around so much and figured out the little tip about the slider on the pump. A troubleshooting guide should essentially be worded like "If this is happening make sure that this is secured/plugged in/properly positioned etc. Not the case here.In conclusion: The fountain is wonderful. It does exactly what is shown in the video in the description. It sounds great, looks great, and is extremely soothing. I would love to fill my house with these or even get a floor standing one just to have more of that atmosphere in every room, but alas I live in an apartment (with a landlord who, let's just say, deserves his own written review. I'll do that in the proper venue once I've moved out.) But the instructions are poorly written. As I said. All manuals should be done assuming the customer knows nothing. This may seem like a useless review to someone who had prior knowledge, but to those of us that literally have no idea, it will help you.

So the product was great until it wasn't.. After a few months the pump had stopped to a trickle.. Before tossing the pump and ordering a new one, I gave it one last clean.. While doing that, I found, shoved up in the hose line, was a cut piece of it, to restrict flow (see pic).. My guess is after a year or so you figure the pump gave out and it's time to buy a new one.. Well it's not, I shoved a screw driver up there and got it out.. My fountain works like brand new again and I have a feeling itll stay working like new 🙃.. Im not gonna say, when it was new, MAYBE it needed the cut piece of tube to restrict the flow, so it wasn't to much, BUT it ended up ruining it almost.. Were gonna say it was a mistake hopefully, bc other then this issue, it's been doing what it's supposed to do and been very nice to have.. Thanks!

The media could not be loaded. This is a very simple, yet elegant looking desk waterfall/fountain. It's also not exactly what I was looking for, before i really knew what i was looking for.It is extremely simple to put together (basin, pump, fountain base, water cups... and the decorative rocks and glass ball).However, when I assembled, filled, and ran it, I found two things that weren't to my liking:1. It was almost silent. I was expecting some amount of flowing water sound as soothing background noise but there was none. I tried removing the glass ball from the top cup to increase flow but everything is too close to the next recepticle to generate any noise. If you want visual aesthetic with no sound, this is your fountain.2. The ball doesn't spin much/at all. Other reviews recommend adding water but that is not a silver bullet. I tried filling it to almost overflowing and draining it to just enough to keep flowing, no spinny.So I tried some configuration changes to try and improve the glass ball visual aesthetic and provide some flowing water ambience. After a little trial and error, I came. up with the following, as shown in the pic and vid:- Remove the bottom (LED holding) cup. This allows the water to drop from the third cup straight into the water basin through the hole where the last cup should be.- Place the LED in the runoff hole of the fountain base in front of where the bottom cup goes.- Place the glass ball on top of the LED to help obscure the space where the last cup should be.- Lay the rocks around the fountain base, using 2-3 to help build up the 'wall' hiding where the water flows into the basin.This will not give you a spinning ball but it will light it up and provide some subtle background trickling water. You're welcome.I don't usually expect to have to hack something to suit my requirements but this fountain is elegant and cheap enough that I didn't mind.

The only issue i ever have with items like this and this one is it's only flaw is the fact that if it's not perfectly level it leaks. I added a plate under it to catch cause it was a very slow leak but then apparently the plate leveled it. I never understand why these things happen but otherwise works well and looks nice. My kids absolutely love it.

UPDATE: A replacement showed up very quickly. Same packaging, but it was perfect.Very quiet motor. I forgot to look what setting it is on before turning it on. No splash. No water trickling sound, but it might be in low. (Mini update: turned switch on bottom, might have changed the water flow somewhat. However! I added a little stone or two to the top and now as the water runs around the stones I have a water fountain sound! Also, still no splash!)I planned on putting it on a table on the porch. Listing says indoor and outdoor many places. The directions clearly state indoor. It is only a two prong plug.Original review: The tail on the yellow bird was broken. It was shipped only in the privy manufacturer packaging. The box did not look harmed.Wondering if everything was just too tightly packed.The water reservoir was sitting directly on the top of the packaging on the bird. Any downward pressure probably broke it.It’s pretty. The yellow isn’t as bright but it almost looks more natural instead of lemon yellow. I liked it. Hopefully I’ll be able to plug the new one in and use it.
Cool little fountain but colors are maybe a bit drab. Otherwise it’s cute.

I'm like 90% sure that the unit I received was used/returned because there were water marks on the pieces. I don't really care about that but thought I'd mention it. The gripes I have are that there is a hairline crack across the back side of it and there are some glue spots/flaws in the finish. I'm sure the crack can be sealed, and it's in the back so no one will really see it. The glue spots are likewise fixable.The fountain is easy to set up. You just attach the tube to the pump, set the pump volume with the little lever, pour in your water, place the top piece onto the bowl, press the pump to the bottom of the bowl so the suction cups stick, arrange your rocks, plug it in, and you're off to the races. The pump is quiet and easy to replace if necessary.It makes a nice setting for action figure photos (just don't leave them there or the water might damage them) and can be decorated adorably with colorful glass pieces/beads, non-water-soluble minerals (such as quartz or obsidian), or little glass or ceramic fish/frogs/turtles/birds/etc.Note: in my photos, I have the pump set on medium (the lever is right in the middle)

The media could not be loaded. If you're looking for a small, minimalist tabletop fountain that is NOT plastic, this fits the bill. It's easy to set up - attach the pump and replace the dome. The water evaporates quickly; good for adding humidity in the room but it needs some attention. I add water every day, ~ 1/2 cup, when the pump starts gurgling. Otherwise it is silent when filled. I wanted more of a trickling noise, but not too much, so I added a small rock to the top. That breaks up the flow and makes a quiet trickle. (See video.) I also added more rocks to the bowl, which was larger than I expected.
It's quite good. I wish it has a on-off bouton. I have to always unplug it from the main switch. It's working quite nicely so far though.
I bought the original and loved it. This was supposed to be a replacement. It's not as graceful and I'm having trouble getting the sound of water.

I really really like this little fountain. But the other reviews are right… It’s so small and so quiet that you won’t hear actual bubbling. So if you’re looking for that sound… This isn’t the fountain for you. Otherwise, It’s a great little fountain and every other wayEDIT: if you remove the small rocks from around the bubbler, this is a much more enjoyable sound and overall small fountain.

The media could not be loaded. I gave 4 stars only because no instructions. I was about to return it because they have no instructions how to put it together. But I realized how to do it!!! Is affordable, beautiful center piece for any party!! A little noisy but you can’t hear it once you have music playing, lolLove it

Read Jeff Thompson's review. He talks about how to set up the cords and silicone the opening to make sure you don't get leaks. It takes a little work, but once you get it set up correctly, it is really wonderful. I also agree with the buyer who said it pumps plenty of water at the lowest pump setting. I took their advice and I'm glad I did. It pumps quite a bit of water at the lowest setting. The lights are perfect, the sound of the water is amazing. I really like it. Here's a few tips: 1. Put it in a container in case it leaks. 2. You can fill the water from the front so seal the bottom part of the back opening with silicone (see picture). 3. The lowest point of the back opening is about 3.5 inches from the bottom. So if you fill the water from the front, get the level to where the water just covers the LED light in the lowest basin. That is about 3 inches from the bottom so it won't be overfilled and the water won't leak out the back. 4. Use a water treatment that is meant to stop bacterial growth and mold. I use one that is meant for swamp coolers and humidifiers. 5. Like others have suggested, use small rocks at the base of each waterfall to change the sound to fit your preference. 6. I took out the black screen on the second tier waterfall because I didn't like the way it looked. After I took it out, I didn't notice any difference in splashing or the flow of water, so I would recommend doing that. I just want to give another special shout-out to Jeff Thompson. I don't know you, but I'm very grateful for your idea on stopping the leaks! I took the time to write my suggestions because Jeff took the time to write his. Overall, after taking the time to get it set up right and making a decorative base for it, I absolutely love this waterfall! It's so relaxing and peaceful. I'm so glad I got it.
Very nice piece. Nice water sound and very little pump noise. I was happy with the purchase. It was a gift for my wife.

The media could not be loaded. What I like: Appearance of better quality than it actually is, attractive, easy to put together, can't hear the motorWhat I don't like: The water stream is barely audible. Ambient noise will cancel the subtle sound. I had to build up the stones by placing a larger stone on each side of the smaller stones which helped. The stones help highlight the sound as the water trickles through them however, it's a very small water flow with limited space to build the stones up. After all, it's a small item. Best placed in a quiet space.

I bought this for my wife to place next to her Orchids, thinking it would add a little moisture to the ambient air around them. I was very impressed with the quality, and the easy setup. It is important to note that you need to make sure the pump is completely submerged. Anyway, the LED's are awesome but why not put one in every tier?? There are 4 tiers but only 3 LED's. It just looks like it is missing that forth tier and seems like it could have been such an easy thing to include. This is the reason for my 4 stars instead of 5.I will fix that 4th tier by adding an LED to that location. There are many aftermarket parts to make that happen. Other than that, it's a wonderful table top feature that works great with a surrounding of plants.ADDITIONALLY: I am normally not happy with about 25% of my Amazon shipping experiences, but this time, I have to say that I am completely happy! I did not think I would get this until at LEAST 5 days later, yet it got to me in two days. THANK YOU! Expected Feb 17th, got Feb 12th!EDIT: I changed my review to 2 stars out of 5. Why? The pump croaked after less than 5 months of use. I figured it would die with continuous use in a year or two, but not after less than 5 months. We only used distilled water, used the water anti-algae drops weekly as-per instructions, and NEVER let it go dry. As a matter of fact, because of evaporation, I checked it every day to make sure it was full. So since it croaked, I decided to do to it what I wanted to anyway. Put an after-market pump in it, and redo the LED feature. After all, I was always irritated that not all the tiers were lit.EDIT 2ND: The customer service is very good. I had a response to my complaint email within one business day, and had a pump shipped and received within 4 business days free because of the warranty. Our feature is working great again, which is why I bumped the rating back to 4 stars.

I love this for fountain for table tops, not too big or too small... Just right! Beautiful and well made looking sculpturing gives it a more realistic feel. The only issue I had is the pump is a bit too loud, which I resolved for the most part by adding some foam as sound barriers to both the inside bottom and outside bottom. I am sensitive to any noises, and wanted to focus on the soothing water sounds more than vibrations of the motor. They could easily redesign this with that added sound absorption, but either way it's worth the buy and brings good vibes into ur home!

The video in the product details is extremely amplified compared to the sound it actually makes. It is a nice looking product, the motor is quiet, the water flows nicely and does not splash onto surrounding surface, but I really was looking for something to create a little more ‘white noise’ in a silent house. This does not provide that in my opinion.
I love it but there's no on/button. I have to plug it/unplug it.

Lovely little item, truly.I don’t understand why people complain about the water noise or splashing, all you have to do is place pebbles where the water pours and then no more noise or splashing.Leave top bowl (level 3) alone.Leave middle bowl (level 2) alone, place one of the larger rocks where the water from this bowl hits the platform.Bottom bowl with light (Level 1), if you want to remove the sound where water from level 3 drops into the lighted level 1 bowl, place a rock leaning against the orange light in the bowl where the water from the level 3 bowl lands and that will stop the splashing sound.If you line up the pebbles against the edge of the platform you will also cut down any noise from the motor.You can top off the water by pouring it into the little hole in the back, where the power cord is supposed to come out of the water pump.... so you don’t have to remove the platform to do that. However, it is tedious to once a week clean the item. You have to remove the pebbles to fully clean it and then have to replace them when done. If you use clear not hard water, you can clean it every few weeks rather than once a week..NOTE: Make sure you run it hard during the first few weeks so if there is a pump problem, you can return it to amazon. I did wind up having a pump issue and THEIR CUSTOMER SUPPORT DOES NOT RESPOND TO EMAILS.
The media could not be loaded. This is very cute and relaxing, I can't really see the light but guess it will be better when it's dark

If you don't mind it splattering a little bit, this is a nice fountain. It's a case of the pump not quite being matched to the capacity of the fountain, so you will want to turn it to the minimum speed. Also, a couple of things that aren't mentioned in the instructions... It may seem strange, but your electric cable for the LED light will be underwater. Just be sure and screw the connector on tightly to help it be waterproof. Also the purpose of the sponge isn't mentioned. It shows where the sponge sits, but doesn't say if it's only for packing, or meant to be there while operating the fountain. I found the sound so disagreeable if it was in place while the fountain was operating, that I pulled it out.From past experience with fountains, you will want to follow the advice of cleaning it every week because mold will probably build up in the reservoir just above the water line. Also, even though I use distilled water, there is enough stuff in the air, that eventually slime will start to grow in it if not cleaned regularly.If you keep these things in mind, you will have a very pretty, gurgling fountain to grace your table.

I really enjoyed this fountain while it was working as it had a great aesthetic and sounded nice! My pump burned out a little after a month of owning it but the company is super responsive to messages and worked with me on a replacement! I've been very happy with the experience!

I know I saw the measurements but it’s still on the small side. A bit of water sound is nice. It is stable and the filter is quiet. Wish it were a few inches bigger all around but that is my fault for not visualizing correctly.
Refreshing to the eyes, music to the ears.

First, this is a beautiful fountain made of resin and it's fairly heavy as well. I got it for use next to my desk in my office. It looks lovely there and it's very quiet while running.It was difficult to get the pump inside it, however. I like that the little light part was already connected, but the pump has to be connected and placed inside a very small space. I found this pretty hard to do and it took more than one try.The other thing I think would have been great is to have an on/off switch. This has to be plugged in to work and unplugged to stop. I will have to move it from beside my desk because I can't crawl under the desk every day .Other than these small inconveniences, this is a lovely fountain and so peaceful. It makes me smile and quiets my heart watching it.All in all, it's a good purchase. I would give this item as a gift as well.
Received the item nice and in good condition. Thank you
Did have a chip in it bit rest all good.

This indoor tabletop water fountain is attractive and relaxing. The fountain comes with a pump and crystal ball on top. The fountain looks beautiful with four tiers made of stones and a bottom layer to recycle the water. The fountain was simple to set up, taking minutes to assemble, and began working after adding water and plugging it in.The LED light adds a nice ambiance, but it's just one colour. The addition of a clear, glass ball on the top tier creates a mesmerizing effect as it spins with the flow of water, reflecting light beautifully. The pump operates quietly in the background. On the downside, it is a bit pricey for a small tabletop fountain. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a charming and relaxing water fountain to add to their home decor.

Top 3 Pros- Water Sounds- Plenty of pebbles to place on the base- Easy setupTop 3 Cons,- Trickle sound vs a deeper sound- Splashes a little- Pump hums louder after a bit of useSimi quiet pump (other review mentioned they can be noisy) not overpowering the water sound but can be heard if you are paying attention for it. I filled it how I usually do, Put distilled water in the base, start pump and pour water into the water outlet and then unplug, let it sit for 10seconds and then plug in, no noise and pumps well. Also lots of stones I usually have enough for one layer this had some spares that could go on top and add some depth.Overall ,Great product and some tweaks could make it feel more premium but over all suits my needs and sounds good.

The media could not be loaded. I don't usually write reviews, but I wanted to put this out there just in case there is someone looking at indoor fountains looking at them for that particular thing I was. I need the Flowing water sound too. This one IS beautiful, the spinning ball is very pretty, the lights are pretty, the case is pretty, but it's missing the most intangible piece, the gurgling water. It's almost silent. The sound of running water is exactly WHY I wanted a fountain on my computer desk. It calms my brain. Thus I may be looking for another. ::sigh::
The noise level is a tricky question the motor doesn’t make any noise but the fountain doesn’t make the water trickling sound that one get a fountain to hear.

My child had been asking for a desktop fountain and after looking at many options, he chose this one. The rolling ball is really cool, especially since it is lit up from below. The fountain came with good instructions, which made for easy set up. The mister is really cool to watch, but results in the whole counter getting wet as the mist settles, which is a little bit of a problem since ours is sitting on a wooden bookshelf. Luckily the mister has a separate power source, so our solution is to just turn it on for a little bit and then unplug it. The fountain is well made and worth the price. The motor is not noisy and the trickling of water is a nice ambient sound. My child often turns it on before bed and falls asleep to the sound.One more comment - the picture shows what appear to be live fish in the fountain. This fountain would definitely not be a good long term home for fish. As a fish owner, this is pretty obvious and I told my kid going in that we would not actually be able to put fish inside, but if you didn't know much about fish, the picture might be deceiving.

I love squirrels and mushrooms so I was quite happy to discover this little fountain. My only complaint is that I can barely hear the water running, which is why I gave it only 4 stars. So, if you're wanting a fountain you can hear, this isn't it. But it's cute and it's relaxing to watch anyway. I still really enjoy it.

I had one just like this and it worked great for several years. The solar part got a white film and eventually it wouldnt come off. It still worked until the little motor stopped working. This one is too small for the pot I use for my fountain. I don't like it.

I liked the idea that with a minimum of work it is possible to create a nice Atmosphere and have a water feature in my small garden. Lately the solar panels stopped working even though we are still in summertime and gave plenty of sun. It worked well for about 5 months.

This works so easily. It adds the perfect touch to my front yard. I just bought a large planter, filled it with water, and placed this fountain in it. The only thing is I wish it would store solar power so that it would also work on a cloudy day or into the evening. It has to have sunlight on it to work. It is easy to clean and is a cheaper option for wanting a fountain without all the extra cleaning and work. I definitely recommend.

Works great in my birdbath! I wish the 4 centering pegs were attached better, I took off one star for that - some large birds ended up removing them from the fountain and I had to look for them in my yard a couple times. There isn't a good way to glue them on either. Some of the reviewers mentioned this product stops working - and I did experience that a couple times when the birdbath went dry. I brought it inside, cleaned the filter material, and then took it back outside in the sun where I had to shake it quite a few times vigorously until I could feel it working again. As long as the birdbath had water, the product worked well when the sun was out. Another note: I could only use the downward flowing fountain attachment, all the other attachments caused the water to shoot outside the birdbath. But that was fine - I just wanted water movement in the bird bath, and this did the job.
I would have thought the solar battery would last longer !

I would give it 5 stars, except some of the little fountain spouts seem to have gotten clogged. But it's a really cute little fountain, runs on solar and does the job. Would recommend, especially for the price.

This was a gift for my husband. It fits in a large bowl or container of some sort. I put his into a Very Large Bowl, it looked so pretty.
