I bought this about a year ago and then stashed it away next to my vacuum cleaner knowing that I would probably use it one day. I've always been able to get the lint out of my filter, but I was getting tired of seeing a little bit of trailing lint down toward the bottom where I couldn't reach. I used to use chopsticks and covered the end of them with duct tape and that would get some of the lint out but it was a real pain in the butt. Anyway, I know this is kind of long, but I also think it's kind of funny and that I thought somebody could use a good laugh. I have a kitty at home who, if I don't put her dry food somewhere out of sight that I haven't put in the Tupperware yet for freshness, she will get into the bag and rip it open. I'm sure some of you have experienced similar situations yourselves with your pets. Anyway, happenstance would have it that I put her dry food bag in my dryer one day just to keep it out of sight. While my daughter was visiting one day she threw all the freshly cleaned clothes into the dryer and started it up without checking the dryer drum. You guessed it! After about 20 minutes we were hearing rattling around like pebbles or something and she went and opened the dryer. And oh my God, what a surprise we had awaiting! There was dry kitty food everywhere and thankfully it wasn't mushy or anything because the heat from the dryer must have unglued the glue on the cat's food bag and just opened the top. And holy cow, those bags are tough because it wasn't ripped anywhere! But then of course I had a horrible mess all over inside my dryer. And yes, it freaked me out. We shook the clothes out one by one and then I was left with the task of getting all the dry kitty food out of the dryer. I was able to salvage just about all of it with some of it of course catching in the dryer filter. I remembered having this vacuum cleaner filter for sucking out dryer lint and dug it out and oh my God! It worked like a charm and got every little bit out of there and I was able to vacuum out all the dustiness and everything from the kitty dry food. And then of course I went all over it again with a damp cloth and I even sprayed it with a little bit of air freshener. Thankfully, I didn't use fabric softener when I washed the clothes or when I dried them, or of course it would have ruined the kitty food. I think it's kind of a funny story and I'm so thankful that my dryer is fine and working great. Thanks for making a wonderful product and I'm so very thankful to have!

I had the traditional (& super expensive & painful) laser hair removal a few years ago at a med spa & due to lack of maintenance the hair came back. But this device is surpassing the results/expectations by a mile already. I’m on treatment 8 or 9 now & barely have any hair growth & I am doing full body pretty much! I am Hispanic & come from a family of very thick, stubborn hair. However, I am pretty pale but still struggle with the dark, thick hair. My skin is so smooth & soft now. The device is lightweight & so easy to use. Pain is minimal, most of the time I don’t even feel anything. It’s quick. It works so well, I bought one for a family member. I did experience a blister on my first use, but haven’t since then & I am using it at the max level. My skin tends to be on the more sensitive side, so I was not worried & it healed just fine. Literally love this thing, it’s the best purchase I’ve ever made & the price is great for what you get in the end! This is a must!

I went to a professional Laser names A&E Laser in CNY. 16 visits - they did not work!I starting using the INNZA Laser Hair Removal October 2024, its now almost Decemeber 1st 2024 AND I HAVE RESULTS!!!! I use this mahine 2x a week everywhere on my body! My work breaks I do smaller areas as my face and stomach. At home on my couch, I laser my legs and other random areas. This INNZA Laser Hair Removal IS GAME CHANGING FOR REMOVING HAIR and making it affordable for anyone who needs it! I swear I would do a commercial for these people, Im so obsessed!

I’m not kidding about this product, this is my genuine and honest review:I’m a Latina, I struggled with dark, thick, wire-like hairs on my face, mostly beard area. I waxed for years and always had ingrown hairs and constantly had to pluck missed hairs that the wax didn’t get. The ingrown hairs were so bad and painful and would often leave scars from when I’d dig out the hairs to pluck. I’d have to wax at least every week because these hairs insisted on growing back quickly. I’d go to work with irritated skin from the wax and it sucked because coworkers would tell me why my skin was red and irritated, I was always embarrassed having to explain it’s from waxing at home. I was super self conscious about the heavy hair growth on my face, sideburns, chin, and mustache area. After 4-5 years, I finally gave up on the wax and looked into laser hair removal. I got some price quotes to get lasered professionally but it was always out of my budget. Then I did some more research on at home laser devices and stumbled on this one. They had a great deal at the time and I got it for 70% off which sold me right away. I read it takes time to actually see some progress so I was patient and used it consistently about once or twice a week followed by putting aloe Vera on my skin after use. I did this for about 3 months and I’m extremely happy to say these hairs hardly grow back!! And when some hairs do grow back, they are thin, almost clear looking hairs that feel like nothing when plucked. I can go months now not even using the laser and the hairs hardly grow back. This product really did make me feel so much better about myself and got rid of my self consciousness of having heavy female facial hair. So if you’re still iffy about purchasing, please just do it already. I swear on anything this product really works. I’m extremely happy I no longer deal with having a beard anymore lol

I have PCOS and am biracial, which makes for a TERRIBLE combo when it comes to managing facial hair. I have had a hairy chin since I was a teenager that was manageable with tweezing or shaving, but as I got older my hair turned into a big thick, coarse, beard any man could be proud of. Me as a woman? Not so much. Soon, there were too many hairs to tweeze, waxing never got all of the hair, and it was impossible to get a good angle on it, hair removal creams were too weak for the hair but any stronger and they would have been to strong for my face, plus if I had a pimple or razor burn I couldn’t use them, and when I went in for laser hair removal they told me my skin was too dark for treatment.Years of shaving against the grain, (because with the grain never got a smooth enough shave) have caused significant discoloration on my chin and made it darker. I wouldn’t care about that since I can cover the color with concealer, but of course, even after shaving EVERY MORNING my hair would grow back by 4pm and leave me with 5 o clock shadow. To understand how well this product works, I need you to understand, these were THICK, BLACK, LONG hairs that grow straight out in a matter of hours. They are the most coarse hairs I have on my body, even including more personal areas, they are that wiry. Literally feels like a bottle brush coming out of my chin!On my wedding day I was worried I would have to hide a razor on me, sneak into the bathroom, shave, and reapply my chin makeup, it was SO bad. After two weeks of using this product at level 5 on my face, 3-4 times a week, I have been able to shave in the morning before treatment and not had to shave again until the next afternoon. TWO WEEKS and an issue I’ve dealt with for 15 years is improved. Even just having to shave only once a day instead of morning and night is a Godsend, but the idea that I could possibly one day have to shave less than that is incredible. I attached a picture so you could see what shade I am, and what shade my discolored chin is. The fact that the laser can tell the difference between my hair and my hyper-pigmented skin is incredible to me considering professionals turned me away when my chin wasn’t as dark. I took a chance on this device because it looked like my skin shade on my face was the absolute darkest it’s approved to be used on or a little darker.I have had laser treatments on a tattoo in the past and the person performing the treatments warned me on brown skin, discoloration can occur making your skin lighter or darker. For me it was worth the risk because I already had such significant discoloration, and it bothered me way less than the hair, which just made me feel like less of a woman. I have not noticed any color change one way or another from this laser, but I am taking pictures to see if there is a change and I will update this review if I notice anything since I know that is important to others.Bottom line: This device is easy to use, especially for small areas. I’m sure it will work on large areas as well, but it will certainly take some time. I originally was displeased with the tiny window because I think it will take my legs a looooong time to get done, but the window is exactly the right size for my upper lip and chin, so I think any bigger would not work. I don’t think the pain is too bad at power level 5, but I have not gone past this due to my skin tone. The fact that I have to shave HALF to a THIRD as often after only 6 uses is just insane.I say if you’re thinking about it, just do it! Especially if you’re just on the border of the “recommended skin tones” on the chart. I love, love, love this device and want to try it on my husband’s back hair soon! One million stars if I could. Thank you thank you thank you for helping me feel more like a woman again.

It’s a great solution for 1st world problems lolWe got a new bed and we couldn’t change the position of the tv, and the angle was causing neck pain and discomfort. I initially thought the glasses were gimmicky and wouldn’t work that well, but I was proven wrong! I can watch tv or read a book in bed without straining my neck! I’ve noticed my posture feels better b/c I’m no longer hunched over or in a weird position. Wearing them feels like I’m using a VR headset.Cons: my eyes do feel tired more quickly, so I’m unsure if I will get used to it or will atop using them b/c of this. They are also slightly too heavy, and are a little uncomfortable on my nose. They have left marks on my nose when I wear them for a little while.

I have not tested it for a long time but you may initially feel a bit uncomfortable due to the middle of the glasses having a barrier between your eyes, so whatever you are looking at you will feel like each of your eyes are looking through binoculars with a division in between. You will however have "no blind spot" in the middle and your mind will stitch both images together giving you a full picture.The discomfort: Imagine if you had your hand in a karate chop position, now put that in between your two eyes. You will still see everything in front of you and the hand itself will not cause a blind spot but you will feel discomfort by the fact that the hand is in the middle of the two images. I do not know if will cause eye strain for other people but it caused me a little bit, perhaps it just takes some getting used to so I will not knock the product down much for it.For the manufacturer, it would be interesting if you guys produce a version where the eyes are not separated so the middle barrier/division is not present. (basically like a jordie laforge style)great concept, very good execution. perhaps version 2 will be perfect?

I have fibromyalgia with near-constant back and neck pain, so I frequently lay down while working on my laptop at home. These have been such a *huge* help! Typing is tricky since the glasses kind of throw off my equilibrium a bit, but it’s still possible, and as long as what I’m doing is mostly reading and using the mouse, they’re wonderful. My husband tried to play Call of Duty with them out of curiosity, and the only problem was the equilibrium issue; he could see the TV just fine from the couch, he just couldn’t get the hang of playing in that position. In other words, looking through them is nearly identical to how you would normally see, just slightly smaller. The only “con” to these, if it’s bad enough to even be considered a con, is that the upper part of the glasses rests snugly across the forehead, so they leave a pretty deep indentation on my forehead after I take them off (not at all painful), and when I get too warm they can fog up. But that’s the only “issue” I can come up with. They’re really great!

Was quite skeptical...I needed something for bed room tv as it sits at the front of my bed on a dresser. I would get neck strains and arm pains. would move around alot to get a good view of the tv.Until now...I lay flat on my back with a perfect view with these glasses. Nice and sturdy ...well built...awesome fit with regular seeing glasses.I'm very happy I bought these..I actually fell asleep faster and with them on hahaha. That's how comfortable they are.

This is a bit heavy on the bridge of the nose. I expected that based on the reviews. I went ahead and purchased and am so glad I did. I have severe endometriosis bd get intense abdominal pain. It is great to enjoy laying down and putting zero pressure on the abdomen yet being able to watch programs and read. Highly recommend and wish I had it back after I had surgery
brilliant, just what i needed
Purchased these for my husband and he loves them! He loves the fit and the quality for the price.

I assumed that these were a joke when I first saw them. When I received them I realized that the joke was on me... because they actually work.These are a comfortable set of glasses with blacked out lenses. Mounted to the center of each is a large glass (I assume it's glass... they're heavy) prism. It's the prism, and the way it's been cut that allows you to see horizontally.Don't misunderstand... these will never be mistaken for some sort of "spy" eyewear. They're way too obvious. In fact, if people see you wearing these they'll immediately assume you're suffering from some dire handicap, and and are likely to offer to buy you a meal.I can wear these and look straight ahead, and still read what is in front of me on the table, in in my hands. These eliminate the need to crane your neck forward.I tried laying on the bed and on the couch, and reading with the book centered on my chest. Perfect!I even laid flat on the floor and read, with nothing propping up my head. Amazing.It's obvious to me that these would be perfect if you were to go to the beach (hopefully, a deserted beach) and laid flat on your towel, reading. In the case where you're on a normal beach with people around, expect lots of stares and giggling.Additionally, I can wear my reading glasses under these. It's still comfortable.So, any negatives? Yes, there is one. Because the prisms are glass and heavy, they make the glasses front-heavy. So if you're say, sitting at the table with them on, reading straight down, they are trying to pull away from your face. It's likely that's why they seem to imply that they're designed for laying down to read, for which they are, excellent.I really like these, but trust me, I won't be wearing them in the bleachers at the next Astros game.Very clever idea that actually works very well.
You’ll look crazy, but you’ll also be comfy, so it’s a win.

I loved the original version but these are even better. The view is clear and does not make objects appear smaller and further away. I prefer the way these prism lens are sturdier and solid, have no framing issues, are easier to clean, and do not stick out as much which allow them to fit in a sunglass case. I use them every night when I lay down to read my kindle before bed and the comfy weight on my face also helps me fall asleep, as the original did. I have also used them to watch TV from bed and also while leaning back in my desk chair. I have gotten so used to wearing them that I very much dislike the eye muscle strain I feel when reading or watching something and I have to tilt my head or eyes.Edit: I use both the older version and this one depending on my mood for Kindle or phone light glare. This version of lazy glasses allows the light from your phone to be visible below the lens so if you are unfocused you may get distracted by the light visible below the lens. The original version with the black frames blocks this light so you only see through the lenses. I keep them both on my bedside table.

A must for "tech neck," sitting with your neck craned while using your phone or reading a book is terrible for your posture and causes your neck to move forward over time exacerbating the issue until your neck and shoulder muscles are in constantly pain. I've used a denneroll that was prescribed by my chiropractor in the past and while it helps, it forces to to stare at the ceiling for extended periods or hold a book/device directly over your face to keep you occupied (I don't know if any of you have dropped a phone on your face while doing this but it's not fun).With this I can use the denne roll and watch something that's playing on a TV or resting on my chest. Even better I've found these glasses can replace the use of a denne roll and I can instead stare at the ceiling while watching TV or other tasks from the couch and have my neck in the relaxed position.In addition it allows me to multitask throughout the day by having a book resting in my lap while at my computer, I can look through the lenses to read or write what's in my lap and then look over the top of my glasses like you would bifocals and be able to read and use my computer screens.Now, I would caution walking around the house with them on (I have on occasion but it takes some getting used to walking while staring at your feet and tilting your head from side to side while doing this can be very disorienting.I like this design over others that I have tried specifically because you can see over the top of the glasses by having them rest a little lower on your nose. The picture is still clear and it's easy to use. Very much recommend for those suffering from a pain in the neck or stiff trapezius muscles relating to posture.
Perfect!

I had older pair that were +1.75 from 8+ years ago and they have never fallen out of my flat lens sunglasses. Eyes changed and purchased the +2.50. These stick on bifocals work on lenses with minimal curvature and great on flat lenses. Very clear on my flat lens sunglasses. So keep that in mind.That's probably why when I purchased 8+ years ago from Grainger they were listed with the safety goggles which have flat lens. After cataract surgery I needed sunglasses with readers. Already had three pair of plain Maui Jim sunglasses and wasn’t looking forward to buying all new Maui Jim’s w’readers. Found these lenses by accident and thought for this price I’d try them. They install easily and the vision is better than expected. Main concern was they were a bit large, but the directions said they could be trimmed. Positioned the lenses where I wanted them, used an ultra fine point sharpie to mark the area sticking out below the lens and then slowly trimmed them with sharp small scissors. Worked like a charm and didn’t hamper the vision a bit. Like the idea of being able to switch lens power for reading, driving, etc. In a perfect world they could be a bit thinner, but that’s not as much of an issue after they’re cut down. Hope they sell a lot of these for a long time so they’ll be available down the road if needed.

I wasn't super optimistic given the many mixed reviews I've seen about whether these actually stick to your mask and make it through multiple mask defogging rinses.I followed the best directions I found on the web (not the packaging) to a tee - wash out the mask carefully with toothpaste/brush, rinse mask well & dry completely, soak the stick-on lenses in warm water, apply them to the inside bottom corners with the convex side pointing up/away from the mask lens (concave side down), press firmly in place and blot off any residual moisture, press firmly again, let dry overnight.I followed this procedure the day before I went diving in Thailand last December, and they stayed on just fine through defogging and mask clearing. Two dives that day, then three dives a few days later and they were still going strong. Worked perfectly! Could see my computer/guages and camera settings clearly, and marine life in the distance perfectly. Can see how it would be great for snorkeling masks as well. Made my diving experience perfect!

They were easy to apply and they stayed in position. I even cut some down across the top as they were a hair too big for some glasses. I have used these for years and you can reapply them in other glasses. They absolutely work as bifocals.
These are GREAT, you can lay down in bed & still watch tv or use ur phone. For someone who is bed ridden or just lazy lol, this is Great & a Fun Gift as well.

At 80 years old I was diagnosed with macular degeneration but since I like to read and do artwork, I have been using these clip-on glasses for many years. W/o them I cannot see. I have several pairs to keep where I need them and they work great. I am happy with this purchase.

I wasn't sure about ordering these to use on my very expensive glasses. I was afraid that I might scratch my lenses but they absolutely do not! There is a spring clip that you press open and position theses glasses over your regular lenses. All the parts that touch your lenses are covered in plastic or rubber. They stay in place and don't slip around. It is very easy to flip the lenses up when you don't need them. I am using them to read music on a music stand. My regular glasses are progressive bi-focals but the bi-focal is positioned at the bottom of the lenses and I can't use them unless it point my nose up to the ceiling. These clip-ons provide the additional magnification just where I need it. I have also used them for doing detailed craft, sewing and bead work.

I find these days the glasses they make (progressive type) are great for distance, but your reading area is not magnified like with the older bifocals and the reading spot can be so small you have to move your head back and forth because you can't move your eyes.These clip on glasses fix all that! They offered me magnification I needed and a larger reading area when worn over my glasses. You need to buy the right number for you. Ask your doctor. 2.00 was what my doc said I needed over my glasses and it works perfectly. (You could probably also go to a store that sells reading glasses in the pharmacy area and try some on over your glasses to figure out what lets you read.)

These clipon readers are perfect! The lens are excellent quality, just like prescription eyeglasses. The clips have rubber covers which prevent scratching your eyeglasses. The clip is strong and keeps the readers firmly in place even if you are moving around. The readers flip up when you don’t need them and still stay firmly attached and the clipping mechanism is small and doesn’t impede your line of sight. The readers come with a soft, good quality case. These are the best quality clipon readers I have ever used. They fit over my very thick prescription lenses.

They fit well and they are amazing in their ability to give me the sight I need. I have one eye that has been done for long distance and the other for reading. These help with the reading. They fit and seem sturdy. Loved getting three pairs at once so I have leave them ind different places.

Man... even my prescription reading glasses suck. This is the bomb! It actually makes it CLEAR with no aberrations. I have a bad eye due to some surgery and it refracted all over the place, and regular reading glasses barely help focus it back, but this thing totally does it :) AND, it is SHARPER with full power focus and clarity than anything I've ever put on my eyes. Amazing! Takes a bit of getting used to, but it somehow works for my close and intermediate distances (I've had cornea thinned out due to a ton of Lasik, PRK, etc.) and thus sometimes even need reading glasses to see in the distance, strangely enough. The bridge of the nose fits perfectly, too, it doesn't need those weird nose bridge devices. And it doesn't stain the glasses (especially the upper) like regular glass-made prescriptions or off-the-shelf readers. Simply amazing!

They actually do work. 3 pair for $10, wow. I keep one pair next to my computer and another on the kitchen counter where I read my mail. I would use my prescription glasses if reading a long text or a book, but for the convenience of a pair here and there for simple tasks, these are perfect. I gave the third pair to a friend who had stopped by and I asked her to read a short piece. I said 'try these'. She was impressed.By the way they are very comfortable and are quite sturdy.

These glasses are closer to pair of magnifying glasses than everyday glasses (or they are for me... I don't wear glasses). If working on very small things (modeling, electronics, etc.) they are excellent, well priced, and come in multiple pairs. Brilliant product.
These light specs are awesome, been using them for over 10yrs. they serve my purpose.
I bought these for my husband. The price from Amazon was the best. They are so high at Walgreens. My husband love them! He uses them while working on machines for his job!

Husband loves these glasses and uses them all the time. Especially good in low light. Shipper sent the wrong strength the first time but corrected it and shipped the right pair immediately--5 star customer service!
Needed these for lighting and vision

Fast shipping. Product works as described, very satisfied. My previous more expensive glasses which were a As Seen ON TV item had two bright LEDS as this one does, however, worked on one switch so when the battery died you had to wait for the charge to complete before using it again, this new one has 2 switches so when working with one light and the battery drains you can simply switch on the other light to complete the task, besides that the more expensive unit failed within a week, garbage, and not only did the battery fail the left support broke and now just dangles on the wire. Very satisfied with the new pair, feels durable.
I really liked how the glasses put out a lot of light to cover the reading area.
Great item; thus far, I like it.
Had cataract surgery and only needed glasses for computer. Works better than prescription glasses I had before. I have three pairs.

I'd watch your local drug store for buy one get one or buy one get one for half. Other than that the price is pretty much the same as my drug store. They look good on and come in a few colors. They put up with a bit of abuse but like most readers they lenses are prone to popping out and once they do you need new ones.
I have the standard frame type for years, needed a new pair. So when I saw the Ironman version, I jumped at it. Glad I didLightweight, pliable, flexible and perfect viewing range.

These are the second pair my husband has ordered, due to the size (for wider) faces, and the lightweight nature of the material. Stays in place very well, and a modern design make them a perfect option for reading glasses!

Because my lenses include correction for slight misalignment (cockeye), to read music scores on a stand I need low-power readers large enough to wear over my prescription glasses. These work perfectly for that purpose.

Got some prescription readers -- very expensive. They work only in a band just in front of your eyes, which means your head has to be in a certain relationship to the material. This is a problem -- I often lay down in bed with my computer on my chest, which made it hard to get to the proper angle. These glasses look good and can be used at any angle. Much better for me. The only downside is that if you want to shift your gaze to distance you have to take them off, can't simply look over the prescription area.
I've been wearing them since receipt of same. The nose pads are screw attached and can be changed to softer feel nose pads. Not brass therefore no green corrosion to be removed.
Very nice for working at the computer.
Very light on the face and nose bridge! I had the gold before. I bought the gun metal this time .I get compliments on the glasses!
I like them. They work good as cheaters, and they look nice.
